description: Territory Development Executive - Direct Sales - EstancosGalaxy Connect is a distributor in the rapidly growing market for e-cigarettes and vaping products in Spain. Leader in the vaping sector in England with consumer products in more than 30,000 points of sale. We offer a permanent contract and an excellent opportunity to join our fast-growing team. We are looking for Territory Development Executive in Tarragona province that is highly motivated to grow and develop the area. This job is carried out by visiting points of sale and promoting the Company's products in Estancos, Expedidurias de Tabaco and Tiendas de Vapeo.Main responsibilities:Manage assigned territory and be a point of contact for the launch of products and commercial campaigns. Open new accounts. Provide and replenish product sales to existing accounts.Promote and expose the brand to pre-qualified or totally new points of sale in order to develop new business opportunities.Open new accounts and sales channels within the territory. Motivate businesses to locate products at key points for greater returns and sales.Create a strong professional commercial link with the distribution network and assigned territory. Support newcomers and provide support.Notify and work in collaboration with the administrative hierarchy of the company.Management of stock and merchandise at the points of sale through the Company's online systems. Replenish stock directly from the van in stores.Proper handling of the vehicle and the company's work tools.Follow the rules and procedures using the reporting and administration systems. Have a clear follow-up of the sales results and reports.Maintain a high level of knowledge of products and services, as well as market trends and competition. Money management and bank deposits.Working hours determined by store opening hours (estimated 40 hours per week)Attend training sessions and training sessions. Hold telematic commercial meetings with the commercial team and with management.The ideal candidate:Native fluency level in Spanish or Catalan and a proficient level in EnglishA competitive spirit and a passion for sales.Solid track record in the sales and stock management sector.An attitude focused on objectives and results.A firm and self-paced work style with clear signs of leadership.Attention to detail and sales report. Excellent money and deposit management.Professional image and attitude with the ability to interact with large accounts.Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills.Advanced understanding of computer science and office tools.Full and clean driver's license.Motivation to visit accounts and develop long-term customer relationships.We offer:We offer: An attractive basic salary up to € 20,000 per year (depending on experience) + € 5000 Commission in remuneration according to the objectives and OTE. Promotion opportunities, in-house training, a company van, and all the sales equipment and literature needed to run the job function

Desde MODIS consultora GLOBAL especializada en IT y perteneciente al Grupo Adecco, seleccionamos un perfil de Business Intelligence con nivel de inglés intermedio para el departamento de BI en Madrid.Experiencia requerida Tecnologías de Analytics/BITerraform, DWH, SQL, Python, Lambda Functions, API/SFTP, ETL (aws glue, SSIS)Integración de aplicaciones Procesos de automatización Déjanos tu contacto y te contamos más sobre el proyecto! ¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS? -Retribución flexible: seguro médico, cheque restaurante, formación en idiomas, Club Adecco con ventajas y descuentos en diferentes empresas.-Plan de acogida y seguimiento del coordinador. ¡TE ESTAMOS ESPERANDO!

description: ¿CUANTAS OFERTAS HAS LEÍDO HOY Y NO TE OFRECEN LO QUE ESTÁS BUSCANDO?En @INETUM Madrid estamos buscando profesionales con pasión.Si lo que quieres es trabajar en un empleo que te aporte un reto tecnológico, ampliar tus conocimientos e integrarte en un área especializada, este es tu sitio.Queremos ampliar nuestro equipo con perfiles cualificados del mundo de la Energía para incorporación en plantilla en proyectos de larga duración.¿Eres tú uno de ellos? ¡¡Esta es tu oportunidad!! ¿QUÉ FORMACIÓN NECESITAS?Buscamos profesionales con titulación universitaria (preferiblemente en disciplinas técnicas como Ingeniería Superior Industrial, Informática, de Telecomunicación Grado o similar).Todas las certificaciones técnicas son valorables, por favor, no dudes en incluirlas en tu perfil si cuentas con ellas.Si no posees esta formación, pero si experiencia en el puesto, no te preocupes, valoraremos tus conocimientos.¿QUÉ EXPERIENCIA Y CONOCIMIENTOS DEBES TENER?Buscamos sumar al equipo profesionales con un mínimo de 5 años de experiencia laboral y al menos 3 años trabajando en el área de Sanidad.Necesitamos sumar al equipo profesionales que conozcan y tengan experiencia en:• Los circuitos de un hospital y servicios de Atención Primaria• Soluciones de mercado: HIS, Historia Clínica y departamentales• Arquitectura de sistemas de información• Estándares de integración: HL7Entre sus funciones estarán:• Desarrollo de negocio de las líneas de sanidad: estudio de soluciones del mercado y de la competencia.• Soporte a la red comercial.• Confección y realización de presentaciones y demostraciones de soluciones TICS en instituciones sanitarias.• Análisis de los concursos públicos y confección de ofertas de valor para iniciativas públicas y privadas.• Apoyo técnico y funcional para el desarrollo de productos.• Participa en los proyectos dando apoyo al jefe de proyecto y al equipo de proyecto en las prescripciones funcionales y técnicas.¿CUALES SERÁN TUS FUNCIONES?Entre sus funciones estará la toma de requisitos técnicos y funcionales de las necesidades de los clientes; apoyar al equipo comercial en el diseño de propuestas de la oferta de servicios de INETUM; obtención de información estratégica del mercado para ser competitivos en las ofertas presentadas a los clientes; posicionar técnicamente los servicios de nuestra empresa; gestionar la oferta de consultoría energética.OTRAS HABILIDADES A DESTACAR QUE DEBES CONOCER.La persona seleccionada debe tener una alta capacidad para establecer relaciones a largo plazo, entendiendo las necesidades de los clientes y transformarlas en propuestas de servicios de valor agregado.Además, deberás ser capaz de generar confianza en las altas capas organizativas de los clientes debatiendo en profundidad los aspectos de negocio y técnicos de los proyectos.La persona seleccionada debe contar con alta capacidad de entendimiento de las soluciones y servicios más pruebas la correcta resolución de las incidencias o la adecuación de las soluciones propuesta a un evolutivo.• Monitorización y seguimiento de los cambios, así como el impacto en la usabilidad y rendimiento para los usuarios.• Análisis, coordinación, y comunicación del impacto del cambio.• Ayudar y orientar en la capacitación de los usuarios en las herramientas y cambios aplicados sobre las mismas.• Fomentar la máxima interacción y comunicación en toda la organización que facilite la orientación a la mejora continua de las soluciones, así como la búsqueda de la excelencia.Experiencia demostrable en el área de gestión de incidencias o mantenimiento de soluciones de negocio en entornos industriales y de distribución comercial de gran volumen de referencias.• Dotes de comunicación.• description: KingEclient is a digital business consultancy focused in web/app services for International clients.We are part of the WPP International Group, if you are passionate about Digital services and Human Resources we invite you to consider our new job offer! KingEclient is looking for a HR Admin and Payroll Specialist to join our Barcelona team! How would we describe the role?﻿Manage, improve and scale various administrative processes, such as onboarding and offboarding (contracts, social security, relocation, etc.) with a labor consultancy as a partners and maintain an up-to-date employee database. Responsible for communicating with the appropriate authorities (Hacienda, Social Security, INE,...) either directly or through our external partner Process new hires, terminations, transfers, promotions, leave of absence and existing employee changes related to payroll. Prepare and review employees’ compensation by the end of each month. Manage benefits and perks of personal Income Tax (IRPF) for employees. Be a resource for KingEclient people on company policies, practices, and regulations, as well as assuring continuous compliance with Spanish labor laws and regulations. Be the go-to person for employee inquiries related to people processes, well-being, or administrative questions. Collaborate with the Talent Acquisition Specialist in building strong talent pipelines across the organization. Propose, develop and implement company policies and procedures according to Labor Law standards and our Company Values. Use people metrics to identify areas for development and improvement, and propose initiatives. Be the responsible of the prevention Trainings and the promotion of the prevention measures. What are the requirements for this role? Strong desire to work in an digital business, international environment and a track record demonstrating the following skills: More than 2 years of experience as a Human Resources Administrator. Bachelor's degree in Labour Relations or RRHH Pack Office (Excel) Knowledge of Spanish labor laws and regulations: Updated of labor law, social security and local regulations. Excellent level of English and Spanish both written and spoken. Excellent corporate communication, time management and coordination skills. Able to work independently and proactively. Previous digital startup experience or consultancy. Discretion, reliability and a careful working method are a matter of course for you. You are characterized by resilience, flexibility, and customer orientation. *Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in Europe. KingEclient does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status for this employment position. About your soft skills You are passionate about the Internet and everything that surrounds it You like to defend your work to clients You are very good at teamwork You consider yourself responsible Proactivity defines you You accept constructive criticism, and you use it to improve You are willing to give a hand to those who need About your values You consider yourself a respectful and tolerant person You fix yourself clear goals and do anything to achieve them You are a responsible, assertive, and keen person What we offer Full time job – Hybrid model (Office and Telework) Flexible hours and remote work culture Permanent contract for 1 year and possibilities to extend to a long term contract Personal and professional growth Young and cool work environment Wage according to the profile Gympass business membership Friday intensive working day Summer intensive working days (July,August,mid September) New and dynamic office in Santaló street (Barcelona) COVID-19 precautions in our Office:Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsFever control,sanitisation, disinfection or cleaning procedures in placeWe are proud to have an international team that acknowledges a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. At KingEclient, we celebrate diversity and difference, and we are strongly committed to building an inclusive environment for all our employees.

description: We are looking for a Junior Account Manager for our Source Tagging Solutions Division, helped retailers, CPG companies and packagers efficiently apply RF EAS safely both within and on packaging. Within checkpoint business area, we address the protection of the retails products with RF Labels o RF Tags from at the vendors production line. The Candidate will be the link between the Retail and Checkpoint protection program. Reporting to the Sales Manager Source Tagging, she/he will in charge to discover opportunities, develop business case, follow directly with the retailers the projects timeline and coordinate all the needed activities linked to the Source Tagging. This position will focus on growing the existing business handling the existing customers and on the new customer growth. Core Objectives Maintain and develop existing and new customers through appropriate propositions and ethical sales methods. Work closely with sales and sales management team to understand strategic initiatives. In store Audits in order to check if the solution are working correctly. Provide technical and product support to the sales team. Monitor and report on market and competitor activities and providing relevant reports and information. Develop business case for new solutions and/or pilots. Communicate, liaise, and negotiate internally and externally using appropriate methods to facilitate the development of profitable business and sustainable relationships. Attending and presenting at external customer meetings and internal meetings with other company functions necessary to perform duties and aid business development. Achieve/exceed 100% of assigned of her/his assigned quota. Prepare very accurate forecasts. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree in Economics or similar. 2 years of sales experience (selling products/services) better if in multinational companies. Fluent English is a must. Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities  Hunter mentality, ability to grow and win business. Excellent negotiator who permanently seeks for win-win opportunities. Skilled in communicating effectively with all levels of management on complex business issues. The ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, set priorities, and adapt quickly in a changing environment; someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment. The ability to research and identify problems, develop proposals, conduct analysis independently and in collaboration with others. Willing to travel to all regions of Spain. Analytical and creative skills Residence in Madrid area. If you have the skills we are looking for and want to participate in the selection process, please send us your detailed CV to recursos.humanos@checkpt.com All your information will be kept confidential according to GDPR guidelines.

KMINA® es una marca creada en 2016 por un equipo emprendedor de ingenieros y profesionales de la salud con el objetivo de mejorar la movilidad y la vida diaria de las personas desarrollando, fabricando y distribuyendo las soluciones ortopédicas y sanitarias que demanda la sociedad.Actualmente, vendemos en más de 20 países seguimos creciendo y trabajando duro para cumplir con nuestro compromiso que no es otro que tratar de hacer la vida más fácil a nuestros clientes.Nuestro canal de venta principal es Amazon a través de sus distintos marketplaces y modalidades, pero también vendemos a través distribuidores offline y a través de otros marketplaces.Buscamos incorporar una persona al Departamento de Marketing para incorporarla a nuestro equipo, ¿te gustan los retos?Funciones del puesto:Tareas relacionadas con e-commerce en varios mercados europeos.Análisis SEO/SEM.Diseño y creación de catálogo online/offline a través de programas Adobe.Comunicación y coordinación con el CMO para realizar seguimiento de las tareas llevadas a cabo.Qué pedimos:Grado en Marketing, Marketing Digital, Publicidad o similar (puesto perfil JUNIOR).Conocimiento o nociones de SEO/SEM.Manejo de herramientas de diseño, edición y maquetación (Photoshop, Indesign e Illustrator). Se realizará prueba.Vehículo propio para acceder al puesto de trabajo en Alacuás, Valencia (España).Idioma: inglés nivel (se realizará prueba).Ganas de aprender y mejorar cada día, cultura del esfuerzo y espíritu emprendedor para crecer junto al equipo.Se valorará positivamente el conocimiento de fotografía, vídeo y edición de ambas.Se valorará positivamente el conocimiento de otro idioma.Ofrecemos:Salario: 15.000€ Bruto/año (con revisiones periódicas).Flexibilidad horaria.Contrato jornada completa.Si crees que reúnes las condiciones, no lo dudes... ¡Te estamos esperando! #WalkTheFuture

description: ¿Te gustaría trabajar como Subdirector/a de Clínica Dental?Hazlo realidad incorporándote a nuestro equipo y forma parte de una de las empresas de salud y bienestar más innovadoras. En una de las mejores localizaciones de la ciudad de Marbella (Málaga), ocupando la posición de Subdirección de clínica dental. Desde Sanitas te ofrecemos la posibilidad de desarrollar tu carrera profesional en un entorno dinámico, innovador, comprometido con la salud, no solo de nuestros clientes, si no también de nuestros empleados.Si tienes alma de manager, te apasiona la dirección comercial y la gestión de personas, tienes una estupenda oportunidad dentro de nuestro equipo. ¿Cual es tu role?Dentro de nuestro equipo podrás...Colaborar en la supervisión de la calidad de servicio prestada por los profesionales.Colaborar en la implantación de nuevos procedimientos y protocolos para optimizar los procesos.Realizar la entrega de los presupuestos de tratamientos a los pacientes, asegurándose de que le paciente queda correctamente informado sobre los tratamientos, plazos e importes.Participar en la elaboración e implantación del plan comercial de la clínica, proponiendo acciones correctoras ante las desviaciones detectadas, siendo parte activa en la presentación de presupuestos, seguimiento de los mismos, recall, ventas de seguros dentales, y en general de todos los procesos comerciales del centro.Colaborar en la identificación de situaciones críticas (estacionalidad, horarios, etc.), gestionando adecuadamente los mismos para un correcto funcionamiento del centro.Recibir y atender a los pacientes, acompañándole en su recorrido por la clínica.Asesorar e informar al paciente antes y durante el tratamiento.Elaborar cuadros de seguimiento y de actividad comercial.Asesorar al paciente sobre las opciones de financiación y gestión de las solicitudes.Gestionar las citas para la realización de tratamientos.Realizar seguimiento de los clientes y de los presupuestos entregados pero no realizados.Realizar e impulsar acciones de fidelización con los clientes para fomentar las visitas.Realizar acciones de captación de nuevos clientes.Gestionar horas y periodos valle del Centro.Realizar y/o colaborar con otras tareas requeridas por la Clínica.Requisitos - Titulación universitaria, preferible rama económica financiera. - Experiencia valorable de 2 años en dirección de negocio, realizando labor comercial.  - Valorable formación sector sanitario bucodental.- Valorable Nivel alto de inglés (B2) y muy valorable nivel medio alto de catalán. - Ofimática nivel avanzado. - Nuestro candidat@ ideal es una persona proactiva, con habilidad de negociación y gran orientación comercial, orientación al paciente. Valorable experiencia en gestión de equipos.
industry: Sanidad, bienestar y ejercicio

description: POR QUÉ NOS VAS A ENCANTAR  En IKEA consideramos que todas las personas tienen un talento que ofrecer. Buscamos personas que empaticen con los clientes, compartan nuestros valores y estén dispuestos a probar nuevos retos. Si todos te piden consejos sobre cómo decorar tu hogar y siempre estas dispuesto a ofrecerles nuevas soluciones, trae tu talento a VENTAS.   QUÉ HARÁS DÍA A DÍA  - Proporcionar a los clientes la oportunidad de comprar su cocina IKEA, elaborándolas un diseño acorde a sus necesidades.- Proponer a los clientes soluciones creativas en su día a día.- Ofrecer todos los servicios disponibles en la tienda para ayudar a los clientes en su decisión de compra y así propiciarles la mejor experiencia de compra.- Asesorar al equipo para optimizar la relación con nuestros clientes para impulsar el crecimiento de las ventas y mantener la rentabilidad a largo plazo.- Valorable experiencia en diseño/planificación de cocinas.- Alto interés por la decoración del hogar.- Manejo de herramientas informáticas de planificación y Microsoft Office (Excel,etc)- Valorable conocimientos en Ventas y surtido.- Persona orientada al cliente, mentalidad de servicio.- Altas aptitudes comerciales, capacidad de comunicación con los diferentes tipos de clientes y dirigir las ventas cubriendo sus necesidades. Capacidad organización, gestión y multitarea.- Visión espacial para planificar espacios.- Persona responsable, dinámica, actitud abierta, flexible y muy resolutiva.   NUESTRO EQUIPO EN IKEA  Desde IKEA tenemos el compromiso de hacer un mejor día a día para la mayoría de las personas. Todos los colaboradores/as de IKEA disfrutan de un amplio paquete de beneficios que están a tu disposición desde el primer día, aquí te contamos alguno de ellos: Ofrecemos un salario competitivo distribuido en 12 pagas anuales más 2 pagas extras en los meses de julio y diciembre, con un amplio abanico de horarios en jornada continua con los descansos que establece la ley, respetando tú tiempo libre fuera de IKEA.  Para que disfrutes al máximo de tus descansos, en nuestro comedor de empleados puedes encontrar gran variedad de productos a precios muy económicos, subvencionados en 2/3 por IKEA.  Porque la confianza de trabajar en un lugar seguro es la base para nuestro crecimiento personal y profesional, en IKEA contamos con un servicio médico a tu disposición para cualquier consulta. Además de ofrecer un entorno de trabajo seguro para garantizar unas buenas condiciones de trabajo.  Te ofrecemos el 15% de descuento en todas tus compras.  Porque formas parte de la gran familia IKEA queremos compartir contigo los momentos importantes, por ello celebramos aniversarios, fiestas, Teams Buildings, la llegada del verano, regalo de Navidad. ¡Siempre hay un motivo para sonreír!   Muchos más te están esperando, ¡descúbrelos!
industry: Venta al por menor

description: Start Date: 12th JulyWe are looking for German Speaking Associates to join our project team, supporting our clients on interesting projects around the world. In 2021 we expect to grow significantly, seeing our revenues increase by 300%, and we need ambitious people to help us. The role is great for people who enjoy learning, communicating, and building relationships and those who want to propel their career through hard work, early responsibilities, and teamwork. Based in the heart of Barcelona, you will be working with people from around Europe. We are looking for people we want to work with, who bring something different to the company and will help drive us forward.CompanyArbolus is changing the way businesses learn and retain knowledgeWe believe experience is worth sharing, so we set out to help people with experience share their experience easily with businesses. Today, Arbolus is the first platform that helps businesses build and work with networks of experts, advisors, and freelance consultants. Our product has been a big hit with global consulting firms (e.g. the big four) and Fortune 500 companies who use third parties to inform their business strategy. Based in London, we are a venture-backed scale-up with offices in Barcelona (our largest) and New York.RoleProject Associates help their clients build micro-networks around specific projectsProject Associates work with clients to help them build teams of experts and advisors around specific projects. This includes helping them use our platform’s tools to source their own experts as well as engaging experts on their behalf. The role involves:Understanding what your users are trying to achieveResearching their problemIdentifying people who can help with their problemEngaging those people and onboarding them onto the platformSupporting the customer and expert to build strong relationshipsOver time, the role evolves into user management and later an account management position as you build up stronger relationships with your clients. It can be challenging, at times reasonably demanding but also very rewarding from a learning and financial perspective.BenefitsArbolus is a high growth company that wants to reward people for their hard work and contributionCompetitive base-pay + bonusInternational exposureInfluence on the future of ArbolusGreat team & strong office culture2x annual retreats and regular socialsWork from home daysMacbook + moreWhat We’re Looking ForWe want to work with people who inspire usStrong academic background0-2 years experienceA proven entrepreneurial/commercial driveGreat communication skillsHigh emotional intelligenceAbility to challenge the status quoWe like to work with people who are:CuriousOutgoingHigh energyTake initiativeDriven

eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest European e-commerce businesses. Under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo – it offers the best deals in flights, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for the more than 18 million customers it serves worldwide. With a presence in 46 countries, the company has a team of over 1,200 professionals (www.edreamsodigeo.com). Travel is the largest e-commerce segment in the world and eDreams ODIGEO is at the heart of it.Over the last years, the company has truly transformed and is now known to be a real innovator in the travel industry. For example eDreams ODIGEO is the first travel company in the world to launch a subscription programme, like Amazon Prime or Spotify or Netflix in other industries. In addition, the company has industry leading customer satisfaction, high product quality and positive trends on revenue margins and stock price. In fact eDreams ODIGEO was the best performing stock worldwide in travel for the previous 5 years just prior to the outbreak of COVID-19, beating Expedia, Booking Holdings, Tripadvisor, Ctrip and all others. Looking towards the future the company is also looking for M&A targets to expand geographically and product/capabilities, all which offer also professional growth opportunities. More recently, eDreams ODIGEO has been one of the most resilient travel companies in the current COVID context: unlike most other travel companies, it has kept all its staff and invested in product development for the post-COVID recovery. eDreams had gained share during the COVID crisis and will emerge as an even stronger competitor.We are now looking for a Business Analyst for Prime, our subscription program. Prime is a truly innovative product and service. eDreams ODIGEO is the first company in the world to come up with a subscription programme for travel. It is still in its early days and yet has had huge success. It is the world’s largest travel discount program, the company’s top strategic initiative and one of the most transformative products in the travel industry.Key responsibilities:Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the database from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: “Contribute to the Prime strategic roadmap with numbers”Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we include more “benefits” into the program? what is the profitability of a free-trial? contribute to the Prime strategic roadmap with numbersCreate dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal dataContribute to the delivery of the Prime strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and Marketing in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side Desired Skills and Experience:Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.), 2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical componentStrong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; R programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valuedAdvanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivityA self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!Business Proficiency in EnglishWhat do we offer?Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote. A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.Free subscription to O'Reilly Online Learning.Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand!… And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun, and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!﻿Come fly with us and join us now.eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands – eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo –is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

description: Company Vision & MissionCobee is an employee benefits company that is using new technologies to disrupt the big market of employee compensation.All our efforts are focused on becoming the most desirable solution for employees to get compensated at work, making them financially healthier and more engaged with their companies.We are a young company made of a very professional and talented workforce. We think BIG and we have a clear international mission to assist all types of companies worldwide in streamlining and enhancing the total compensation of their employees.Company CultureThere are three core values that we all share in our way of working:1)  Employees first: we strongly believe that making employees FEEL DELIGHTED is our key to success, looking both internally (to our employees) and externally (to our client's employees). We take that into account in every action and decision. 2)  Owner ownership: we all know what our duties are, we work with full ownership towards our goals and we know how those affect the overall company goals. We are autonomous and we care A LOT about the quality of our own work.3)  ISpossible ambition: our business offering did not exist before. We constantly challenge the status quo because we are a set of thinkers who think that improvement IS always POSSIBLE. Who would not like to work for a company whose main value is to make employees happy? ;)What are we looking for?As per our new challenge in the Portugal market, we are looking for a Business Development Representative Junior for the Portugal Market as one of the key roles to get to our success going forward.The ideal candidate will cultivate relationships with prospective clients in order to catalyze business development success. He/she will also be responsible for maintaining contracts and performing other tasks needed to ensure customer satisfaction at all times. See below how to get involved in the adventure! Requirements: You are Portuguese.1 year of experience in similar positions.You demonstrate great communication and presentation skills in spoken and written Portuguese as well as in English (as our official language). Spanish will be a plus.The candidate must have proven strong in Sales competencies.Excellent organization skills to manage pipeline, calls, clients, leads, proposals and make relations with prospects.Excellent communication and teamwork skills.Experience working with Salesforce.Having a strong experience in working with CRM, Indicators, and DashboardsKnowledge of SaaS products and services will be a plus.Structured and always eager to improve the way you work What you will be responsible forBe the first contact point with the prospects to identify the opportunity.Manage daily activity into the CRM.Design cadences to improve the approach with prospects.Apply Sales Intelligence to know all about our clients.Working closely with the AEs involved to exceed their sales quota by identifying and qualifying opportunities with the best fit for Cobee and the client.Close meetings with the DM.What can you expect﻿Extraordinary projection (great opportunity to develop a career)Cobee Benefits (health insurance, transportation, learning, nursery)Offices located in the center of lovely MadridHealthy working culture in a young and talented atmosphereCoolest place to work!

internacional Randstad, número 1 en RRHH en el mundo, ofreciendo oportunidades con las principales multinacionales de diferentes sectores en compañías líderes en sector banca, finanzas, telco, seguros, media, farma, educación, Ibex 35, en proyectos de desarrollo de consultoría y agile, donde entendemos que en un entorno tecnológico, el talento de las personas es lo que va a marcar la diferencia y por ello te estamos buscando!¿Cuáles serian las funciones?Análisis:- Tratar bien con problemas ambiguos / indefinidos; capacidad de pensar de forma abstracta.- Fomentar la comunicación entre todos los miembros del equipo/roles para facilitar el análisis y favorecer un entendimiento común de los requerimientos.Diseño de pruebas:- Gran capacidad para diseñar casos de prueba utilizando el lenguaje del negocio.- Gran conocimiento de la cobertura de las pruebas y de los datos de las pruebas y de cómo obtener y variar ambos en función de la estrategia y el alcance de las pruebas.Defectos:- Enfoque de la prevención de defectos.- Experiencia en la gestión de defectos (informes, seguimiento, etc.).Automatización:Habilidades de programación /automatización en lenguaje Javascript (preferido).Experiencia con pruebas de front-end y automatización.Experiencia con pruebas de back-end y automatización.Experiencia con Git.Otras habilidades importantes- Capacidad para ser mentor y compartir conocimientos con otros miembros del equipo.-Habilidades como presentación de informes, la comunicación, la colaboración, etc.Horario flexible, 100%teletrabajoCompetencias necesarias:Al menos 3 o 4 años de experiencia como QA.Interesante al menos 2 años en AutomatizaciónHabilidades de programación/automatización en lenguaje JavascriptExperiencia con el lenguaje Gherkin para el diseño de casos de prueba.Experiencia con metodologías ágiles de desarrollo de software.Buena familiaridad con bases de datos SQL y NoSQL (preferiblemente MongoDB).Estar familiarizado con las herramientas de pruebas de rendimiento.Inglés: B2Requisitos deseadosCertificado en pruebas de software (ISTQB Foundation, Certified Agile Tester).A qué esperas para formar parte de nuestra gran familia Randstad?Aquí encontrarás motivos para ello:CONCILIACIÓN, Sabemos que tu vida personal es tan importante como la profesional por eso podrás disfrutar de 23 días de vacaciones y en la mayoría de nuestros proyectos tendrás un horario flexible.COMPROMISO, Incorporación a empresa en continuo crecimiento que apuesta por las nuevas tecnologías.ACOMPAÑAMIENTO, Tendrás un referente de Randstad Technologies cerca de ti en todo momento.CONDICIONES contractuales competitivas: Plan de retribución flexible (ticket restaurante y cheques guardería) + Club de ventajas Randstad.SALARIO COMPETITIVO acorde a tu experiencia profesional.Podrás acceder a un amplio catálogo de cursos IT que acompañarán a tu crecimiento profesional.PLAN TRÁETE UN AMIGO, Si nos ayudas a incrementar el equipo, te premiaremos con una compensación económica.Se garantiza la confidencialidad en el proceso de selección.¿Tienes ganas y te ves preparado para asumir un nuevo reto como el nuestro?Te estamos esperando!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3uMvAzQIdyU&feature=youtu.be

description: En Eyna Softeam buscamos poder incorporar a nuestro equipo de proyectos ERP a un Consultor Senior con experiencia mínima de 3-5 años en Dynamics NAV.Como requisitos que debería cumplir:Capacidad técnica demostrada en implantaciones de NAV i/o Business Central (lenguajes C/AL y AL).Experiencia funcional, especialmente en proyectos de SCM (distribución y fabricación) y en módulo financiero.Capaz de realizar análisis de requerimientos con clientes.Conocimientos de inglés a nivel conversacional técnico.Conocimientos de SQL y VStudio y valorable Power Plarform.Si consideras que tienes estos conocimientos y además eres una buena persona, con la cabeza bien amueblada, pensamiento lógico, capaz de soportar entornos de clientes con presión, buen trato con los mismos, proactivo, responsable, resolutivo, trabajador y capaz de trabajar y gestionar equipo, eres quien estamos buscando!Eyna Softeam es una empresa joven, moderna, tecnológica y con una equilibrada mezcla de profesionales con más de 20 años de experiencia y jóvenes cualificados con ideas nuevas.Somos expertos en proyectos Microsoft de Dynamics NAV y Business Central, donde nos gusta demostrar nuestra capacidad analítica para ajustar y customizar la implantación del cliente.Nuestra filosofía es construir una relación sólida con el cliente, fundada en la confianza que otorga la fiabilidad y honestidad de nuestro trabajo.Cuidamos a nuestros empleados, ayudando a su gestión del tiempo y fomentando el teletrabajo, y su progreso profesional.

La misión del puesto es el desarrollo de alianzas con las entidades del sector privado a favor de los proyectos de Cruz Roja Española en Andalucía, así como fomentar el compromiso económico de las mismas a largo plazo, contribuyendo a asegurar el cumplimiento de los objetivos de captación de fondos de la organización.FUNCIONESEstablecer, mantener y ampliar las relaciones con el tejido empresarial de la Comunidad Autónoma de Andalucía, con el fin de contribuir al cumplimiento de los objetivos relativos a ingresos y lograr acciones positivas a favor de los proyectos de Cruz Roja Española en Andalucía.Participar en la búsqueda activa de nuevas alianzas estratégicas, así como en la propuesta y desarrollo de nuevas vías de colaboración con empresas, mediante campañas, proyectos o iniciativas de captación de fondos y de responsabilidad social corporativa.Realizar propuestas de alto valor añadido y desarrollar iniciativas encaminadas a la fidelización y desarrollo de las alianzas, con el fin de lograr su compromiso a largo plazo con la organización.Diseñar un plan de trabajo con las empresas del sector privado andaluz con propuestas adaptadas al tamaño y dimensión de las mismas.Organizar, coordinar y apoyar el trabajo con las empresas desarrollado por los equipos referentes de Cruz Roja en las 8 provincias andaluzas.Realizar la evaluación, reporte y seguimiento de las actividades y proyectos desarrollados, y elaborar los informes de resultados, seguimiento e impacto correspondientes.Participar en foros, grupos de trabajo y aquellos ámbitos encomendados por su responsable, ante cualquier organismo, institución o aliado, público o privado.Realizar propuestas de mejora e innovación desde su visión, experiencia y conocimientos, con el fin de optimizar los servicios y recursos objeto de su competencia.REQUISITOSTitulación universitaria en ADE, Marketing, Publicidad o Comunicación.Experiencia demostrada de al menos 3 años en desarrollo de nuevo negocio, identificación de nuevas oportunidades para el establecimiento de alianzas, concepción y ejecución de campañas y captación de fondos.Formación y/o experiencia en el desarrollo de líneas de trabajo bajo el marco de la Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.Experiencia en la elaboración de propuestas, negociación, e implementación de planes con aliados corporativos.Alta competencia relacional y de negociación, así como alta capacidad de comunicación.Iniciativa y autonomía.Habilidades comerciales.Capacidad de planificación y gestión organizativa y de proyectos.Conocimientos avanzados y experiencia en el manejo de herramientas ofimáticas y digitales.Nivel alto de inglés, hablado y escrito.Disponibilidad para viajar por la región de Andalucía.VALORABLEExperiencia en organizaciones del Tercer Sector, así como Fundaciones o departamentos de RSC de empresas del sector privado.Formación de Master o Postgrado.Formación específica en técnicas de negociación.Carnet de conducir y disponibilidad de vehículo.Referencias.CONDICIONESIncorporación: inmediata.Jornada completa.Categoría profesional: Grupo 1 - nivel 2 del Convenio Colectivo de la Oficina Autonómica de Cruz Roja Española en Andalucía.Como empresa EFR Cruz Roja facilita las medidas necesarias para la conciliación de la vida profesional personal y de sus colaboradores y colaboradoras.

SOBRE DERMATOLOGIA INTEGRAL GIRONADermatologia Integral Girona es un centro médico privado de dermatología situado en el centro de Girona. Liderado por la Dra. Maria Damont, médico-dermatóloga con más de 40 años de experiencia en el diagnóstico y tratamiento de la piel, cabello, uñas y ETS.Nuestra misión es ofrecer al paciente todo lo que necesita para el cuidado de la piel en un único centro. Queremos ser el centro de referencia para el paciente, ofreciendo la experiencia del equipo y la atención personalizada.Nuestros valores son confianza, escucha activa, empatía, profesionalidad y formalidadSOBRE LA POSICIÓNNos gustaría incorporar un médico-dermatólog@ con el objetivo de complementar nuestro equipo médicoSOBRE TISi estás buscando avanzar en tu futura carrera profesional y aprender de la experiencia y conocimiento del centro, necesitamos:Grado en Medicina y especialización en DermatologíaAutónom@Colegiación obligatoria y homologación (si procede)Persona con empatía y con ganas de un proyecto de futuro¿QUÉ TE OFRECEMOS?Horarios a convenirSalario a convenir

Company DescriptionSnow Software help organizations to optimize software availability, compliance and cost savings through delivery of Software Asset Management solutions. With our solutions we are helping over 4500 organization worldwide, with over 11 million devices. We are top-positioned in the Leaders Quadrant of the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Software Asset Management solutions.Job DescriptionDeveloping and executing sales strategies and plans in order to achieve sales targetsGenerating 20-30 direct customer meetings and workshops (2nd meetings) per month through different sourcesAttracting relevant stakeholders for workshops, engineer customer in group format, help create basis for customer business caseDemonstrating and clearly differentiating the product from the competition focusing on our clear and compelling value propositionDriving new product salesForecasting and delivering against substantial revenue targets and achieve the assigned sales volumeIdentifying new business opportunities and follow-up the defined business opportunitiesWorking with our partners in order to maintain and expand Snow’s business within assigned customer accountsWorking with global and local Marketing and Business Development teams to drive lead generation and awarenessSupporting channel planning process and forecasting for assigned territoryDocumenting plans, activities and opportunities accurately in the CRM systemQualificationsTo be successful in the role as Enterprise Account Executive you have to be sales-driven and a fast moving person with a strong customer focus. You are passionate about creating a value for your customers, which ultimately leads to profitable business for both. To identify the right decision makers and influencers as well as the courage to ask the right questions is critical to your success. We see that you have excellent Communication skills - you know what to say and more importantly, how to say it. You believe in what we’re doing and won’t stop at anything to deliver on your goals. You are best at what you do and you know how to get the best out of your colleagues.10+ years’ of sales experience, of which 5 years involved a complex solution sales process Proven track record of success driving revenue through discovering, prospecting and creating new businessExperience in System Management and IT InfrastructureStrong knowledge of MS Office and CRM applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)Specific work experience in the SAM software market is desirable not essentialExperience selling to companies with over 10,000 employeesAbility to travel 50% of the timeAdditional InformationThis is a chance for you to join a challenging and inspiring environment where you will have the possibility to make a daily impact. Every day you will work alongside helpful and down-to-earth colleagues who are dedicated and ambitious. Together we create an innovative environment that drives Snow forward. If you are the right person for the role you will be part of a fantastic journey in a dynamic, high-growth business.Snow Software is an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are always committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Discrimination is not welcome on the basis of any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we work.SalesSnow SoftwareSpain

Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.Job Description Summary:The Market PMM Intern will work on both merchant and consumer needs to gain a working knowledge of both sides of the business. They will be in charge of supporting local Market PMM in their daily activities from getting a deep understanding of customers needs and used payment products as well as understanding the competition to enhance our users local experiences.Job Description:Our teamThe Global Product Marketing team [PMM] is setup to drive product commercial success in partnership with Marketing, Global Product and Sales teams. PMM’s accomplish this by deeply understanding and consistently championing the needs of the customer as a representative voice in all discussions and decisions, ensuring product and feature releases solve tangible customer pain points.The Market PMM role is responsible for building a deep understanding of the market, competitive landscape, regulatory environment and financial services system as well as local culture & interaction with PayPal’s products & services across all customer segments. It connects the dots between Market, Global Marketing, Product and Sales teams at a local level to ensure accurate definition and prioritization of product and feature releases, improvements and bug fixes. While being aligned to specific geographies, Market PMMs are also responsible to collaborate across markets that serve each of our customer segments in the identification of opportunities for business growth.Key ResponsibilitiesDaily activities are broken out into Inbound work and Outbound workFrom an inbound perspective (60% Time allocation), the Market PMM continually defines the most important customer needs and opportunities. The Market PMM intern will collaborate on the following activities:Interacting with the following teams; Sales, Marketing, User Experience Research, Market research & Customer SupportModerating or observing focus groups & 1:1 interviews with customersStaying on top of and using competitor products in the MarketStaying on top of Market insights & trendUltimately Market PMMs create a clear understanding of opportunities across product and segment in their market to allow prioritization at the global level. They will be able to help answer priority customer questions and requests with the local business, providing deep expertise about our products.From an outbound perspective (40% Time allocation), the Market PMM performs the in-market activities to ensure successful Pilot testing and Product feedback. The Market PMM intern will support local Go to Market Strategy across sales, marketing & functions at country level and ensures local understanding of global product delivery. They will constantly evaluate end to end journeys to identify optimization opportunities end local experience enhancement.Key RequirementsEnergetic and positive, hungry to learn and challenge, creative, reliable, results focused with a can-do attitudeInterested in the operational, marketing, product and financial aspects of businesses in generalStrong in analytics and problem solving. Experienced/comfortable with data mining and analytical toolsGreat communication skills and ability to work and collaborate cross-functionally with external and internal teams including Product, Marketing, Sales, LegalHighly organized, attention to detail and follow-through. Should enjoy problem solving, fixing processesExcellent written, verbal, and presentation skills. Proficiency in MS Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and excellent in MS ExcelTo Be Considered You MustCurrently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree in engineering, business, marketing, economics or data science at leading University, or equivalent.English and Spanish fluencyOther European languages are advantageous.Be available for an 6-month internship starting as soon as possible.We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.REQ ID R0072301

Someone who comes from the agency, is to work managing paid media channelsSupport the development and execution of paid social actions to achieve conversion of IE undergraduate and graduate programs.Trade with your analytical mindset to plan and execute paid social campaign performance and reporting across multiple platforms.Ability to monitor, analyze, and find ways to optimize conversion rates and paid social media metrics, strategies, and tactics to achieve business goals.Work and analyze data to define custom reports to drill down into performance and analyze results for improvementsRequirements2-3 years of experience working on high performance paid social campaigns, paid media specialist or similar roll.Knowledge and experience and campaign management on the different social platforms: Linkedin, Facebook / Instragram, Twitter, Tik-Tok, etc,Person with a strong data-driven approach is a plus - data should be at the center of every decision you makeMust be passionate about social media including organic social and content.Good communication skills, analytical and teamworking mindset.Be self-motivated, highly inquisitive, confident, energetic and creative.Fluent Spanish and EnglishBenefitsSalary 21-24K

description: Actualmente seleccionamos, para incorporación en uno de nuestros principales clientes, un CONSULTOR POSVENTA.Nuestro cliente es una empresa líder en el sector de la CONSULTORIA en el sector de la automoción, con presencia tanto a nivel nacional como internacional.Buscamos incorporar un Técnico, con titulación de Grado Superior en mecánica o automoción, con experiencia en departamento de posventa en concesionario, como consultor posventa en automoción, departamento posventa de fabricante, recepción activa de taller y/o gestión de recambios.¿Qué haré?Desarrollarás tu carrera profesional en el ámbito de la consultoría, integrándote en el departamento de Marketing Posventa en uno de los principales fabricantes de automóviles. Analizaras e Impulsarás mejoras en el área postventa para lograr un incremento en la facturación y en la rentabilidad del negocio. Trabajarás también en aquellos procesos que aseguran la satisfacción de los clientes y mejoran los indicadores de gestión de los concesionarios y talleres.¿Qué te ofrecemos?Incorporación a compañía líder en su sector.Grandes posibilidades de desarrollo y aprendizaje, excelente ambiente de trabajo; la persona seleccionada entrará a formar parte de un equipo creativo y comprometido con el trabajo.Grandes posibilidades de proyección profesional.Jornada laboral completa. Horario de L a J, de 9-18 y V de 9 a 14,30hFlexibilidad horaria.Trabajo presencial –posibilidad teletrabajo-Contrato: Obra y servicio, proyecto de 3 años de duración con posibilidad de incorporación indefinida pasado este periodo de tiempo.Coche de empresa.Incorporación: JunioUbicación del puesto: Barcelona.REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:Técnico Superior en mecánica o Automoción.Mínimo 2 años de experiencia en departamento de posventa en concesionario, como consultor posventa, en departamento posventa de fabricante, recepción activa de taller y/o gestión de recambios.Conocimientos y experiencia en la actividad de posventa de un concesionario, en especial Recepción activa de taller, gestión de recambios,…Conocimientos de herramientas de Business Intelligence: Power BI, Tableau,..Disponibilidad para desplazamientos nacionales.Inglés, Nivel medio-alto.Buscamos una persona con:Facilidad para las relaciones interpersonales.Autónoma, proactiva y organizada.Capacidad de tomar decisiones e identificar y solucionar problemas.Pasión, Motivación, con ganas de aprender, persona positiva.

description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location for this position from the following: Madrid, Spain; Warsaw, PolandMinimum qualifications: Experience in strategic partnerships, business development, and stakeholder management. Experience influencing internal and external stakeholders across all levels of management. Experience building relationships. Experience working with startups.  Operations and project management experience. Preferred qualifications: Experience in an international partner management or operations management role. Deep knowledge about entrepreneurship, or network experience in the startup sector. Entrepreneurial spirit, ability to operate successfully with ambiguity. Strong desire to be a thought partner to product teams to activate product vision. Proven track record as a strategic thought-leader at a large global technology company, VC, incubator, or technology startup in business development, partnerships, product management, general management, or sales. Passion for entrepreneurship with an ability to speak the language of users.  About The JobGoogle for Startups (GfS) works to empower startups worldwide through a combination of programs, partnerships and Google products. We work closely with organizations, local tech hubs from Accra to Zurich, as well as accelerators and diversity-focused groups. We also run a network of physical spaces called Campuses, where startup founders come to learn, connect, and build companies that will change the world.You will cover EMEA, driving impact in the startup ecosystems. In this role you will work closely with the GfS regional lead to drive the partner engagement strategy in EMEA. By partnering with the local offices and with local organizations, you will also execute the local strategy toward startups by providing the programs and resources available within GfS (brand, partnerships, programs, network of experts) to founders in the region.You will work cross-functionally across local teams and manage the network of partners (accelerators, tech hubs, VCs) in the region. You will be responsible for day-to-day communication with partners in order to ensure we're delivering value to startups and founders in each hub. For non-GfS markets, you will ensure our brand footprint via the execution of programs or initiatives in alignment with our main key performance indicators (impact to startups, Google’s business, brand, and reputation).Responsibilities Manage day-to-day relationships with Google for Startups partners, both external (e.g. accelerators, tech hubs) and internal (other Google teams in non-GfS Campus markets). Work with GfS partner program lead and regional leads to drive partner engagement strategy. Be the GfS liaison for country offices that want to begin Google for Startups programming in their cities by providing playbooks, programs, brand usage, and oversight. Ensure the success of their strategy towards startups and the alignment with our core KPIs. Conduct operational tasks for partners in your portfolio including contracts, purchase orders, and invoices working with Legal and Strategy & Operations leads.  Ensure data collection from partner programs is in compliance with privacy and personal identifiable information rules.  Source and value potential partnerships, perform due diligence on partners, leading through execution including annual partner evaluations, and off-boarding conversations.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

description: Job SummaryThe Red Hat Consulting team is looking for a Cloud Native Architect with an OpenShift Infrastructure focus to join us in the Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. In this role, you will promote the adoption of Red Hat's solutions at our key enterprise accounts, government agencies, and service provider partners. You'll lead small to medium-sized project teams and ensure the quality of customer deliverables for one or more projects. You will apply well-developed consulting, business, and process expertise in your quality work, as well as actively coach and mentor others while building good customer relationships. You'll earn the trust and confidence of our customers' engineering, development, and operations teams by matching their requirements and use cases with the functional capabilities of our solutions. As a Cloud Native Architect, you will serve as a customer advocate within Red Hat to deliver the right solutions and to ensure that these solutions are implemented and supported in a creative and reliable way. The role can be based in any of our EMEA offices with access to a major airport. Successful applicants must reside in a country where Red Hat is registered to do business.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesDesign automated, containerised cloud application platform solutions with a focus on application containerisation, including cloud-ready distributed application architectures, migrating workloads to containers, containerised development workflows, and integrating container platforms with automated continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) pipelinesLearn new technologies quickly, including topics like container orchestration, container registries, container build strategies, and microservices on container platformsAssist in presales discovery and solutions blueprint developmentPresent, discuss, shape, and influence customer architectural design decisions and roadmap with external and internal stakeholdersPlay a technical governance role in project deliveryCollaborate with Support and Engineering teams to ensure customer success and effectively manage technical riskTravel in the future to work alongside leading financial services, retail, telecommunication, and institutional customers, in line with Red Hat's COVID guidelinesRequired SkillsExperience designing complex customer solutions in a rapidly evolving technological fieldPrior experience working in a enterprise architect or a consultant role related to the delivery of infrastructure solutionsPrior experience focused on cloud environments and their supporting infrastructures, in particular the microservices architectureSolid operational and management experience with hybrid platformsBackground in customer engagement with either a major consulting services organization or within a services division of a major software companyProven record of working in a strategic advisory capacity to senior IT and business executivesBroad experience across technologies like Red Hat OpenShift, Red Hat Virtualization, and Red Hat Ansible Automation PlatformExperience with CI and CD processes and development of pipelinesWorking knowledge of cloud architectures Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) and their supporting infrastructuresExcellent written and verbal communication skills in English, including experience presenting to senior business and technology leadersWillingness to travel up to 50%, following Red Hat’s COVID-19 guidelinesAbout Red HatRed Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

description: Job Purpose:  As a member of Tech Data‘s European headquarters, the Consultant European Profit Management operates across a wide variety of front-office disciplines helping country and central operations systematically achieve significant and sustainable gains in profitability through superior margin management, both, at product and customer level, to meet Corporate goals.You will provide support to drive tangible profit improvements by prioritizing, transforming, standardizing and optimizing Tech Data’s pricing and Trade Margin management strategy, methodologies, tools and processes across our European operations. This implies improving the performance of major gross profit/Trade margin components that include Front End Margin, Backend Margin, Net Freight, Customer Rebates and Forex gains and losses. You will interact with country management teams, executing and coordinating assigned activities to ensure that goals or objectives of business units are accomplished within prescribed time frame and funding parameters.Responsibilities:  Assume accountability for the delivery, implementation and impact of advanced standard methodologies, tools and processes aimed at providing sustainable results for major Trade Margin components such us Front End Margin, Back End Margin, Net Freight and Customer Rebates.Collaborate with key members of local and central organizations and the European Profit Management community to provide strategic, analytical and implementation support in order to address potential risks and opportunities in the area of Trade Margin.Monitor country results to identify major deviations from defined profitability plans, prioritizing immediate remediation measures and driving the implementation of the required levers jointly with local teams.Support the European Profit Management Community that shares ideas and best practices, driving further harmonization and standardization across the region.Participate in the definition of functional specs of IT innovations related to profit management improvement opportunities liaising with TDIT and in-country business users to define priority and rollout strategy.Act as a key role model to the organization demonstrating the highest adherence to the corporation’s key values of Integrity & Respect, Passion for Winning, Leadership, Ownership and Partnership.Actively oversee the company’s operating policies and practices and ensures these meet and exceed where possible, all corporate requirements.Perform other duties as assigned by the Director, European Profit Management. Experience, Skills, and/or Abilities Required:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the experience, skill and/or ability required.Over 2-3 years working experience in a relevant discipline, ideally management consultancy or operations.Graduate degree required / preference given to those candidates possessing MBA.Fluent in English (other languages a benefit), exceptional verbal, written and communication skills.Willingness to work in a multi-cultural and multi-skilled team.Advanced analytical and fact based decision making.Previous experience implementing large projects (ideally business operations related) or effectively partnering with country organizations. Proficiency with Microsoft Excel; SAP knowledge is a plus.Experience in relationship building and facilitation skills with business partners; influence without authority; comfortable interacting with senior management.Strength in dealing with senior executives and peers to successfully implement change.Exceptional verbal and written communication and interpersonal skillsAble to operate effectively and constructively in a multi-task environment under stress and pressure.Able to define and achieve clear individual, team and company prioritiesPositive “can-do” attitude consistently able to deliver above expectationsExtensive root cause diagnosis and problem solving skillsAn ability to stimulate others to change and absorb new ideasStrong motivators and ability to work effectively in teams and aloneRemain professional and perform above expectations in high stress situations consistently Working Conditions: Normal, professional office environment Cultural Competency Requirements: Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds. Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

description: Consultoría de dirección especializada en Excelencia Operacional y métodos de gestión avanzada, que ayuda a mejorar la competitividad de las empresas, precisa incorporar para sus oficinas en Madrid:RESPONSABLE LEAN MANUFACTURINGEstamos buscando a un profesional experto en Lean Manufacturing para que se incorpore y desarrolle una carrera profesional en una consolidada Consultoría especializada en la mejora de la competitividad de sus clientes. Una vez adaptado a la metodología y best practices de la compañía se responsabilizará de compartir y transmitir conocimientos y experiencia a las empresas que precisan de sus servicios de consultoría Lean.Se incorporará a la oficina que la compañía tiene en la zona centro de España y se ocupará de las siguientes responsabilidades: · Ejecutará y desarrollará íntegramente proyectos de consultoría (nacionales e internacionales) para la mejora de la competitividad, mejora de procesos y direccionamiento estratégico en el ámbito operacional. · Los proyectos son básicamente de ámbito nacional y algún proyecto internacional.· Contribuir al desarrollo del negocio, generando relaciones de confianza con el cliente.· Potenciación y desarrollo del negocio en la Zona Madrid/ Centro.  Requisitos del perfil: Formación: Ingeniería Industrial Superior. Se valorarán estudios de Postgrado, así como sólidos conocimientos de técnicas de gestión avanzada. Debe aportar sólida experiencia en técnicas Lean Manufacturing y Kaizen, para la mejora de operaciones.Experiencia: Mínimo entre 5 y 10 años, como Director de Producción, como Responsable de Lean Manufactoring o como Consultor de Gestión en entorno de Lean Manufacturing. Carrera profesional coherente y consistente. Habituado al trato y relación con cliente.Idiomas: Imprescindible buen nivel del inglés y castellano.Informática: Buenos conocimientos a nivel de usuario.Retribución: Retribución a convenir (fijo más variable).Otras condiciones: Disponibilidad para viajar nacional e internacionalmente en un alto porcentaje. Vehículo propio. Para cubrir este puesto los candidatos preseleccionados deben reunir los siguientes requisitos:· Voluntad de transmisión de conocimiento, enseñar a otros a hacer mejor los procesos en el ámbito industrial.· Compromiso con la compañía.· Comunicar ideas por escrito y verbalmente con precisión y claridad, de manera convincente.· Rigor en los planteamientos, capacidad de análisis y de síntesis.· Calidad en la ejecución y atención al detalle.· Organizado y planificado.· Destreza en la aplicación de técnicas “Lean Management” y otras de gestión avanzada.· Capacidad de trabajo y gestión de múltiples proyectos.· Competencias comerciales (desarrollo de negocio)· Curiosidad e inquietud intelectual para el aprendizaje.· Entablar y desarrollar relaciones de confianza.· Orientación de servicio al cliente.· Identificar y dar respuesta a oportunidades comerciales.

including topics around certification and complianceExperience in DevOps will be an added advantageProgramming experience in a higher-level language such as NodeJS, Ruby, Chef, Puppet, YAML, JSON or Python will be advantageousGood understanding and expertise of tools such as Ansible, Terraform, CI/CD (Jenkins, GitHub, etc.)Deep understanding of API based security & compliance standardsGood understanding of Unix/Linux and Windows operating systems and scriptingDemonstrable experience with AWS and/or Microsoft Azure or GCP installation, configuration, and administration of security features and servicesExperience with cloud networking models and connectivity, network security, virtualization, and cloud computingExperience working with customers, positioning, demonstrating, configuring, and fixing network infrastructure security productsStrong communication and presentation skillsStrong problem finding and solving skills, ability to analyze complex multivariate problems networking security spaceExperience understanding exploits, malware, ransomware, and etc.: their creation and activationAdditional InformationThe TeamAs part of our Systems Engineering team, you’ll You will play a key role in navigating complex territory accounts in order to generate and deliver winning proposals, contract bids, statements of work, and RFI/RFP responses. It is business critical to meet and exceed sales quotas by building and implementing strategic account plans targeting enterprise-wide deployments of the Palo Alto Networks Next-Generation Security Platform.Your ImpactEstablish yourself as a trusted advisor to prospects and customers working with your Account Manager and the local partners within your territoryIdentify and document specific problems with prospective and current customers which can be solved through the deployment of integrated solutionsArchitect and propose validated solutions which address the identified cybersecurity problems in each unrivaled environmentEnsure ongoing customer happiness, support, and adoptionContinuous self-improvement and learning to maintain technical leadership of applicable technologies (data center, SDN, public cloud, security, networking, etc.)Understand and effectively differentiate against our top competitorsAct as the customer advocate for any issues that require technical assistance and follow up with the customer until the issue is resolvedQualificationsYour Experience5+ years of experience as a successful Pre-Sales Systems Engineer, systems integrator, or equivalent experienceBS in Computer Science or equivalentWorking knowledge of Palo Alto Networks products, with a focus on Next-Generation Firewall and some comparative technologies; Continuous technical developmentExperience with systems installation, configuration and administration of routers/switches, UNIX/Linux, and Windows-based systemsExperience that emphasizes L2-L4 Networks (L2 switching architectures including Spanning Tree, IP routing that includes OSPF and BGP, and L4 Load balancing)Understand and effectively present our security platform to technical and non-technical audiencesStrong analytical skills to evaluate complex multivariate problems and find a systematic approach to gain a quick resolution, often under duressMature and effective time-management skillsPrior experience selling network infrastructure-based security appliances, including but not limited to: Firewalls, SSL/IPSec VPNs, Security Proxies and CachesFamiliarity working with Channel partners and understanding of a channel-centric market approachPrevious work in the enterprise networking security spaceExperience and knowledge of modern network threats and malware, network forensics, automation tools and technologies, and endpoint security technologiesSignificant industry certifications (SANS, CISSP, CCIE, etc)Additional InformationThe TeamAs part of our Systems Engineering team, you’ll support the sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our systems engineer team, you are driven by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.Our CommitmentWe’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at [email protected].Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
