description: We are looking for a Sales Consultant who will engage with our prospective clients that are most innovative high-tech-high-impact start-ups and Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Europe and USA and evaluate their financial needs in order to offer the services provided by the company.To join the team You have to possess a genuine interest in technology and business, be highly analytical and articulate, and have a strong command of English. You must be a team player, well organized and also keen to take on responsibility. Key qualities include being able to demonstrate an entrepreneurial mind-set, being highly self-motivated, and have a high degree of stamina to work within an ambitious and goal-driven environment.As Sales Consultant You will contact prospect clients from all over the world by email, phone calls or Skype calls. You will oversee all the activities from the consulting client's profile and needs, service promotion, preparation of commercial offers, and dealing / handling documents on behalf of the clients. Since the work environment is international, the language used in a written and oral form in English, in which You should prove fluency. Any other language is not critical but considered a plus. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESClient consulting: Identify clients who are eligible for the Grant Schemes we work in.Client Acquisition: Oversee the process of signing clients and become a strategic partner in their seek for public fundraising.Key Account Management: Interacting directly with C-Level clients and help the process work smoothly.Coordination with Project Management: Perform a successful handover to the Project Consultants.Customer Relationship Management: Act as a go-to point of contact in order to solve contingencies and striving towards excellence in service.JOB REQUIREMENTSBachelor's DegreeFluent English comprehension, oral and writtenExperience in sales/business development is highly desirableSOUGHT CHARACTERISTICSMultidisciplinaryProactiveProblem-solving attitudeFast learningPresentable appearanceWell-organizedProblem-solvingLateral ThinkingFlexibility/ AdaptabilityGood communication skillsResults orientationEnergy ManagementREMUNERATIONSalary + Productivity bonus (linked to the achievement of milestones related to the success rate of conversion of a prospect to a client) CAREER DEVELOPMENTTo highly motivated and ambitious individuals Alien Technology Transfer can offer fast career progression. Further career steps will successively lead to higher responsibility in team leadership and management. During the first 3 months, the senior company managers will provide all the necessary professional training. Once the Funding Consultants becomes completely autonomous, s/he directly takes charge of administrative duties and management of different activities within the teams.HOW TO APPLYPlease apply directly through LinkedIn, with CV in English in the attachment.Please note: Due to the high volume of candidates we are unfortunately not able to provide individual feedback regarding the outcome of every single application.

Job summaryWorking as part of the Global Applications, Technical Readiness & Transition team supporting the delivery and the on-going run of the Global Digital Ecosystem (GDE) product for GRM. The GDE Release & Environment Manager (REM) will support delivery and operational teams in ensuring proper release planning and execution of capability deployments across non-production and production environments.Collaborates with Release Train Engineers, Scrum Masters, Product Owners, Technical Delivery Leads, Software Developers and Quality Assurance along all phases of the delivery life cycle, ensuring the operation of a robust environment management and release/deployment capability for GDE.Job Responsibilities:  The GDE Release & Environment Manager (REM) will own the end-to-end release management lifecycle including the scheduling, coordination, and management of releases across the programme. GDE comprises multiple technology assets that include core GDE components and components consumed under SAAS or managed service offerings. Releases under management of the REM will include full end-of-sprint code releases and more frequent isolated releases deploying on a Blue/Green basis. The REM will be responsible for implementing and managing release processes through development, testing and production environments, working collaboratively with all participants in software development and maintenance. The REM responsibility will also extend to environment management within the GDE programme. This role will be accountable for managing both non-production and production environments, defining and implementing an environment management & control framework and supporting delivery and operational teams in the effective use of GDE environments within the defined control framework.Operating as part of the Global Applications team the REM will work with local Release Management teams in the GRM markets where GDE is deployed. Specific Responsibilities of the role:Definition and implementation of a Release & Environment management strategy and related processes including the establishment of a Release & Environment management control frameworkEnd-to-end ownership and oversight of Release & Environment management processes, to include branching strategiesPlanning of release schedules in collaboration with Release Train Engineers and market Release Management teamsManagement of relationships and coordination of work across delivery and operational teams in a global, multi-market, common code-base contextMeasuring and monitoring progress to ensure releases are delivered on time and to a high level of quality – ensuring that all release related SLA’s are metCommunication of release plans and outcomes to business and technology stakeholdersConducting release readiness reviews and go/no-go checkpoints ahead of release deploymentAssessment, management, and follow-up of risk acceptances as part of the release management life-cycle – working with delivery teams to assess readiness of code for deployment to productionKey contributor to release reporting – informing weekly and monthly operational delivery reportsLead and co-ordinate deployment execution for GDE releases in conjunction with market Release Management teamsDevelopment and implementation of environment management strategy including gating process and acceptance criteria for use by teams when promoting code through environmentsDefinition and implementation of required environmental management practices including test data management in non-prod environmentsContinuous improvement of Release & Environment Management process effectiveness – including definition and implementation of automation strategiesKey requirements for this Senior Technology role include:Strong ITIL knowledge, with particular focus on Release & Environment ManagementIn-depth knowledge and experience of Cloud Engineering practices, specifically relating to applications hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS)Experience with CI/CD and optimizing code delivery through automation and/or process reengineering – including relevant experience as a Software Engineer, Solution Architect or Systems AdministratorExperience in defining and implementing branching strategies to support multiple team deliveriesAdvanced knowledge of Agile methodologies with proven ability to influence behaviors to adopt agile best practices within delivery and operational teamsExperience working with the JAVA Angular / React technologiesAdvanced knowledge of software delivery lifecycle under a scaled agile delivery modelDemonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional teams toward task completionUnderstanding of environmental cost levers to lead environmental rationalization and optimization effortsDemonstrated effective leadership and analytical skillsProven track record in influencing and negotiating across diverse group of stakeholdersOther requirements / considerations:Qualifications/experience: Bachelors` degree in relevant field (Information Systems, Computer Science, etc.) or equivalent experience (8-10 years’ experience in information systems operations environment in systems administration or development roles)Language: English is a requirement. Spanish and/or Portuguese language capability would also be a distinct advantageLocation: Liberty Mutual locations in EuropeMobility: Potential for limited travel – up to 10% (incl. international)

Join an innovative, fast growing chemical company! Synthesia Technology is long-established international leader in the manufacture and marketing of chemical products, polyesters and polyurethane systems for thermal/acoustic insulation and for many other industries. We are part of the multinational company Kingspan. We are currently looking for a Transport Manager to join our team. Job purpose:  The Supply Chain Team is composed of Internal Logistic, Transport and Planning sub-teams. In the transport team, we are looking for an experienced International Transport Manager to help us build and professionalize the logistic area supporting the growth of the business .For our Worldwide market, you will define the best transport strategy and take over the partnership with transportation companies. Your work will have a considerable impact on Synthesia Technology Europe growth and  you will participate in the creation and improvements of the distribution chains across the company. As  Transport Manager, you will be the responsible for  carrier negotiations and contracts for all the means of transport. The key drivers of the position are: · Safety in  operarions and environmental respect.· Customer service level improvement.· Cost reduction Job Description/Key Accountabilities: · Define Outbound Transport Strategy.· Define Transport Purchasing Strategy.· Lead Tender, business negotiations & pricing· Lead carrier contract creation· Fix best in-class standards for carrier contracts (SLAs, processes, risk management, latest cut- off…)· Define operational, tactical and strategic dashboard with key metrics· Propose and implement continuous improvement projects in partnership with our internal logistic and planning teams.· Lead win/win projects with our carrier  portfolio.· Optimize our transport cost thanks to cost reduction projects.· Coordinate IT developments with the tech team for new features implementation.· Identify and implement innovative and sustainable solutions to offer the best customer experience in the market.· Stay up-to-date with transport market innovation. Candidate Profile: This is a challenging role that requires the candidate to show ownership and  enthusiasm, professionalism  towards operations and business in general. The desired candidate is perhaps currently in a different industry, such as transport sector or the wider chemicals industry. · Min. Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or a related field· 5+ years experience from manufacturing environment or transport· Knowledge in ADR and Warehousing of Chemical Products· Fact driven, result focused and used to work  with targets.· Ability and energy to drive change management process · Candidate uses analytical work and data to provide insights, make decisions and provide workable solutions for improvements· Extremely well organized, keen attention to detail and flexibility to work with different aspects of a business· Excellent communication skills· Strong problem-solving skills . Fluent Spanish and English (business fluent) Salary and benefits: As per market levels

Position: Partnerships CoordinatorLevel: Entry-level Employment type: Full-timeLocation: Madrid, SpainAbout The FBAThe Football Business Academy is a business school dedicated to the football industry. Our programs have been developed and are delivered in a collaborative way with football industry experts around one foremost objective: to provide Candidates and Participants with all the necessary tools and an optimal learning environment in order to succeed in this passionate and dynamic industry.In order to reach this objective, we place a lot of importance on collaborating closely with industry stakeholders and co-creating value for them. As a result of this, more than 40 Partners have already joined us in our mission to build the future of Football together. About the role:The FBA is looking for a Partnerships Coordinator to support the servicing of our network in line with the interests of The FBA Family (which involves Staff, Candidates, Alumni, Faculty, and Partners). The successful candidate for this position will work closely with our Partnerships Manager and liaise with other members of the team for certain tasks. You will be part of a dynamic team which is passionate about accelerating the professionalization of the football industry and inspiring the next generation of football business leaders. This role plays an instrumental part in the way that FBA Candidates experience our program and get their (usually first) football industry experience under their belt. In other words: it means a lot to them, so it must mean a lot to you too. By doing so, we can ensure that we continue to raise the awareness and image of The FBA as the number one football business education provider globally and become the go-to place where the football industry’s stakeholders come look for off-the-pitch talent. Sounds like something you’d want to be part of? Continue reading!Your profile:Passionate about football businessFluent in English (written and spoken)Any additional languages are a plusBachelor’s degree in sports management, marketing, business administration or other related fieldPrevious experience in the football industry is preferrableAbility to work independently and prioritize workStrong organizational skills and attention to detailPositive attitude and open-mindedAbility to show initiative, be flexible, and find solutionsConfident communicator who is able to network and build relationships effectivelyQuick learnerComputer skills (MS Office, Hubspot)Permission to work in SpainYour main responsibilities:Support the Partnerships Manager with the coordination of internshipsLiaise between FBA Partners and Candidates to identify the best synergies and facilitate the internship recruitment processMonitor the football industry’s internship/job market and identify relevant opportunities for FBA Candidates and AlumniBe a voice of support and guidance to FBA Partners and Candidates alikeCoordinate agreements, feedback forms and other necessary documentsKeep CRM system up to date (Hubspot)Build relationships & networks on a global stageResearch potential partners and source key contactsDevelop new partnerships with football clubs and other industry stakeholdersOccasionally represent The FBA at events, meetings, and conferences (which may take place abroad, as well as on evenings or weekends)Additional details / considerations:Start ideally in June or at the very latest beginning of July 2021Based in Madrid with flexibility regarding office/remote workIf/when working remotely, you must have access to a home office scheme and reliable high-speed internetStandard full time work schedule consisting of five eight-hour workdaysAbility to work in Spain is a mandatory requirement. No sponsoring will be providedSalary between 18K and 22K euros (gross) depending on experience levelPlease note that The FBA is an equal opportunities employer and strongly committed to diversity and building a multicultural environment. Next steps:Do you think you have what it takes to join The FBA Family and embrace the role of Partnerships Coordinator? If so, you can get yourself in the game by submitting your application via email to jobs@the-fba.com by the end of Friday, 21st May 2021 using the following instructions:Email subject title: Partnerships Coordinator ApplicationYour CV in PDF format (max. 1 page)A cover letter outlining your motivation and aptitude for the job (max. 1 page)If we see a good match, you’ll be invited to submit a case study based on a few exercises we have created. If we really like what we see there, you’ll be invited to the interview process.Thanks for your interest and good luck!
company: The FBA - The Football Business Academy

description: Organización en constante crecimiento y mejora continua en su apuesta por el conocimiento y la formación. description: Who we are, What we do, Why we do itDarwinex is a Peer-2-Peer (P2P) Asset Manager and FCA (UK) regulated broker with the commitment to provide the latest innovative trading technology connecting traders and investors. We help talented traders develop their skills, build a verifiable track record and tap meaningful 3rd party capital. Trader strategies list on our DARWIN Exchange, to give traders regulatory cover and attract 3rd-party capital in exchange for success fees on investor profits.We have been recently recognized by Great Place to Work® as a great company to work for, where our team is one the best assets we have. We feel really proud of this and as a company, we continuously seek people who add value to our team which we consider is the unique way of offering a great service to our customers. We’d love it for you to join.About the roleThe successful candidate will report directly to the CMO and be responsible for project management of the Marketing department’s activities. You’ll be expected to evangelise new and innovative marketing initiatives (both inbound and outbound), working together with the team to devise email marketing campaigns and online media buys to maintain and enhance the Darwinex brand name amongst target audiences.Day-to-day activities will also include administrative affairs such as maintaining up to date documentation, supplier invoicing and liaising with the Finance and Compliance departments for the same.The candidate will also work closely with our Business Development team. Responsibilities: Establish and actively manage global and localized online media buys via Ad Networks, Google Search and Display, Facebook, Twitter, AdRoll, direct marketing arrangements and offline media buys.Campaign Management: ensure that all campaigns (e.g. email, webinar, social, offline, media buys, etc) function as per requirements, coordinate with the relevant departments to measure effectiveness and attribution to desired goals, impact analyses of the corporate website, email marketing and any custom landing pages.Work together with the designated CRM owner and involved teams to develop and track automated client journeys, funnels, behavioural and personalized email marketing campaigns.Working together with the Graphic Design and Frontend Web Development teams, manage all corporate website, landing page and email template designs, creatives, copies, translations, calls to action and related affairs.Produce documentation, project plans and road maps for processes, A/B tests and all financial promotions.Keeping yourself and the rest of the team well informed of competitor marketing initiatives and promotions.Liaise with members of the Business Development teams to ascertain their marketing requirements and ensure timely and effective delivery of such requirements. Evaluate requests to ensure that they are inline with the company’s strategic objectives and brand guidelines.Perform task management in a centralized manner, recording all requests, opinions, ideas and progress updates, ensuring that management is always kept informed of the progress of important tasks.Arrange meetings with key personnel to proactively ascertain their marketing requirements and provide them with progress updates on existing requests.Monitor and ensure that all marketing campaigns are within budget. Develop spending reports with a view to identifying high ROAS areas, and making data-driven recommendations for future spending accordingly.Assist when required with event management for local regions, sourcing venues, coordinating personnel placement and merchandise delivery.Work with tools such as HubSpot CRM, CrazyEgg, HotJar, Google Analytics, Power BI, GotoWebinar and JIRA.Experience RequiredMinimum of 5 years’ experience in Marketing, preferably in the financial or data sector.Bachelors or Masters Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or any relevant field.Prior experience with all items listed in the “Primary Responsibilities” section of this job post.Excellent written and spoken English.Strong organizational, project management and prioritization skills.Strong work ethic, proactive attitude, meticulous attention to detail, and the ability to deliver fast under pressure.Self-motivated with troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Why DarwinexYou'll get the opportunity to be part of a rapidly scaling FinTech company, working alongside some of the brightest talents in tech and investments. This is a unique opportunity for the right candidate to forge a strong career in one of Europe’s most disruptive FinTech Startups. We were recently cited as one of Europe’s top 21 FinTechs to watch in 2021!https://sifted.eu/articles/21-fintechs-to-watch-in-2021/Flexible hoursPartially remote workingTeam EventsA strong and clear company cultureOffice in the heart of MadridGreat team to work with!Welcome to Darwinex!

description: La Fundación Goteo busca ampliar su equipo de administración y gestión para mejorar sus procedimientos internos y para encargarse del secretariado de la Fundación. La Fundación quiere mejorar sus procedimientos internos y la transparencia y busca una persona con experiencia para ayudarnos a crecer y mejorar de manera eficiente.Necesitamos incorporar una gestora con valores, que forme parte del equipo de organización interna, que trabajan en nuestra sede de Palma.Funciones principales:Encargarse de la relación con el patronato de la fundación: enviar las convocatorias de las reuniones,apoyar en la preparación de la documentación de las reuniones, redactar acta, preparar y firmar los certificados.Encargarse de la relación con el protectorado,comunicaciones, respuestas a requerimientos, entrega de planes de actuación anuales y cuentas anuales.Gestionar toda la documentación de la Fundación actualizada y en orden.Redactar informes narrativos de la actividad y cuentas de la Fundación.Contraste, seguimiento y digestión de informes de consultores jurídicos, fiscales para transmitir y publicar la información correcta y actualizada.Encargarse de preparar y publicar la documentación obligatoria en relación con la transparencia.Gestionar los correos de atención a la comunidad de usuarias de la plataforma.Atender y mejorar los procesos vinculados a la relación con la comunidad de donantes y la plataforma Goteo.Coordinar la revisión y seguimiento de la documentación administrativa necesaria para la gestión de las ayudas económicas de usuarios y la Fundación GoteoPreparar, revisar y coordinar contratos y convenios con los diferentes stakeholders de la Fundación.Coordinar la relación con las consultorías de Protección de datos y consultoría jurídica y el Notariado.Preparar y presentar el Balance Social.Preparar documentos y protocolos de mejora interna de la organización.Preparar y dar seguimiento a convenios con otras organizaciones e instituciones.Impulsar y dar seguimiento a la política de protección de datos de la entidad.Centralizar las consultas legales de la Fundación.Apoyo en el área de justificación de subvenciones y en la coordinación con la consultora fiscal.Requisitos académicos y profesionales:Titulación superior universitaria en administración de empresas, derecho.Experiencia en trabajos de gestión y administrativos.Conocimientos y experiencia en el tercer sector y en fundaciones.Conocimientos legales y administrativos.Buenas capacidades de comunicación oral y escrita en catalán y castellano.Desenvoltura con las TIC y apertura al aprendizaje con nuevas herramientas.Se valorará:Inglés medioHabilidades personales:Aptitudes para gestionar el tiempo.Aptitudes excelentes para la comunicación verbal y escrita.Habilidades socialesIniciativa y proactividad.TenacidadAptitudes para la planificación.Buena organización.Capaz de comunicarse con personas a distintos niveles.Capaz de dar explicaciones claras y concisas.Tener capacidad analítica y mucha resolución delante de posibles problemas.Cómo solicitar el puesto:Escribe un email a cv@goteo.org y envíanos tu CV y una carta de motivación, explicando por qué te interesa trabajar con nosotras y que puedes aportar a la Fundación y concretamente en el rol descrito.La Fundación está comprometida en crear igualdad de oportunidades para todos/as, independientemente del background y nacionalidad de la persona candidata. Por esta razón, está particularmente interesada en recibir solicitudes de personas racializadas, personas con diversidad funcional y personas que se identifican como LGTBQIA.

description: From Montaner & A we are looking for a QUALITY MANAGER for our client, a Chemical Industry company, and one of the main polyurethane manufacturers globally, with more than 50 years of existence, international presence and two production plants in Barcelona (Vallés Occidental and Oriental), due to its growth.Reporting to the Global Operations Director and in a second line to the Plant Manager, his/her job purpose and key functions will be:Purpose: Main responsibility is to manage the quality control department of the two locations in the area of Barcelona . The referred locations are central to the company business results and require a strong asset maintenance program. As an addition and aligned with the growth plan of the company, Quality Control Manager of the referred locations, will also provide guidance on key Quality Control programs to the rest of the locations of the company. - Translates the organization's business goals into appropriate Quality Control goals that support and contribute to the organization's business results. - Develops and controls the Quality Control department budget that provides for optimized spending to achieve the agreed-upon capacity and asset reliability.- Control over the QC analysis performed over raw materials received, intermediate materials manufactured, and final products delivered to customers. The scope of the role also comprises the analysis performed over emission points for environmental permits compliance (waste water)- Direct responsibility over the Quality System and its related certifications like ISO9002 - Supervise the maintenance of all instruments for the Labs of QC of CST/LLL; and the i+D departmen . - Periodically benchmarks current performance with internal and external sources to identify opportunities for improvement.- Facilitates good environmental, health and safety performance.- Fosters a culture that does not tolerate and seeks to understand and eliminate the causes of waste/errors using techniques such as Root Cause Analysis (RCA)- Supervise inspectors, technicians and other staff and provide guidance and feedback- Act as a back up of Lab managers to approve the right products or reject defectives- Work together with Production managers to devise ways to improve the manufacturing process to ensure higher-quality goods.- Supervises the handling of customer complains, major product quality deviations , and other Qc incidents. Develops, maintains and lead a process of structural approach to handle these situations .- Supervises the performance of the QC department through the implementation of the Performance Management System .- Ensures effective use and integration of information technologies.- International part of the role (actual 2021): - Oversees the development of the QC program for the newly started manufacturing process at other international plants . Provides guidance ton specific safety issues related to lab activities.-	Supports the design phase of the new sites, providing specific expertise for the design of the process steps, sampling, analytical methods to be used , equipment and technical details ,etc.Requirements :- Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering or related field- Experience managing teams (technicians, engineers and supervisors), in different sites- More than 5 years of Qc Manager experience- Deep understanding in legal requirements applicable to QC (raw materials and products)- Able to Understand customer needs and requirements, to develop effective quality control processes.- Experience working with Standard Costing and Budgeting (desired)- Ability and energy to drive change management process - Candidate uses analytical work and data to provide insights, make decisions and provide workable solutions for improvements- Extremely well organized, keen attention to detail and flexibility to work with different aspects of a business- Experience in driving/leading efficiency programs based on Lean, Six Sigma, 8D or similar process improvement methods- Excellent communication skills- Strong problem solving skills- Fast driven and result focusedOffered :- Stable position with growth possibilities in a leading company in its sector globally.- Hours: Monday to Friday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., with the possibility of extending at specific times.- Salary between 55 and 65.000€ annual gross, depending on the candidate’s value.

description: ¿Quiénes somos?Sustec es una compañía de gestión y contratación de publicaciones seriadas e información para centros de documentación y bibliotecas, de instituciones académicas, públicas y privadas.Colaboramos con los editores y proveedores de las publicaciones realizando la contratación, gestión y mantenimiento para los centros de documentación y bibliotecas.Somos una pequeña empresa con proyección de seguir progresando y creciendo cuidadosamente.CargoQueremos incorporar una persona para el departamento de comunicación, con un perfil de marketing y también administrativo.La función principal es el contacto con los clientes, la gestión de presupuestos y seguimiento y de prospectos/contactos.- Contacto con clientes potenciales.- Seguimiento y gestión de prospectos (presentación del servicio).- Gestión y realización de presupuestos.- Soporte de comunicación y administrativo con cuentas/clientes actuales.- Soporte administrativo con proveedores (editores, actualización de tarifas).Aunque las tareas tienen un enfoque principal de comunicación y contacto con los clientes, los procesos tienen inherente un parte administrativa, requieren anotación, planificación, registro y mantenimiento de datos en nuestra aplicación. También se requiere flexibilidad para apoyar en tareas y procesos administrativos, de gestión del cliente y de gestión con proveedoresEs por ello que el enfoque es de un perfil de comunicación/administrativo.IdiomasSe valorará el conocimiento de inglés (especialmente escrito para las tareas administrativas) y de catalán.La curva o proceso de aprendizaje de nuestra actividad y sector es ciertamente largo.Proyecto y filosofíaEsto es lo más importante para nosotros:Buscamos una persona con ganas de aprender y progresar, con iniciativa y autonomía para colaborar en el desarrollo y crecimiento de la empresa, comprometido con el proyecto y determinado para una relación a largo plazo.ContratoJornada completa de 8h y contrato indefinido.Nuestras oficinas están en Poblenou (Barcelona).Pueden saber más sobre nosotros en nuestra web: sustec.es¡Te esperamos!

description: Descripción del PuestoEstarás a cargo de desarrollar contenido para LUCA, en el mercado mexicano y LATAM. Tu objetivo final es convertir a LUCA en referencia dentro del área de educación escolar digital para el mercado mexicano y latinoamericano.Buscamos un emprendedor SEO. Para mejorar rápidamente el posicionamiento de nuestra web.Encargado de la unidad de negocio de E-Learning para México y Latinoamérica.- Definición de KPIs de rendimiento, asegurar su implementación y enviar reportes semanales de cumplimiento.- Tomar las acciones necesarias para destacar y diferenciarnos de la competencia. Desarrollar la unidad de Global- Definir y mantener la estrategia SEO para crecer el tráfico orgánico de la web.- Desarrollar la marca Luca como referente en el mundo del E-Learning.Requerimientos- Experiencia de trabajo en firmas internacionales y un sólido pasado académico.- Perfil comercial.- 2-3 años de experiencia en SEO.- Conocimientos de HTML. - Capacidad de manejo de números y grandes cantidades de información.- Experiencia probada en utilización de las siguientes herramientas: Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Rank Tracker, Analytics, Tag Manager y Search Console.- Conocer muy bien el mercado Mexico.- Eres sociable, prestas atención a los demás y eres buen líder.- Te gusta trabajar en startups y conoces cómo definir y ejecutar estrategias rápidamente.- Hablas perfectamente español y tienes un buen nivel de inglés.En Luca, trabajarás en un ambiente donde todo lo que hagas será increíblemente importante para el producto final y el éxito de la compañía. Tus acciones y decisiones darán forma al futuro de la compañía.

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:Here at Bodas.net (The Knot Worldwide) we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life’s milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we’re there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:We are looking for a highly motivated engineering leader with a passion for leading teams to create elegant and scalable software for our users. The right person will have a proven track record delivering engaging, consumer focused products within a data driven, agile environment. In this role you will lead a talented engineering team, partner with product development, and actively participate in both tactical and strategic conversations to determine the evolution of our products.The Knot Invitations is an exciting new line of business for The Knot Worldwide and we are making significant investments in our offering. This role has significant growth opportunity and visibility to stakeholders including the CEO, CPO, and CTO. The Engineering Manager for this team will work cross-organizationally to drive technical architecture vision and be a strong partner to product and design to establish OKRs and set technical vision to achieve business objectives.RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversee an engineering team responsible for our Invitations product vertical.  Ensure the team is operating effectively to reach their goals, are properly supported and deliver quality software. Evolve our platform into a sustainable architecture that supports iterative and fast development. Develop, coach, and mentor multiple engineers at various stages of their career to ensure growth and cultivate emerging leaders. Provide leadership within the team to ensure solutions are built in alignment with company principles. Actively participate in Agile ceremonies including pre-IPM, IPM, standups, and retros. Partner with product and design to plan and deliver OKRs. Actively participate in establishing the broader technical and product strategy that supports our company goals. Partner with Principal Engineers and Architects to set the vision and create the tech roadmap to effectively operate this product and platform. Formulate and proactively look for opportunities to improve the overall effectiveness of the teams. Collaborate with the broader zone and company on key technical initiatives. SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS: Have 7+ years of proven industry experience with 3+ years of experience leading engineering teams. Deep understanding of distributed system design utilizing both relational and non-relational data stores. Experience working within an Agile based environment. A track record of shipping successful consumer facing products. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable managing multiple work streams and coordinating resources across teams and products. Thrives in a collaborative work culture with teammates located in-office or remote across multiple locations in the US and abroad. Knowledge of A/B testing software and techniques is a plus. The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability.

and forecasting, provide country input into overall I&I forecasts Prepare ad-hock business cases to maximize identified market opportunitiesQualifications Proficient in written and spoken English and with external customers & stakeholders and acting upon customer insights.Experience managing and coaching diverse team.Capabilities Strategy Execution to Maximize Revenues Action oriented to drive plan implementation Comprehensive business acumen & marketing experience in high specialty therapeutic area Thorough understanding of revenue drivers for the brand in local country Leadership description: Nosotros:GreenIce es un ecommerce de iluminación y uno de los líderes en su sector a nivel nacional y europeo. Who We AreBrooks is a team of passionate people united by a desire to do meaningful work, lead healthy lives and make a difference. We share a focused mission: to inspire everyone to run and be active. That’s it. No distractions—it’s all about the run. Through science, creativity, service, authenticity and connection, we obsess over delivering the best running gear on the planet. We do it our way, with our unique spirit, with a goal of being more relevant to runners than any other brand, day after day and mile after mile. We are determined to innovate, challenging ourselves to lead thought at every turn. Inside these walls and on the roads, tracks and trails, we live and breathe Run Happy, celebrating the positive impact running has on our lives and others. We inject it into all we do because it makes everything better, smarter, more fun and more memorable. Our company culture defines us, bonds us together and creates the conditions for success. It is lived daily as a behavioral expression of our collective set of brand values: Connect with People, Innovate for our Customer, Compete as a Team, Build Trust, Have Fun & Bring Passion, and Be Active. If you’re on our team, it means you’re part of creating something extraordinary. You’re part of Brooks.Your JobThe Brooks Technical Representative will lead and execute the field support strategy in all distribution channels located within their respective territory to increase market share, amplify Brooks’ product leadership, and create recognition, awareness, and loyalty for the brand.Your ResponsibilitiesLead the overall field support efforts for Brooks at both SRA and Non-Specialty accounts located within the territory.Support the Sales and Marketing teams with product launches, in-store merchandising, and innovative grassroots programs at all accounts.Work with Sales management and Marketing on the success of National Account sell-thru programs/in-store promotions; all Tec Rep’s are accountable for an established sell-thru number for a pre-determined store base within their respective territory.Educate and motivate the retailer, consumer, and all key points of contact about Brooks technology and product leadership via product seminars and clinics.Work the sales floor at accounts as assigned – be an expert at driving product sell-thru in all channelsRepresent Brooks at national (and selected local) running events and expos -- including set-up, breakdown, distribution of collateral, interaction with consumers and product trial.Provide feedback and analysis via bi-weekly field reports to measure effectiveness of product initiatives and sales strategies; identify new opportunities for growth within or outside the running industry.Maintain appearance of leased company vehicle and all Brooks equipment.Your QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Marketing/Sales/Retail Management preferred.1 – 3 years of retail experience (Athletic Specialty preferred).2+ years of Marketing/Sales experience within the sports industry preferredFluency in Spanish and good understanding of business English are an absolute must.Highly-motivated and energetic with an enthusiastic attitudeExcellent verbal and written communication skills in Italian and business English, demonstrating effective listening through concise, clear verbal and written communicationVery strong presentation skills.Excellent interpersonal skills that inspire and build trust resulting in effective working relationships across the company. Works well independently, as well as within a team.Keen attention to detail in planning, organization and execution of tasks, while still seeing the big picture and understanding how all of the pieces fit together and affect one another.Ability to anticipate how a decision made can affect our customers, our partners, our products or other departments’ operations and/or morale; “connecting the dots.”Demonstration of innovation and initiative – always looking at improving our products and processes while also displaying a willingness to dive into the details and help out wherever necessary.Passionate participation in Brooks’ sports activities a plus, overridden by the ability to understand and empathize with the runner in order to develop loyal, engaging relationships with our customers and the Brooks community.Basic knowledge of retail math, inventory management, product merchandising and retail selling skills.Knowledge of performance athletic footwear/apparel/accessories and their related technologies.Knowledge of the biomechanics of human motion; understanding of injury prevention basics.Understanding of the territory’s local running community (events, clubs, coaches, specialty retailers).Extensive travel required; able and willing to work weekends and extended hours as required.Must show proof of good driving record upon request.Embraces and lives the Brooks values!Our Offer25 working days of holiday leave per yearCompany car, mobile phone and laptop according to our company policyBonus and merit potentialDiscount on Brooks productsThe opportunity to be part of a great teamPlease note that this role requires 70% travel - valid driving license is a mustPlease submit your CV and motivation in EnglishAt Brooks, we celebrate diversity & equity. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment, and encourage people of all backgrounds, perspectives, experiences, and skills to apply. Brooks is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, the presence of a sensory, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military status, marital status, pregnancy or child birth, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, political ideology, or any other non-merit based factors.

description: Ciklum, international Software Development Company is looking for an HR Generalist to join our fast-growing office in Malaga.In this role you will be a part of the International HR Enablement team, having colleagues close to you and a big distributed team acting in the same role in other offices of the company in Ukraine, Belorussia, Poland, the UK, US.It is an opportunity for the one interested in having diverse tasks, working in an IT environment, being part of a multinational team and combining typical HR administrative activities with supporting the relocation process, dealing with work permits.Responsibilities:Proper keeping and update of all employment related templates (meeting legal and business standards and needs)Managing preparation, standardization and administration of local employment contracts and amendments theretoBeing a centre of expertise and assistance in building the knowledge database on matters related to employment, immigration, taxation and social security systemBuilding cooperation with a 3rd party payroll provider and external legal consultants on HR Admin issues – payroll input data submission and payroll sheets verification on regular and variable pay; sensitive hirings, transfers / changes, exits support – managing vendors and ensuring the service level is met to ensure employees are paid correctly and in timeCommunication with and assistance to Malaga employees, People Partners, Managers in matters related to the Employee lifecycleKeeping local HR internal policies and procedures up to date, manage their implementation, focus on developing the missing policiesEnsuring proper formalization of HR-related processes related to employee lifecycle in the Company (hiring, transfer, change of employment conditions, termination, etc)Provision of advisory and consultations of HR labour related matters, according to Spanish legislation, to all employees and managersSupport employees in immigration matters according to local legislation and ensure smooth adaptation to the new countryEmployees’s local benefits managing (medical insurance, etc.)Requirements:High education HR (labor law is ideal)Knowledge of Spanish labor law2+ years of related work experienceAdvanced PC and internet user (MS Office, Google suit, Office 365 packages, HRIS system, additional software like Navision is a plus)Experience working with documentation (preparing reports, contracts, payrolls, etc.)Experience working with state institutions, labor unionsExperience working with work permits for expatriates is a plusPersonal skills:Self-organized and self-motivatedStrong communicator and negotiator, team playerResponsibleAttentive to detailsA Get-Things-Done personFast in troubleshooting and escalationLanguages at least Upper-Intermediate written and spoken English is mandatory, native or fluent SpanishWhat's in it for you?Working in an international team of professionals on a full-time indefinite contractPrivate medical insurance after passing the trial periodPossibility to work in a big and successful company23 working days of vacation paid per year

description: excelia es una firma multinacional de Consultoría, Tecnología y Servicios profesionales con más de 20 años de experiencia. Prestamos servicio en más de 50 países de Europa, América Latina y Estados Unidos desde nuestras 10 oficinas propias en 8 países. Somos una compañía dinámica e innovadora centrada en ayudar a nuestros clientes a optimizar y expandir sus operaciones a nivel local e internacional, permitiéndoles acelerar su internacionalización, digitalización y enfocarse en lo más importante: su negocio.En la línea de BPS, excelia ofrece servicios de contabilidad, impuestos y nómina, así como servicios corporativos internacionales a través de nuestra red de oficinas propias y de nuestros partners de negocio, apoyándonos en nuestra plataforma tecnológica EDP (excelia Digital Platform).En excelia te ofrecemos la posibilidad de seguir desarrollando tu carrera profesional en un contexto internacional, una compañía en rápido crecimiento y con un espíritu de superación, compromiso e innovación continua.Buscamos una posición de Global Operation Manager con experiencia en la línea de BPS de la Firma, que lidere la operación de BPS a nivel Global, que adore los retos y no entienda de límites profesionales.Si te identificas y cumples con parte de los requisitos de la lista, envíanos tu CV.- Tienes experiencia en una empresa de servicios profesionales y quieres continuar en el sector.- Has estado al menos 6 años desarrollando labores similares o de supervisión.- Tienes excelentes dotes de liderazgo de equipos internacionales.- Tu formación es en el área financiera. Licenciatura de administración y dirección de empresas.- Tienes experiencia en auditoría.- Hablas inglés fluido, nivel C1.Ofrecemos:-Proyección internacional.-Incorporación a una Firma que ofrece carrera profesional y crecimiento continuo.-Empresa estable, joven, dinámica y que apuesta por la innovación.-Equipo con ambición y afán de crecimiento.¿Te interesa la oportunidad? ¿Crees que encajas con el perfil que buscamos?¡Haz clic en "Solicitar" y forma parte de excelia, una compañía internacional donde desarrollar todo tu talento!

description: Overview We’re excited to have now joined the 7-Eleven family of stores! The Assistant Leader is responsible for assisting management with overall store conditions, in order to maximize guest services and store profitability. The Assistant Store Leader will aid in fostering a coaching environment where employees want to excel, and are recognized for their achievements. The Assistant Leaders must be scheduled to work separate shifts/days with the exception of one day a week. They will oversee facility operations in the absence of Facility Leader.Cultivate a GUEST in Mind Culture. Focus on the wildly important. Be a leader. Be committed to the guest.Responsibilities Provides prompt, courteous customer service by discovering guest’s needs with management support.  Assists in planning and preparing of schedules.  Prepares shift reports and/or other reports as required by management. Completes DSR and shift analysis reports.  Assists and supports management in calculations of food consumption, and requests purchases of food products, supplies and equipment, as required.  Ensures accuracy of gasoline pump readings.  Supports in the cleaning of shelves, drives, dispensers, restrooms, store interior/exterior, and other designated areas.  Assists management in maintaining building, equipment and grounds.  May assist in analyzing financial data including but not limited to; profit and loss statements, shortage to identify business opportunities and increase of sales.  May assist in analyzing food service results and trends to determine the proper action plans, to leverage the stores food sales and address areas for improvement. Assists management with ordering and vendor check-in.  Works under the direction of the Item Level Inventory Specialist with inventory audits. Contributes in price counting inventory, pricing, stocking and rotating merchandise.  Conducts competitors survey at the direction of management using personal vehicle.*  Effectively reacts to and reports customer complaints tactfully and promptly.  Addresses and follows company policy and procedures and all laws governing restricted beverage and tobacco sales.  Performs service transactions in accordance with company policy such as alcoholic beverage & tobacco sales; lottery sales & redemptions; vendor coupons redemptions; Company approve credit card charges, etc.  Follows credit card, money order, and check cashing policies.  Effectively oversees facility operations during absence of Leader; communicates employee relations problems to management for further handling.  Safeguards cash and merchandise; follow company robbery prevention and reaction procedures as provided in the emergency response and reporting procedures and policy manual.  Reports and follows policies and procedures established to prevent loss of cash and merchandise due to actions by employees, vendors and/or customers.  Ensures the bank deposits are made daily. Follows proper cash handling procedures in accordance with company policies.  Ensures and eliminates safety hazards; reports unsafe acts or conditions to management. Prepares required accident/incident report, immediately reporting such activity to management.  Operates cash register and all point-of-sale equipment efficiently.  Aids in managing the merchandising of the facility by directing sales promotions, implementing new programs, and communicating to vendors and other appropriate personnel on marketing activities. Uses suggestive selling techniques.  Assists in training and coaching to develop top performing employees. Assists management with applicant screening process.  Carries out sales associate responsibilities, as required.  Maintains personal appearance in accordance with company uniform and personal appearance policy for Assistant Store Leaders.  Performs other duties as assigned.  Reports to work on time and when scheduled. QualificationsThe qualifications listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. Essential functions are job duties that an employee must be able to perform with or without reasonable accommodation. All of the responsibilities listed above are considered essential job functions to this position.Education/ExperienceMust be at least 18 years or older to apply. High School diploma or GED is preferred. Two year degree or above desired. A minimum of one year in retail, fast food, or sales experience is required. Maintains current food handler and food safety certification as required by county. Must be authorized to work in the United States.A valid driver’s license is required to perform banking responsibilities and to conduct competitor surveys. Reliable transportation and valid automobile insurance is required. Employees are subjected to motor vehicle checks in accordance with company policies if required to drive.Knowledge And SkillsDemonstrated leadership and customer service skills and competencies. Proven success developing team members. Demonstrated ability to use P&L and store reports to affect change. Ability to read and interpret documents such as rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Excellent oral and written communication and intrapersonal skills. Ability to write routine reports and to speak effectively before customers and employees. Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals. Ability to exercise sound judgment and work with minimum supervision. Proficient computer knowledge (Microsoft products preferred Word, Excel). PDI/Verifone/Topaz experience preferred.Physical Functions Must be able to stand and/or walk for full shift.  Ability to occasionally lift and/or carry up to 50 pounds from ground to overhead, and/or 60 pounds from ground to waist level,, up to thirty minutes of workday (i.e., to assisting in stocking/maintaining inventory levels).  Ability to push and pull with arms up to a force of 128 pounds (i.e., utilizing hand truck.)  Ability to bend at the waist with some twisting, up to one hour of the workday.  May be required to climb a ladder and/or stool, kneel or crouch to store or retrieve materials and/or place or remove signs.  Ability to grasp, reach, and manipulate objects with hands all day. This handwork requires eye-hand coordination and may require bilateral coordination of hands, up to four hours of the workday. Working Conditions Employee performs approximately 95% of work indoors. Outside work will be required.  Employee is exposed to intermittent indoor cold temperature extremes when working in the walk-in cooler and/or freezer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. Essential functions are job duties that an employee must be able to perform with or without reasonable accommodation. All of the responsibilities listed above are considered essential job functions to this position.This job description is subject to change at any time.#INDSJ711

description: ¿Te gustaría formar parte de una empresa dinámica? ¿Te apasionan las ventas y buscas un nuevo reto? Si tienes ganas de aprender y crecer en un entorno divertido y en un sector en auge como el de la comida a domicilio ¡esta es tu oportunidad! ¡En Just Eat Takeaway buscamos a un comercial de calle para la captación y gestión de restaurantes en la zona asignada! Qué esperamos de ti:Buscar constantemente nuevas oportunidades de negocio (restaurantes) en tu cuidad / zona y comentarles los beneficios de unirse a la plataforma de Just Eat Takeaway. Captación de nuevos restaurantes estratégicos que ayuden a potenciar la imagen de marca de Just Eat en la ciudad a través de reuniones/visitas presenciales. Apoyar a los restaurantes existentes para resolver problemas (operativos) que no se pudieron resolver de forma remota.Potenciar el crecimiento de la zona a través de la mejora constante de la oferta gastronómica.Colaborar con los compañeros del equipo de Inside Sales (televenta) con el objetivo de lograr resultados óptimos.Monitorizar y dar feedback sobre la actividad de la competencia en la ciudad / zona. Gestionar y coordinar tu propio tiempo y agenda para cumplir con la estrategia de ventas de la compañía. Requisitos: Experiencia comercial de 2-3 años en venta presencial en el sector de la restauración o sectores afines.Conocimiento comercial con fuertes habilidades de negociación e influencia. Experiencia trabajando con el CRM Salesforce Carnet de conducir B. Se valorará un buen nivel de inglés. Ser capaz de priorizar y gestionar el tiempo de forma óptima. Ser ambicioso, aprender rápido y tener ganas de tener éxito y ser parte de un gran equipo.Ser un amante de la comida! ¿Qué ofrecemos? Trabajar en un Great Place to Work donde las personas están en el centro de todas nuestras decisiones. Formar parte de una gran familia con un ambiente joven, dinámico, con oportunidades de desarrollo profesional Contrato indefinido y a tiempo completo  (lunes a viernes)Salario competitivo + comisiones mensuales por cumplimiento de objetivos. Coche de empresa Teléfono móvil + Ipad Beneficios Sociales: Ticket Restaurante, Andjoy (gimnasio), Seguro de Vida, Seguro de Salud (tras cumplir 1 año en la compañía). Flexibilidad Horaria Si eres una persona apasionada de las ventas y el sector de la comida a domicilio, proactiva, dinámica, ordenada, con muchas ganas de superación, te gustan los retos y quieres trabajar en un entorno joven, dinámico y divertido ¡¡QUEREMOS DARTE LA BIENVENIDA, JUST EAT SPAIN TE ESPERA!

description: Especialista en Medicina Estética

¿Por qué elegir Ferrovial Servicios?¿Te gustaría desarrollar tu carrera profesional en un equipo de trabajo rodeado/a de los mejores profesionales del sector?Ferrovial Servicios es una organización líder a escala nacional en la prestación integrada de servicios medioambientales y de gestión de infraestructuras proporcionando soluciones de calidad, eficientes e innovadoras para dar respuesta a las necesidades de nuestros clientes y ciudadanos. Si habías imaginado desarrollarte en una compañía, en la que mientras ayudas a mejorar la vida de las personas puedas afrontar cada día un reto diferente, Ferrovial Servicios es tu sitio.¿En qué consiste el puesto? Desde la Dirección de Tecnología y Procesos, en el Departamento de Transformación Digital y Sistemas buscamos incorporar a un/a Digital Project Manager en Madrid o Barcelona cuya misión principal será contribuir a la estrategia y diseño de la transformación digital en la compañía a través del desarrollo de proyectos basados en tecnologías digitales 4.0, controlando su implantación, operación soporte y transición, así como su optimización, rendimiento y costes.Las funciones son las siguientes:Proyectos DigitalesEntender las necesidades del cliente interno, buscando y analizando soluciones tecnológicas que puedan dar respuesta a sus peticiones, diseñando una propuesta integral e identificando los recursos necesarios (económicos, humanos, arquitectura, proveedores, etc.) para ofrecer al cliente la mejor solución/propuesta en términos de objetivos, plazos, tecnología y presupuesto.Diseñar un procedimiento/metodología de ejecución de los Proyectos Digitales y velar por su cumplimiento, estableciendo un modelo de seguimiento común y transversal.Identificar iniciativas, proyectos y tecnologías que contribuyan al desarrollo del Plan Estratégico de la D. de Trasformación Digital con el objetivo de aportar valor añadido a la compañía.Desarrollar y dirigir los proyectos IT aplicando metodologías ágiles asegurando calidad en los entregables y cumplimiento de expectativas.Servicio de SoporteDiseñar y desarrollar un modelo de Servicio de Soporte para hacer un seguimiento exhaustivo y de calidad de los proyectos digitales implantados, velando por las garantías de disponibilidad, capacidad, seguridad, continuidad y escalabilidad.Coordinar el Servicio de Soporte de los proyectos e iniciativas digitales durante el EarlyLife, siendo el nexo entre proveedores y equipos internos.Diseñar y liderar el HandOver del proyecto al departamento de Aplicaciones, garantizando un traspaso riguroso de documentación, procedimientos y formación.Plan de Comunicación del Plan de Transformación DigitalCoordinar el Plan Comunicación en el marco del Plan de Transformación Digital junto al departamento de Comunicación, generando contenido y publicando noticias relevantes del área para asegurar que la información llega al resto de la organización. Además, debe impulsar el lanzamiento de Píldoras Formativas que contribuyan al cambio Cultural que supone el Plan de Transformación Digital en coordinación con el departamento de TalentoImpulsar el valor del User Experiencie y su aplicación en los Proyectos Digitales, asegurando calidad en los entregables y cumplimiento de expectativas.¿Qué buscamos?Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o Física. Formación en metodologías ágiles (Scrum o Agile), certificación PMP e ITIL. Valorable formación en innovación. Conocimiento general en tecnologías 4.0, BigData, loT, BlockChain, RPA, AI, UX. Experiencia de más de cinco años en departamento similar o consultoría tecnológica. Nivel alto de inglés (mínimo C1)Perfil pensamiento analítico, orientación al cliente, orientación a resultados, colaboración y learning Agility.¿Qué te ofrecemos? Estabilidad: Contrato indefinido Desarrollo y proyección profesionalFormación continua a través de diferentes proyectos (Cursos internos, externos, voluntariados, etc.)Experiencia trabajando con los mejores profesionales del sectorSi te gustan los retos y cumples con el perfil no dudes en inscribirte a nuestra oferta ¡Te estamos esperando! ¡Tu futuro está a un solo clic de distancia!
industry: Servicios infraestructurales,Servicios medioambientales

Normativa Europea. description: In order to support the vision of creating more liveable urban spaces, EIT Urban Mobility is looking for an intern for the Innovation department. The intern will support the team during its phase of consolidation of the department due to the rapid growth of its activity. Especially in the area of communication, marketing and event organisation. The Innovation team is responsible for the continuing development of the Innovation portfolio, monitoring programmes, driving excellence, and providing quality support and service to our Innovation partners. The Innovation team has five Innovation Officers located in Innovation Hubs across Europe and three staff members in the headquarters.MAIN TASKSTasks and responsibilities include:Learn and adherence to defined marketing guidance rules, templates and timelines given and collaborate to apply them to a projectLiaise with Marketing & Communications department on behalf of project leadsRead content and participate in the discussions with internal experts to devise simple understandable messaging pointsCollaborate in setting-up and coordinate multiple small team meetings (Eventbrite + Zoom). Send invites and track acceptanceAssisting in setting-up multiple small niche events at one timeCollaborating to keep project leaders updated on event progressRaise issues for improvement on communications or eventsAssisting to chase speakers and collate meeting content and write preparation notes. Track attendanceAssisting to prepare timeline and communications plan for the eventCollaborate in developing a marketing and communication campaign in alignment with EITUM COMMs department.Prepare timeline and communications plan for the eventDevelop a marketing and communication campaign in alignment with EITUM COMMs department.Post-event reportingFollow up with event participantsEDUCATION, EXPERIENCE and KEY SKILLSUnderstand graphic tools/ marketing toolsHigh level in English (written and spoken)Knowledge and experience in communication, marketing and events managementMotivation to work in fast-moving, innovative, and sometimes ambiguous environments;Team player who can work independently;Organized and structured, pro-active and hands-on;A positive and ‘can-do’ mindset.CONTRACT TYPE7 months Full-time internship contract / agreementGross monthly salary: 1.450 EurLOCATIONBarcelona

description: Estate Agent - Luxury Homes ( Mallorca)We are looking for ambitious, experienced estate agents in Mallorca who wish to earn a six-figure income. Are you an experienced Estate Agent, Manager, Lister or Valuer with a proven track record in Mallorca or in Spain (but looking to relocate)? Fine & Country have an immediate opportunity for entrepreneurial estate agents to join our network, and sell prestige homes.Roles and Responsibilities includeo	Liaising with high-net-worth clientso	Responsible for own lead generation by prospecting for new businesso	Generating and carrying out market appraisalso	Listing and marketing luxury homes.We Provideo	Full support from Fine & Country’s luxury Park Lane head office and Fine & Country Internationalo	Systems to enable you to run your business including CRMo	All the marketing material an agent would need.o	A proven and winning success formula (including systems and strategies).o	Property advert listings on all the major portalsWe are looking foro	Fluent Spanish or English or German.o	Ambitious, self-motivated and entrepreneurial.o	Able to provide the highest levels of customer serviceo	Believe in ongoing personal and professional development.Benefitso	High, uncapped earnings. €100k+ achievable in year one.o	Become part of Fine & Country’s international luxury brand.o	Earn from worldwide referral opportunitiesAbout Fine & Countryo	Over 300 offices in the UK and across the worldo	Head office on Park Lane, Londono	Specialise in selling properties in the upper quartileo	We’ve won the 'Best Estate Agency Marketing' award at the International Property Awards for 5 consecutive years.Interested in learning more?Email us in confidence: mallorca@fineandcountry.com#Career #property #propertymanagement #residential #management #realestate #Recruiting#luxuryhomesforsale #mallorca #menorca #millioneurolistings #realestateagent #sellingsunset #propertydevelopers #mallorcahomes #menorcahomes #Jobsearch #EstateAgencyMallorca

Como parte esencial de nuestro equipo en nuestro centro de Alcobendas, buscamos incorporar una persona para realizar tareas de Ingeniería de Despliegues en nuestros proyectos de Digital labs enfocados a nuestros mercados de Transporte y defensa . Para ello es necesario aportar:Tecnico con conocimiento de despliegue de software.Orquestador de software que instale y configure entornos de diseño. Con experiencia en cyber. Conocimiento en varias de estas tecnologías:Kuberntes, IAM, Oracle Identity Manager, SailPoint,, Event Mesh, API Gateway,Graviteee, Mulesoft, Kong, Kafka, Broker IoT, MQTT, block chain, Camunda​. Quiénes somos¿Sabes quién está detrás de más de 100 millones de aterrizajes seguros en más de 1.200 pistas de aeropuertos de todo el mundo? ¿Quién ha hecho más inteligente la movilidad de ciudades como Londres, Medellín o Madrid? ¿En quién confían las principales entidades financieras españolas o 140 compañías energéticas en todo el mundo?La respuesta es Indra.Una de las principales empresas globales de consultoría y tecnología y el socio tecnológico para las operaciones clave de los negocios de sus clientes en todo el mundo. Contamos con cerca de 40.000 profesionales localizados en nuestras oficinas de más de 46 países y con operaciones comerciales en más de 140 países.Apostamos por el desarrollo de tecnologías y soluciones propias con una oferta que cubre toda la cadena de valor, desde la consultoría, el desarrollo e integración a la externalización para todos los sectores en los que operamos:- Transporte y tráfico- Defensa y Seguridad- Energía e Industria- AA.PP y Sanidad- Servicios Financieros- Telecom y MediaBuscamos un profesional con experiencia y visión de futuro para contribuir en la implantación de soluciones y servicios eficientes y eficaces para satisfacer las demandas de nuestros clientes.En el mundo de Defensa y Seguridad, liderar la innovación es construir un mañana más seguro. Y lo hacemos creando ecosistemas en los que clientes, socios y gobiernos se unen para proteger e impulsar el futuro.Un futuro lleno de retos, amenazas y oportunidades, donde anticiparse es tan importante como saber reaccionar.Y lo hacemos integrando la solidez del mundo físico con la innovación del mundo digital.Porque en Indra creemos que la única manera de anticiparnos al futuro, es vivir en él.LA MEJOR FORMA DE DESARROLLARTE PROFESIONALMENTEContarás con un plan de formación integral en nuestra Universidad Corporativa "Indra Open University" y tendrás a tu disposición multitud de recursos para que puedas trabajar en tu propio desarrollo. La asignación te permitirá avanzar en tu carrera y desarrollar todo tu potencial.UNA CARRERA PROFESIONAL ADAPTADA A TIPodrás aprender en distintas áreas de la compañía, especializarte en una tecnología determinada o en un área funcional. Nuestros Planes de Carrera se ajustan al perfil de cada profesional y te situarán en el lugar más adecuado de la organización en función de tus conocimientos y actitudes. Además contamos con un Proceso de Gestión de Carrera para hacer el seguimiento individualizado de tu desarrollo.FLEXIBILIDAD Y CONCILIACIÓN PARA UN BUEN EQUILIBRIO EN TU VIDAEn Indra, uno de los aspectos más valorados por los profesionales es la flexibilidad. Contamos con medidas de conciliación que te permitirán dar respuesta a tus necesidades personales.
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información

description: ¡El mejor momento para cambiar! Trabaja como agente inmobiliario en aProperties.¿Tienes experiencia como asesor inmobiliario y buscas dar un paso más en tu carrera? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad laboral de lujo!En aProperties, la agencia inmobiliaria líder en comercialización de viviendas de alto standing de Madrid; te estamos buscando.Construye tu marca personal, celebra tus éxitos con nuestros elevados bonus de captación, y recompensa tu trabajo con nuestros bonus por objetivos anuales.¿Qué te pedimos?- Que seas capaz de trabajar de forma autónoma y en equipo.- Que tengas dotes comerciales y capacidad de negociación.- Que domines el Paquete Office.¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?- Realización de visitas- Búsqueda de propiedades en venta en tu zona agenciada en exclusiva- Asistencia a firmas- Captación de propiedades- Valoración de propiedades¿Qué te ofrecemos?- Trabajo con las mejores propiedades de lujo en Madrid, Barcelona y Valencia.- Ser tu propio jefe. Tú gestionas tu trabajo, que puedes compaginar con otros proyectos.- Grandes recompensas a tu trabajo: elevadas comisiones, bonos por captación y facturación...- Amplios beneficios sociales: gimnasio, clases de inglés...
