description: Servicio Móvil somos un grupo empresarial formado por 17 empresas especialistas en Logística Integral, Gestión de la Información, BPO y venta de productos sanitarios. Nuestros más de 2400 empleados ayudan diariamente a nuestros clientes a mejorar sus procesos de negocio y facilitar sus operaciones.Necesitamos incorporar un/a DIRECTOR/A COMERCIAL DEL SECTOR SANITARIO para una empresa de nueva creación del Grupo, con sede en MADRID, para realizar las siguientes funciones:· Dirigir, gestionar y controlar la actividad del Departamento Comercial.· Dirigir, gestionar y controlar la actividad de desarrollo de negocio.· Analizar las necesidades del mercado y de los clientes.· Definir, elaborar, implementar y poner en práctica la estrategia del plan comercial.· Negociar y cerrar acuerdos comerciales.· Liderar, guiar y supervisar a los equipos humanos encargados de la aplicación de la política comercial y los objetivos a cumplir.· Generar informes y realizar seguimiento comercial. Requisitos…· Licenciatura o Grado en Farmacia, Medicina, Biología, Química, Biomedicina etc.· Experiencia demostrable como Director General o Director Comercial en empresas del sector sanitario, farmacéutico o bio-tecnológico.· Experiencia en desarrollo de negocio en empresas privadas y públicas.· Experiencia en gestión de equipos.· Disponibilidad para viajar.· Deseable nivel alto de inglés.· Carnet de conducir.¿Quieres saber qué ofrecemos?· Salario competitivo.· Contrato de trabajo estable.· Flexibilidad horaria.· Desarrollo profesional.· Buen ambiente de trabajo… ¡y mucho más! ¿Quieres saber más sobre nosotros? ¡Visita nuestra página web!https://serviciomovil.com/

THE CHALLENGE At Eventbrite, people are our number one priority. Our goal of building the platform to power live events and experiences for millions globally relies on our strong foundation of people and culture. We are the face of Eventbrite, and responsible for finding, attracting, and bringing on the best of the best to drive Eventbrite’s business and award-winning culture forward. You’ll support both our global Talent Acquisition efforts by scheduling candidates and working with our hiring managers and interview panels across our global offices. THE TEAM Our Talent Acquisition team’s mission is to build pipelines of talent and efficiently hire new Britelings through relationships, influence, branding, and experiences. We have a tight-knit, quick-moving, and fun-loving team of Talent Managers who seek out the best talent for Eventbrite. We believe talent acquisition should be a company-wide effort, that candidate experience comes first, and that hiring should be based on relationships and not transactions.THE ROLEWe are currently hiring a Technical Sourcer for a 12-month contract here at Eventbrite. As a Talent Technical Sourcer, you’re the anchor for our Talent Acquisition team. You'll support both Recruiters and Hiring Managers in attracting and creating a strong pipeline of diverse passive candidates in Europe. Your sourcing skills will play an integral role in helping us build leading-edge engineering and product teams.THE SKILL SET2+ years of technical sourcing experience in a fast paced environment focused on EPD roles (Engineering, Product and Design).Proven track record of leveraging multiple sourcing channels to identify untapped high caliber talent Ability to research and analyze market intelligence to educate Recruiters and Hiring teams on the talent landscapeExperience tracking funnel metrics and data to increase efficiency and effectivenessDemonstrable record of creating compelling outreach messages for drip campaignsAbility to create future talent pools by building relationships with candidates and keeping candidates warm for future opportunitiesWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we’ll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. Applicant P rivacy Notice
industry: Software,Internet

description: En Robotics somos líderes en soluciones de gestión del tiempo y talento de la fuerza laboral. Nuestro software, VisualTime, es utilizado en la actualidad por más de 500.000 personas en miles de organizaciones. A pesar de ello, seguimos trabajando con mentalidad de start-up y ¡no paramos de crecer!Estamos buscando personas motivadas y con experiencia para el desarrollo de nuevas generaciones del software SaaS, con la intención de seguir ofreciendo la mejor solución y experiencia de usuario que exista.Buscamos Desarrollador/a Senior Back-end, para incorporarse de manera estable a nuestro equipo en Sabadell.¿Qué vas a hacer?Formar parte del equipo de desarrollo en la parte de backend, creando controladores, servicios, interfaces e inyección de dependencias.Trabajar con arquitectura de Microsoft Azure de microservicios.Trabajar en un entorno ágil SCRUM, de forma muy colaborativa.Desarrollar, y además, participar en análisis y diseño de las nuevas funcionalidades, ¡aquí escuchamos a todos los miembros de nuestro equipo desde el primer minuto!Crear y mantener código modular, escalable y de alto rendimiento.¿Qué esperamos de ti?Amplia experiencia en .NET Core, C#, ASP.NET y MVC.Experiencia y conocimientos de Entity Framework.Experiencia en base de datos SQL.Con conocimiento de inyección de dependencias e interfaces.Adaptad@ a metodología Git-flow.¿Qué otras habilidades son deseables?Pasión por nuevas tecnologías, calidad de código, arquitecturas limpias y principios SOLIDActitud de mejora continua y proactivaActitud pixel-perfectAdaptabilidad, vivimos en un entorno cada vez más cambiante y rápido. ¿Qué te ofrecemos? Contrato de trabajo indefinido, plan de carrera y un proyecto muy ambicioso y de largo recorrido.Plan de incentivos atractivo.Horarios flexibles y a la carta para conciliar.Teletrabajo varios días a la semana.Acceso a plan de formación.Trabajar en una empresa centrada en producto, VisualTime, con mentalidad “a lo grande”, para llegar al máximo de personas y con un proyecto a largo plazo. Café de George Clooney, con una taza corporativa 😉 incluida.Disfrutar de nuestros meetings y eventos anuales ¡que son lo más! 😊En Robotics estamos creciendo, ¿te gusta el dinamismo y los retos? ¿Quieres unirte a nuestro equipo talentoso y entusiasta? ¡Te estamos esperando!
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información

description: Importante empresa multinacional selecciona para integrar en su equipo técnico un Ingeniero de Ofertas ferroviario para participar en la redacción y gestión de ofertas técnico-económicas de sistemas de señalización y telecomunicaciones ferroviarias.Las funciones asociadas son: - Elaborar y / o supervisar la documentación técnica, económica, administrativa y comercial de las ofertas tanto internacionales como nacionales. - Aportar soluciones adaptadas a las especificaciones y expectativas del cliente, para presentar una propuesta competitiva - Estimar y costear las necesidades de compra de materiales y/o servicios para ofertas, concursos o licitaciones. - Compras en las diferentes oportunidades de la compañía, tanto a nivel local como internacional.Ofrecemos contratación indefinida y participación en proyectos ferroviarios de alcance internacional.Requisitos mínimos﻿Ingenieros técnicos o superiores de Electrónica Industrial, Telecomunicaciones o Informática.Será necesario aportar, al menos, 2 años de experiencia desarrollando las funciones descritas en proyectos/productos de alta criticidad (naturaleza industrial). Manejo de SAP y MS Project: avanzado. Nivel de inglés: avanzado.
industry: Transporte por carretera o ferrocarril,Software

description: En butic queremos reforzar nuestro equipo comercial/ventas, para lo que queremos incorporar a una persona que debe tener experiencia profesional en ventas y cierre de matrículas de formación de postgrado. butic the New School, centro de formación de referencia para estudios vinculados con el sector AECO (Architecture, Engeneering, Construction and Operations), requiere incorporar a un perfil alineado con las necesidades y la realidad de la empresa, la cual se encuentra en un momento de crecimiento y expansión internacional.Nuestro proyecto educativo liderará la Transformación Digital del sector de la Arquitectura, la Ingeniería, la Construcción y las operaciones vinculadas (AECO) en España y Latinoaméricabutic es a fecha de hoy, el único Centro de Formación Oficial simultáneamente autorizado en España por parte de la totalidad de multinacionales implicadas en este tipo de estudios, tales como Autodesk, Adobe, Chaos Group, Itoo Software o EPIC Unreal Engine, así como socia y/o centro autorizado de Building Smart, PTEC o la IFMA.butic The New School es un proyecto aprobado por el CDTI, entidad pública dependiente del Ministerio de Ciencia, Innovación y Universidades (Gobierno de España).¿Cuál será tu misión? La persona seleccionada deberá tener una sólida experiencia comercial en venta de formación online en directo, muy orientada a resultados y logrando el objetivo de ventas de la empresa en los diferentes programas, asesorando, orientando y cuidando al potencial alumno hasta su matriculación final.¿Cuáles serán mis funciones y responsabilidades?Gestionar la cartera de clientes asignada, ejecutando procesos de venta desde la prospección hasta el cierre y tanto de alumnos presenciales como onlineCumplir las políticas comerciales y procesos operativos establecidosContribuir al conocimiento del mercado, la definición del público objetivo y sus necesidades, el análisis de la competencia, salidas profesionales, etc.Participar en acciones de RR.PP. (ferias, foros, viajes, entrevistas, etc.) que potencien la imagen y conocimiento de la compañíaColaborar en el desarrollo de promociones comerciales, materiales y medios necesarios para comunicación y venta de los programasSe requiere:Formación media-superiorPersona empática, organizada, disciplinada y apegada a procesosPasión por la calidad, actitud positiva y proactivaOrientación a resultados y al trabajo por objetivosAlta capacidad de negociación y persuasiónEs necesario contar con muy buenas habilidades comunicativasMínimo 2/3 años de experiencia y resultados demostrables en áreas comerciales del sector EDUCACIÓN, venta directa y/o televentaConocimiento de Office y sistemas de CRMPasión por las ventas que aportan alto valor al clienteSe ofrece:Contratación estableSueldo base y altas comisiones por consecución de objetivosPrestaciones superiores al convenioBuen ambiente de trabajoOrganización representativa en nuestro sector y ser corresponsable del mejor producto del mercado en nuestro sectorOportunidades de carrera y desarrollo profesional, así como formación internaFlexibilidadSe valorará:Formación de postgradoConocimiento del sector educativo (grado, postgrado, formación para adultos o executive)Alto sentido de la responsabilidadInfluencia y presencia social en alguna de las áreas en las que operamos

Desde GTB (Grupo Ogilvy, Multinacional de Publicidad) buscamos un Data Engineer para el departamento de Data y Tecnología. ResponsibilidadesParticipación en evolutivos, correctivos y nuevos desarrollos del área de Data.Asegurar el correcto delivery de los nuevos desarrollosAyudar en la resolución de incidencias.Monitorizar el correcto funcionamiento de los procesos bajo su responsabilidad.Evolucionar la plataforma y proponer mejoras sobre los procesos.Experiencia:+ 2 años de experiencia trabajando en departamentos de Data/Análisis/ases de Datos/Programación / Business Intelligence Formación:Formación ciclo formativo superior, Ingeniería Técnica, Ingeniería Superior o Grado en Informática (o similares) Idiomas:Inglés nivel medio Conocimientos:Modelado de BBDD relacionalesProgramación de PL/SQL profunda. Triggers, procedimientos, funciones,Funciones analíticas, estructuras de tablas anidadas,Control de versiones subversion, git.Manejo de Toad , PL/sql devloper, sql developer, MSSQL server studioProgramación y estructuras Sql ServerConocimiento de entornos transaccionales normalizos y entornos de DW.Procesos de normalización de informaciónManejo de estructuras en XMLVBA y Excel deseableTrabajo y conocimiento en cloud azure.Valorable:Valorable conocimientos de anonimización, cifrado y scrambling de datos.Valorable trabajo con compliance GDPR.Valorable conocimiento en BBDD no estructuradas y almacenamiento Cloud.Valorable nociones de Big Data.Valorable conocimiento de herramientas de gestión de maestros y Data quality.Valorable conocimientos de Microsoft Dynamics (entorno, CRM). Gestión del software y entorno vinculado a la gestión del dato.Valorable experiencia en automoción, seguros.Valorable experiencia en el análisis de Call Centers.Valorable conocimiento de Qlick view, Tableau, Spotfire, Microstrategy, Business objects.Valorable conocimientos de ETL ODI, Talent, Data Factory,Valorable conocimientos de B2B, B2C. Competencias:Entusiasmo, orden, rigor, templanza, pensamiento lógico y trabajo en equipoOrganizado y estructurado. Optimista y enérgico.

description: Si has finalizado tus estudios de grado, es el momento de decidir con quién quieres empezar tu camino profesional. Volkswagen Group España Distribución te ofrece la oportunidad de unirte a una gran compañía, en la que podrás participar directamente en diferentes proyectos con impacto directo en el negocio y donde tus propuestas e iniciativas contribuirán a los resultados de la empresa.En el Internship Program la compañía te ofrece unas prácticas de 12 meses en la división de Group After Sales, en el departamento de Quality, que se combinan con la realización de un Master in Management and Digital Business in the Automotive Industry en ESIC Business & Marketing School, parcialmente subvencionado por la empresa. ¡Experimenta ser la mejor parte! La persona seleccionada dará soporte en el área de desarrollo red y señalización, garantizando el mantenimiento y actualización de BBDD de la red de servicios oficiales en cuanto a procesos y señalización, contratos de altas y bajas y demás modificaciones pertinentes.Por otra parte, en el área de Market Intelligence, dará soporte en la gestión de estudios de mercado aplicables a las áreas de posventa y ventas.Tus funciones serán, entre otras:Revisión y validación de contenidos de los cursos formativos:Revisar la calidad y propuesta pedagógica de diferentes cursos de formación de varios perfiles.Recopilar información de necesidades para la elaboración de contenidos.Gestión del proceso de selección y validación de perfiles de posventa:Supervisión, seguimiento y respuesta del trabajo del proveedor.Control general de los procesos en curso.Gestión de salas para Assessment.Ejecución del Procedimiento de control centralizado de Estándares de Formación:Análisis de incumplimientos por parte de la Red.Revisión de incumplimientos en una BBDD coordinación con el dept. de auditorías y logística.Supervisión envío estatus mensual de fichas de status de cumplimiento de estándares a la Red.Preparación fichas de status estándares a Presidencia y Dirección.Participación en diferentes proyectos del departamento:Planificación Plataforma de formación.Coordinación con Team Leaders y departamento de logística en relación a las actividades formativas.Elaboración de presentaciones.Proyecto TALENTIA de búsqueda de talento futuro.Otras tareas administrativas asociadas al puesto:Validación usuarios Ágora.Listados ocupaciones en LEMA.Apoyo a la logística de los cursos.¡Tu talento tiene infinitas posibilidades
location: El Prat de Llobregat, Cataluña, España

description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite has built its business on empowering event creators with solutions to enable their success. In the process, we have touched millions of customers, helping them get together, explore their interests, and pursue their passions through live experiences. Now, we’re embarking on a journey to further connect our consumers and organizers through delightful commerce experiences.To help us deliver on this ambitious vision, we are on the hunt for a rock-star Product Manager who puts the customer first, is passionate about user experience and lives and breathes data to make decisions. Sounds like you? Let’s talk.THE TEAMYou’ll be joining a global team of experienced and talented Product Managers, Engineers and Designers who are focused on building a product that empowers and enables customers to participate in great live experiences. We are passionate about events, motivated, collaborative, and a fun-loving team responsible for a high-growth, global business. THE ROLEYou will be responsible for defining a vision, strategy and leading a team in executing a roadmap for Eventbrite’s checkout experience. You will make data-driven product decisions supported by both metrics and user research. You will work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders and will collaborate with product managers, engineers, and designers within and across other business units. Your ultimate goal is to build a high quality product that drives engagement from customers.YOU WILLLead the ideation, research, design, development and launch of user-centric commerce productsUnderstand user needs; identify and define product requirementsCreate clear goals for the team. Drive product development with a world-class team of Engineers, Designers and Analysts to deliver impact for our business and usersUse data and metrics to inform your strategy and success criteriaTHE SKILL SET3-5 years of product management experiencePassion for live events, frequently attending events and buying tickets onlineSelf-starter with a solid track record of execution and resultsProven ability to work cross-functionally, collaborate, influence and work as part of a teamData-driven, analytical problem solverUser-first mindset with experience in user research and testingExcellent written and oral communication skillsBONUS POINTSExperience with user facing productsExperience or knowledge of eCommerce platforms / marketplacesWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we’ll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite is seeking Full-stack Software engineers to join us in our mission to bring the world together through live experiences. Last year alone, our platform processed over 150 million tickets across over 3 million events organized by our creators. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to build features, design APIs, and scale our product as we grow.THE TEAMWe're a people-focused Engineering organization: the women and men on our team value working together in small teams to solve big problems, supporting an active culture of mentorship and inclusion, and committing themselves to learn new things daily. Pair programming, weekly demos, tech talks, and quarterly hackathons are at the core of how we’ve built our team and product. We believe in engaging with the community, regularly hosting free events with some of the top technical speakers, and actively contributing to open source software. Our technology spans across web, mobile, API, big data, machine learning, search, physical point of sale, and scanning systems.Our engineering teams own their services and systems end to end from requirements gathering to deployment to maintenance. Team members follow an on-call rotation to ensure any issues are mitigated immediately and root causes are rectified.THE ROLEWe seek Full-stack Software engineers who are passionate about their craft to join our engineering team in Spain, although we’re remote friendly. We’re currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. Teams usually consist of front-end engineers, backend engineers, a product manager, a designer, Technical program manager, and an engineering manager. You will solve challenging technical problems and own your impactful products end-to-end. You will contribute to Eventbrite engineering’s culture of technical excellence through inclusivity and mentorship. This is more than an opportunity to join an amazing team, it is a chance to impact Eventbrite’s platform and organization at scale.THE TECH STACKEventbrite is one of the world’s largest Django-powered sites by request volume. Python, Django, and MySQL are the primary off-the-shelf technologies in our stack. We are hosted on AWS. PySOA, our services framework builds on these core technologies. On the frontend, we make extensive use of React and Redux. However, the company is transitioning to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where each team will have complete ownership and autonomy.THE SKILL SETYou have 1+ years of experience building applications in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, JS, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.You have 1+ years of experience using some form of web framework: Django, Symphony, Rails, ASP.net , etc.You experience in building responsive web pages using a combination of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript with recent experience in ES6Experience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality. Passion to learn and to mentor others English and Spanish conversational to advanced levelBONUS POINTSYou have experience working with modern frontend frameworks: React, Backbone/Marionette, etcExperience with state management frameworks like Redux.Experience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.Experience using non-relational databases like Elasticsearch and Redis Comfortable developing in a container environment like Docker Familiarity with continuous integration tools like Jenkins or CircleCI What We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we’ll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. description: The time is now to start your next career step at Celonis, one of the fastest growing global tech companies worldwide!Celonis is the execution management system leader. Powered by its market-leading process mining core, the Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications, with a developer studio and platform capabilities for business executives and users. The Celonis EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions, and automations. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Celonis has thousands of global customers including ABB, AstraZeneca, Bosch, Coca Cola, Citibank, Dell, GSK, John Deere, L’Oréal, Siemens, Uber, Vodafone, and Whirlpool. All rely on Celonis technology to unlock their full execution capacity and drive change to business processes. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York, US, and has in total 15 offices worldwide. The company has grown 5,000% in 4 years and 300% in the past year. In 2019, Celonis reached a $2.5 billion valuation, after receiving a $290 million Series C funding round. Celonis is continuously expanding, especially in Europe to be able to serve the local markets. Recently offices were opened in Paris, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Madrid, as Center of Excellence for international tech talent. Particularly in these uncertain times Celonis plays an impactful role in helping customers to use their execution capacity the best way possible. At Celonis, we believe that every company can unlock their full execution capacity - and for that we need you as a Workday HRIS Senior Analyst in Madrid with experience in Corporate Treasury or related finance field. This role is critical to building a best in class Treasury department! Your Responsibilities:Support for Workday HCM & Integrated Business Applications (Core HR, Absence, and Advanced Compensation).Analyze user experience and adoption, determine common pain points, develop content, and deliver targeted trainings as such to facilitate enablementOffer technical solutions to gain process efficiency and improve data integrityContinually enhance the Workday platform, including reporting and analysis capabilities, to meet ever-changing business requirementsCollaborate with HR Operations to develop and implement new features/enhancements.Modify and redevelop business processes and condition rules based on client requirementsSupport new feature implementations by assembling data, gathering workbooks, developing test plans, and supporting UATResearch and troubleshoot system issues/errors and educate end-users on Workday best practices and functionality.Document system policies, adoption plans, and best practices to ensure Workday scalability across global business.Maintain system access and modify tenant security as needed.Requirements: 3+ years of Workday HCM experience in a hands-on-capacity (Minimum of 2 years system experience)Experience with Workday report writing (Advanced, Matrix, Dashboards, Calculated fields) Strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to anticipate needs and resolve issues proactively.Ability to partner with HR/Talent Acquisition to analyze and define business goals and requirements, translate requirements into functional and technical designs, and implement relevant solutions within Workday HCMYou are exceptional at communicating concepts and ideas to stakeholders, in different shapes depending on the contextWe:See people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individual alongside with the strength finder test Offer attractive compensation models (best-in-class salary, stock option packages, employee referral bonus, family service, flexible working hours, …)Are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the worldAre experts in the field of Process Mining - the new Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications: the EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automationsDistinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible workCelonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

description: We are papernest.We have a dream, a world without paperwork. A world where administrative phobics like us live finally protected from the anguish of the forms filling and surcharges for late payment.On the other hand, we will not lie to you, there is much work to do. That’s why we are looking for committed, creative and enthusiastic people like you to accompany us in the adventure.Since 2015, we have never been idle. With 3.5 million moves a year in France, and 76% of French people stressed by this event, we decided to attack the subject starting with this opportunity. As a result, we have created the only platform that allows you to transfer all your contracts during your relocation, 100% free, 100% online. At the time of our sixth anniversary, we are more than 750 employees, we have accompanied over 800 000 users, and we opened an office in Barcelona.We see things in a big way: a team of ideas bubbling around the globe, a future where our entire administrative life is just a click away.As an international company, listed on the French Tech 120 and based on the vibrant Poblenou district, we are looking for a HR Controlling and Compensation & Benefit Manager. With a direct report to the Head of HR for Spain, you will be the main responsible for all the Compensation & Benefits policies update and analysis. You will also be the leader for all the data related to HR with the EMEA target operating model.You will also be responsible for providing a high level of service through efficient and effective support to internal customers in regards to Compensation & Benefits, Legal & Labor relation and Global Mobility fulfilling the KPIs and objectives defined.Your missionsEnsuring and monitoring monthly payroll and HR Admin processes.Supporting Comp&Ben proposals, Employee Relations, HR Administration Processes, People Services and Analytics, HR Reporting and HR Budget control.Monitoring government regulations, legislation, compensation & benefits trends, researching, benchmarking and analyzing benefit plans, programs and policies.Administering papernest’s benefits programs (e.g., insurances, meal vouchers, flexible compensation etc.) liaising with the benefits providers/brokers and managing the enrolment, renewal, and distribution processes, ensuring C&B plans are cost-effective and competitive.Managing the global mobility/relocation processes overseeing the sponsorship of work visas and partner with Legal and Company Practises and Conditions to ensure a smooth mobility process.Spearhead global expansion efforts by helping to establish human resource infrastructure in new countries when required.Monitoring organization’s salary structure and benefits, balancing cost control with the need to attract and retain staff.Following our offboarding process partnering with internal/external stakeholders.Security and Labor Inspections procedures as well as in specific initiatives like Works Councils collective bargaining negotiation and litigation trials preparations, acquisitions, mergers or restructuring impact assessments (dismissals, etc).Your profile:You come from an extensive HR Admin technical background in the areas in scope, owning Payroll, C&B and HR Operations improvement.You have 5+ years working in HR with an emphasis on People Operations; experience working at a global company with national and international brands/site, and a rapid growth start-up environment preferred.You have knowledge of legal and employment-related requirements within Spain (other countries will be valued).You have lead Project Management and HRIS deployment will be highly valued.You have the ability to organize operations and optimise processes.You are also defined by your ability to demonstrate a high degree of confidentiality.Other requirements:Bachelor Degree in Business Administration or an HR Analytics specialisation and you are a master in Excel.Experience in managing and developing teams <5 people.You are friendly, committed and very professional working environment being part of a high impact HR team.Languages:Fluent in Spanish and English (written and oral), French could be a plus.Why papernest?You will be working with talented, smart, and great peopleYou will have high responsibility and autonomy to make as much impact as you can imagineYou will be working in a fast-growing and internationally expanding company with great opportunities for you to step up in your careerYou will work in a meritocracy with test-and-learn and fear-nothing attitude where truths rule and politics have no spaceYour manager:Your manager will be Pauline, Head of HR Management Spain. In search of sunshine, she left her native Normandy to move to Barcelona and join papernest in 2020. Always ready to launch new projects, Pauline will share her ideas with you with enthusiasm! In her free time, she enjoys many activities (hiking, sewing, museums, sports, ...) and loves to gather her friends to share good meals around board games. If you are ready to play the game, we look forward to meeting you!Recruitment process:First call with Elena, Talent Acquisition.Interview with Olivier, our CHRO.Interview with PaulineBusiness caseIf this challenge is yours, we look forward to meeting you!papernest is a disability-friendly company.Remote work applicable upon the company policies.

And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. description: THE CHALLENGE Eventbrite is seeking a Senior Backend Software Engineer to join us in our mission to bring the world together through live experiences. Last year alone, our platform processed over 150 million tickets across over 3 million events organized by our creators. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to build features, design APIs, and scale our product as we grow.THE TEAMWe're a people-focused Engineering organization: the women and men on our team value working together in small teams to solve big problems, supporting an active culture of mentorship and inclusion, and committing themselves to learn new things daily. Pair programming, weekly demos, tech talks, and quarterly hackathons are at the core of how we’ve built our team and product. We believe in engaging with the community, regularly hosting free events with some of the top technical speakers, and actively contributing to open source software. Our technology spans across web, mobile, API, big data, machine learning, search, physical point of sale, and scanning systems.Our engineering teams own their services and systems end to end from requirements gathering to deployment to maintenance. Team members follow an on-call rotation to ensure any issues are mitigated immediately and root causes are rectified.THE ROLEWe seek Senior software engineers to join our Ticketing & Inventory team who are passionate about their craft to join our engineering team in Spain, although we’re remote friendly. We’re currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. Teams usually consist of front-end engineers, backend engineers, a product manager, a designer, Technical program manager, and an engineering manager. You will solve challenging technical problems and own your impactful products end-to-end. You will contribute to Eventbrite engineering’s culture of technical excellence through inclusivity and mentorship. This is more than an opportunity to join an amazing team, it is a chance to impact Eventbrite’s platform and organization at scale.THE TECH STACKEventbrite is one of the world’s largest Django-powered sites by request volume. Python, Django, and MySQL are the primary off-the-shelf technologies in our stack. We are hosted on AWS. PySOA , our services framework builds on these core technologies. On the frontend, we make extensive use of React and Redux. However, the company is transitioning to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where each team will have complete ownership and autonomy.The SkillsetYou have 4+ years of experience building applications at scale in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.You have 2+ years of experience using some form of web framework: Django, Symphony, Rails, ASP.net , etc.You have 2+ years of experience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc.You are an efficient, practical programmer with a record of designing and producing dependable code.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality.You are a results-driven self-starter with great communication and collaboration skills; we put a lot of emphasis on being team players.You enjoy teaching and mentoring colleagues.BONUS POINTSExperience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.You have knowledge of microservices and/or Service Oriented ArchitectureYou have experience working with modern frontend frameworks: React, Backbone/Marionette, etcYou have experience designing and developing APIs, both internal service and HTTP APIsWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. description: THE CHALLENGE Eventbrite is seeking a Senior Backend Software Engineer to join us in our mission to bring the world together through live experiences. Last year alone, our platform processed over 150 million tickets across over 3 million events organized by our creators. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to build features, design APIs, and scale our product as we grow.THE TEAMWe're a people-focused Engineering organization: the women and men on our team value working together in small teams to solve big problems, supporting an active culture of mentorship and inclusion, and committing themselves to learn new things daily. Pair programming, weekly demos, tech talks, and quarterly hackathons are at the core of how we’ve built our team and product. We believe in engaging with the community, regularly hosting free events with some of the top technical speakers, and actively contributing to open source software. Our technology spans across web, mobile, API, big data, machine learning, search, physical point of sale, and scanning systems.Our engineering teams own their services and systems end to end from requirements gathering to deployment to maintenance. Team members follow an on-call rotation to ensure any issues are mitigated immediately and root causes are rectified.THE ROLEWe seek Senior software engineers to join our Ticketing & Inventory team who are passionate about their craft to join our engineering team in Spain, although we’re remote friendly. We’re currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. Teams usually consist of front-end engineers, backend engineers, a product manager, a designer, Technical program manager, and an engineering manager. You will solve challenging technical problems and own your impactful products end-to-end. You will contribute to Eventbrite engineering’s culture of technical excellence through inclusivity and mentorship. This is more than an opportunity to join an amazing team, it is a chance to impact Eventbrite’s platform and organization at scale.THE TECH STACKEventbrite is one of the world’s largest Django-powered sites by request volume. Python, Django, and MySQL are the primary off-the-shelf technologies in our stack. We are hosted on AWS. PySOA , our services framework builds on these core technologies. On the frontend, we make extensive use of React and Redux. However, the company is transitioning to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where each team will have complete ownership and autonomy.The SkillsetYou have 4+ years of experience building applications at scale in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.You have 2+ years of experience using some form of web framework: Django, Symphony, Rails, ASP.net , etc.You have 2+ years of experience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc.You are an efficient, practical programmer with a record of designing and producing dependable code.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality.You are a results-driven self-starter with great communication and collaboration skills; we put a lot of emphasis on being team players.You enjoy teaching and mentoring colleagues.BONUS POINTSExperience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.You have knowledge of microservices and/or Service Oriented ArchitectureYou have experience working with modern frontend frameworks: React, Backbone/Marionette, etcYou have experience designing and developing APIs, both internal service and HTTP APIsWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we’ll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite is a people-first organization. Our goal of building the global platform for live experience relies on the foundation of top talent and strong company culture. Our team is the face of Eventbrite, and we’re charged with finding, attracting, and bringing on the best of the best to drive Eventbrite’s growing business and award-winning culture forward. Hiring the best talent globally is no easy feat. However, we have a talented team who has an inspiring story and mission. Our perfect candidate is someone who can connect that vision and story with top-notch talent.THE TEAMWe're a people-focused Engineering organization: the women and men on our team value working together in small teams to solve big problems, supporting an active culture of mentorship and inclusion, and committing themselves to learn new things daily. Pair programming, weekly demos, tech talks, and quarterly hackathons are at the core of how we’ve built our team and product. We believe in engaging with the community, regularly hosting free events with some of the top technical speakers, and actively contributing to open source software. Our technology spans across web, mobile, API, big data, machine learning, search, physical point of sale, and scanning systems.Our engineering teams own their services and systems end to end from requirements gathering to deployment to maintenance. Team members follow an on-call rotation to ensure any issues are mitigated immediately and root causes are rectified.THE ROLEAs a Software Engineer in the Listings Team, you’ll have a direct impact on the users purchasing tickets from Eventbrite; you’ll work on the page that the attendee faces before starting the Checkout flow.You will own the logic that defines how this page will be rendered, which options will the user have and how the user proceeds to the Checkout page to commit the actual purchase. Technically, this involves talking with different services, such as the ones responsible for delivering the price ranges, the event description, or creating the order itself.You will partner closely with the rest of the Creator and Commerce teams to handle the inventory details, the details of the event provided by different services and the different information shared with the Checkout process.THE TECH STACKOur primary stack for our front-end code is written in React. We use libraries such as React Testing Library, Cypress or Storybook.Most of our back-end code is Python and Django, all running on Amazon AWS with a MySQL database. Some of the other tools that we use are Git, Datadog or Splunk.THE SKILL SET7+ years building applications in a mainstream programming language, ideally Javascript3+ years of experience with a front-end framework, ideally ReactYou have experience in building responsive web pages using a combination of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript with recent experience in ES6Efficient, practical programmer with a record of producing maintainable codeAbility to take initiative and produce results with great communication and collaboration skillsYou care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality.Passion to learn and to mentor othersEnglish and Spanish conversational to advanced levelBONUS POINTSExperience in back-end development, ideally with Python or Node.js You have experience designing and developing APIs, both internal service and HTTP APIsExperience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, etcActive Eventbrite user with a passion for live eventsWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite is seeking a Staff Backend Software Engineer to join us in our mission to bring the world together through live experiences. Last year alone, our platform processed over 150 million tickets across over 3 million events organized by our creators. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to build features, design APIs, and scale our product as we grow.THE TEAMOur team’s mission is to have a unified, stable and performant Order Processing experience across Eventbrite. Ordering is a Tier 1 service, all orders in Eventbrite go through our services, which implies we have a great responsibility, as a consequence of this the team is currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. We expect an important growth of physical events in the following months, we are doing full rewrite to improve our scalability, availability and innovation and we need people to help us scale our services, from design to implementation.THE ROLEWe seek staff software engineers who are passionate about their craft to join our engineering team in Spain, although we’re remote friendly. We’re currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. Teams usually consist of front-end engineers, backend engineers, a product manager, a designer, Technical program manager, and an engineering manager. You will solve challenging technical problems and own your impactful products end-to-end. You will contribute to Eventbrite engineering’s culture of technical excellence through inclusivity and mentorship. This is more than an opportunity to join an amazing team, it is a chance to impact Eventbrite’s platform and organization at scale.THE TECH STACKThe Eventbrite stack lives in AWS and primarily consists of React and native apps on the frontend and a mix of Django and SOA on the backend. We have python, node and golang in our application layer. We have a mix of datastores with a strong MySQL presence. However, this team is about to start a migration to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where the team will have complete ownership and autonomy. We will do a full rewrite of the ordering system and we expect you to participate not only in the implementation but also in the decision making, ranging from design to choosing our stack.TTHE SKILL SETYou have 5+ years of experience building applications at scale in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.Experience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.You have knowledge of microservices and/or Service Oriented Architecture.Comfortable with leading large cross-functional initiatives, and collaborating with engineering teams and other stakeholders.Good understanding of Web Service, API, REST and RPC.You are an efficient, practical programmer with a record of designing and producing dependable code.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality.You are a results-driven self-starter with great communication and collaboration skills; we put a lot of emphasis on being team players.You enjoy teaching and mentoring colleagues.BONUS POINTSExperience with distributed systems and large scale systemsWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. description: THE CHALLENGE Eventbrite has built its business on empowering event creators with solutions to enable their success.In the process, we have touched millions of event creators and consumers, helping them get together, explore their interests, and pursue their passions through live experiences. Our suite of creator product tools which help creators create, manage, and market their event programs is a critical part of the value we need to deliver.To help us deliver on this ambitious vision, we are on the hunt for an energetic Product Manager who puts the customer first, is passionate about user experience and lives and breathes data to make decisions. Sounds like you? Let’s talk. description: THE CHALLENGEEventbrite is seeking Full-stack Software engineers to join us in our mission to bring the world together through live experiences. Last year alone, our platform processed over 150 million tickets across over 3 million events organized by our creators. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to build features, design APIs, and scale our product as we grow.THE TEAMWe're a people-focused Engineering organization: the women and men on our team value working together in small teams to solve big problems, supporting an active culture of mentorship and inclusion, and committing themselves to learn new things daily. Pair programming, weekly demos, tech talks, and quarterly hackathons are at the core of how we’ve built our team and product. We believe in engaging with the community, regularly hosting free events with some of the top technical speakers, and actively contributing to open source software. Our technology spans across web, mobile, API, big data, machine learning, search, physical point of sale, and scanning systems.Our engineering teams own their services and systems end to end from requirements gathering to deployment to maintenance. Team members follow an on-call rotation to ensure any issues are mitigated immediately and root causes are rectified.THE ROLEWe seek Full-stack Software engineers who are passionate about their craft to join our engineering team in Spain, although we’re remote friendly. We’re currently through a transition to a pure Devops culture. We strive for teams completely autonomous and with full ownership of their services and roadmaps. Teams usually consist of front-end engineers, backend engineers, a product manager, a designer, Technical program manager, and an engineering manager. You will solve challenging technical problems and own your impactful products end-to-end. You will contribute to Eventbrite engineering’s culture of technical excellence through inclusivity and mentorship. This is more than an opportunity to join an amazing team, it is a chance to impact Eventbrite’s platform and organization at scale.THE TECH STACKEventbrite is one of the world’s largest Django-powered sites by request volume. Python, Django, and MySQL are the primary off-the-shelf technologies in our stack. We are hosted on AWS. PySOA, our services framework builds on these core technologies. On the frontend, we make extensive use of React and Redux. However, the company is transitioning to a completely new stack (such as Kotlin, DynamoDB, Lambdas, gRPC, Step Functions, etc) where each team will have complete ownership and autonomy.THE SKILL SETYou have 1+ years of experience building applications in at least one popular programming language, such as Python, JS, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, etc.You have 1+ years of experience using some form of web framework: Django, Symphony, Rails, ASP.net , etc.You experience in building responsive web pages using a combination of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript with recent experience in ES6Experience using a SQL database: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, etc.You care about making sure your code is maintainable and well tested.You have a holistic approach to quality. Passion to learn and to mentor others English and Spanish conversational to advanced levelBONUS POINTSYou have experience working with modern frontend frameworks: React, Backbone/Marionette, etcExperience with state management frameworks like Redux.Experience with cloud services in AWS, Azure, or Google.Experience using non-relational databases like Elasticsearch and Redis Comfortable developing in a container environment like Docker Familiarity with continuous integration tools like Jenkins or CircleCI What We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. description: THE CHALLENGE At Eventbrite, people are our number one priority. Our goal of building the platform to power live events and experiences for millions globally relies on our strong foundation of people and culture. We are the face of Eventbrite, and responsible for finding, attracting, and bringing on the best of the best to drive Eventbrite’s business and award-winning culture forward. You’ll support both our global Talent Acquisition efforts by scheduling candidates and working with our hiring managers and interview panels across our global offices. THE TEAM Our Talent Acquisition team’s mission is to build pipelines of talent and efficiently hire new Britelings through relationships, influence, branding, and experiences. We have a tight-knit, quick-moving, and fun-loving team of Talent Managers who seek out the best talent for Eventbrite. We believe talent acquisition should be a company-wide effort, that candidate experience comes first, and that hiring should be based on relationships and not transactions.THE ROLEWe are currently hiring a Technical Sourcer for a 12-month contract here at Eventbrite. As a Talent Technical Sourcer, you’re the anchor for our Talent Acquisition team. You'll support both Recruiters and Hiring Managers in attracting and creating a strong pipeline of diverse passive candidates in Europe. Your sourcing skills will play an integral role in helping us build leading-edge engineering and product teams.THE SKILL SET2+ years of technical sourcing experience in a fast paced environment focused on EPD roles (Engineering, Product and Design).Proven track record of leveraging multiple sourcing channels to identify untapped high caliber talent Ability to research and analyze market intelligence to educate Recruiters and Hiring teams on the talent landscapeExperience tracking funnel metrics and data to increase efficiency and effectivenessDemonstrable record of creating compelling outreach messages for drip campaignsAbility to create future talent pools by building relationships with candidates and keeping candidates warm for future opportunitiesWhat We OfferAt Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.We Care About Your Mental Health And WellbeingOur employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our cultureWe offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEOWork-life balance is extremely important to usOur employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.About EventbriteEventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.Is this role not an exact fit?Sign up to keep in touch and we’ll let you know when we have new positions on our team .Eventbrite is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff, and applications from all suitably qualified individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. description: UNIR, Universidad líder en formación online, está en continua búsqueda de personas con talento para su desarrollo en el ámbito de la docencia y la investigación. Si te apasiona la educación universitaria y su innovación a través de la tecnología, este es tu proyecto. Únete a una institución en pleno crecimiento y expansión internacional, formada por más de 4.000 profesionales y con más de diez años de experiencia que la convierten en referente de educación superior online en español.Queremos incorporar nuevos docentes e investigadores en alguna de las principales áreas de conocimiento de la Facultad de Ciencias de la Salud. Ofrecemos colaboraciones en varios momentos del curso y con diferente disponibilidad, desde acuerdos puntuales hasta jornadas más amplias y estables.Facultad de Ciencias de la Salud: Medicina, Enfermería, Psicología clínica, Psicología forense, Neuropsicología, Gestión Sanitaria, Farmacia, Fisioterapia, Óptica, Oftalmología, Logopedia, Personalidad, Evaluación y Tratamiento Psicológico.Responsabilidades: Impartición de docencia y corrección de actividades en titulaciones de Grado o Postgrado. Dirección de trabajos fin de titulación. Preparación y corrección de exámenes. Requisitos: Titulación superior. Contar con experiencia docente en el campo de especialización. Contar con experiencia profesional en el campo de tu especialización. Requisitos recomendables: Estar en posesión de un Doctorado. Estar acreditado por ANECA en sus diferentes niveles. Se valorará positivamente tener concedido algún sexenio de investigación. Competencias: Habilidades de comunicación Competencias digitales Innovación docente Orientación al alumno Planificación Compromiso
industry: Enseñanza superior

description: Desde Penteo buscamos un Senior Consultant para formar parte del equipo de Madrid y ser responsable de proyectos con nuestros clientes en los siguientes ámbitos: Digital, Infraestructuras y Gobierno TI, organización y tecnologías emergentes. Asimismo, participará en la preparación de las ofertas, acciones de soporte experto en la gestión de cuentas.Se ofrece desarrollo profesional hacia la dirección de análisis o bien como Account Manager - Digital Advisor con la responsabilidad de asesorar a clientes y desarrollo el negocio con ellos.Penteo, analista TI independiente, desde hace 25 años lidera una de las mayores Comunidades de Conocimiento TIC de España para acompañar como asesor independiente a las organizaciones en su digitalización y gestión TI.En Penteo cada profesional aporta una experiencia y skills únicos que suponen el motor para su desarrollo y nuestro éxito.Únete a Penteo y participa en un proyecto único que te dará la oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente. Nuestros valores de rigurosidad, conocimiento del mercado e independencia permiten posicionarnos como partner de referencia en nuestros clientes. Responsabilidades:Interlocución con C-Level, asesorándoles en su estrategia digitalAsesoramiento a clientes sobre estrategia, gobierno, organización y tendencias TIDefinición de programas de transformación digital del negocioRealización de Assesments y Proyectos en el ámbito TIRedacción de informes de tendencias TI y artículos especializadosParticipación como ponente en conferencias y seminariosLiderazgo y gestión de equiposResponsabilizarse de la dirección y gestión de proyectosRealización de ofertas a clientes y soporte preventa en acciones comercialesContribuir a la innovación constante de nuestros productos y serviciosRequisitos:Ingeniero Informático o Telecomunicaciones o titulación equivalente en áreas de tecnologías de la información+5 años de experiencia en el sector tecnológicoLiderazgo y gestión de equiposSe valorará especialmente experiencia en consultoría tecnológicaConocimiento del mercado TI: tendencias, tecnologías emergentes, Aplicaciones, modelos de Gobierno TI, etc.Vocación de desarrollar tu carrera en consultoría TI de alto nivelCapacidades lógicas y analíticasHabilidades de comunicación verbal y escritaValorable: Certificación PMP, Prince2, ITIL,Scrum, Agile, etcOfrecemos:Incorporación a un equipo innovador en pleno proceso de crecimientoDesarrollo profesional en el ámbito de la asesoría digitalFormación constante en tecnologías de la informaciónBuenas condiciones salarialesBuen ambiente de trabajo

description: En Grupo Ezentis seleccionamos a un Técnico/a de Soporte de Nivel 2 para la gestión de incidencias y cambios en aplicaciones de provisión y sistemas OSS de una importante empresa de Telecomunicaciones.La persona seleccionada se incorporará en nuestro equipo de Soporte de Madrid.Funciones:Gestión e interlocución con terceros (otros proveedores, fabricantes, desarrollo, otras áreas de la organización del cliente, etc.) para garantizar la resolución de las incidencias, hasta su resolución.Apoyo técnico en la resolución de incidencias, coordinando las incidencias complejas entre equipos multidisciplinares.Gestión de los problemas localizando la causa de raíz con herramientas de análisis y pruebas para detectar posibles bugs y la corrección de los mismos.Tareas de ingeniería de sistemas relacionadas con la arquitectura, integración y mejoras en las aplicaciones y sistemas implicados en esos entornos, así como la colaboración en la resolución de incidencias surgidas en estos sistemas.Elaboración de informes de situación de las incidencias de mayor severidad.Elaboración de informes sobre la disponibilidad y rendimiento de las aplicaciones.Promover planes de mejora y sostenibilidad de la aplicación.Gestión de Peticiones de Cambios programados sobre los sistemas gestionados y colaboración con los equipos técnicos en la implantación al cambio.Identificar, recomendar, configurar y activar controles orientados a la detección de incidencias, la automatización de la administración y mejora.Requisitos mínimos:Experiencia mínima de 3 años en un puesto
