description: Descripción de la oferta:Vacca Enginyeria & Refrigeració, es una empresa líder en el sector de la Refrigeración yClimatización Industrial que dispone de 70 años de experiencia y actividad industrialininterrumpida.Durante todo este período hemos atendido las instalaciones de nuestros clientesprofesionalmente, aportándoles rapidez y fiabilidad en las tareas realizadas.El departamento de SAT requiere de un perfil de Reparador, Mantenedor Frigorísta con unacategoría de Oficial de primera para desempeñar las tareas descritas en lo referente amaquinaria industrial destinada en procesos productivos e instalaciones de climatizaciónindustrial.Se requiere de la persona solicitada:Experiencia laboral mínima de 5 años.Resida en la zona del Vallés Oriental.Carnet de Conducir B.Conocimientos de instalaciones de refrigeración industrial (Enfriadoras de agua, Rooftop, equipos A/A, Cámaras de conservación y congelación).Conocimientos de instalaciones de climatización industrial.Conocimientos de instalaciones de calefacción Industrial (calderas y generadores de calor funcionamiento a gasoil y gas).Conocimientos de mecánica de fluidos en lo referente a instalaciones hidráulicas y ventilación que despenden de las centrales productoras de refrigeración y calefacción.Capacidad de análisis en los trabajos efectuados.Metodología en el desarrollo de los trabajos de diagnóstico y reparación.Capacidad de trabajo en equipo.Disponibilidad para realizar servicios de guardia.Disponibilidad y capacidad para realizar puestas en marcha y averías fuera de la comunidad autónoma.Liderazgo y decisión en la ejecución de los trabajos asignados.Compromiso.Capacidad de dialogo con el cliente.Buena presencia.

description: Being part of an innovative and disruptive gaming company is your dream? This challenge is for you!We are looking for a Full Stack developer who wants to join a TOP gaming company to cooperate, innovate and share inspiration. First things first... top project details!- Company/team: their motto is to move "Fearlessly Forward" together. Cooperative innovation is at the center of everything they do: from their games, new products and technologies, to how they collaborate and share inspiration with one another. - Values: they understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they're trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect their products and processes. Their forte lies in the diversity of their skills - and that comes from the diversity of their people. - Day to day: you'll join an international team working in one of their 6 squads (e-commerce, Fintec, Sports...) with your teammates. Your mission 🚀Work on both server-side and client-side development for a variety of exciting n-tier enterprise projects. Design and develop code, put it into action and support projects on the application level. You'll be responsible for coding from the very beginning until production environment, collaborating in an international and inclusive environment. Write, maintain and document unit and integration test, and write up new and modified functionality. Work closely with Technical Leads and Architects to make their software design and quality unbeatable. You'll be building, owning and running applications. You'll be also operating, observing and learning to make it better. Perks, my friend!Flexible Timetable100% remote until the end of the year.Relocation Package: they help with every aspect of your move: removals, storage, travel and house-hunting. Plus 2 months free accommodation while you're looking. Soft Landing: help with all the life admin - from sorting your social security number to setting up a Spanish bank account. They'll even help find a school for your kids. The Workshop Bus: a private bus running between Malaga city centre and their office. Language Classes free: Spanish or English tuition every week. Medical Insurance: cover for primary healthcare, family medicine, paediatrics and dental. Learning: they encourage you to develop your skills through training courses and qualifications. They also go to a lot of tech conferences as exhibitors, speakers and attendees. Social Events: regular events include: learning Lab, Thirsty Thursday, seasonal events, summer and Christmas parties, sporting competitions, a football team and more!Sabbatical for every four years of service: you have the chance to take six weeks paid leave. Massage Service Soft Drinks and Fresh FruitGames RoomIf this is you – holy cow! 🐄Demonstrated backend skills (multithreading, OOP, etc.) and/or strong frontend skills.Good understanding of web based applications (HTTP protocol, Web Servers, Caching, etc.).Good testing practices (unit, component and E2E testing). Understanding of the data modeling. Agile approach to development. Continuous integrations tools. Positive, growth mindset and creativity while problem-solving. Collaborative, team player attitude and good communication skills in English. Curiosity to learn new languages/frameworks. If this is also you – JACKPOT! 🍒🍒🍒Experience working with Java or some JavaScript framework (Angular, React or Vue).Previous experience building tools (Maven, NPM, Webpack) as well as version control systems (Git). ﻿Let’s have a chat and GetWith us! 😊
industry: Internet

description: From Hays Executive we are looking for a Managing Director for an important multinational group distributor of medical equipment located in the Rivera of Navarra. 	The Managing Director will report to the European Executive Director located in Germany and will be the maximum responsible in Spain managing the daily business through department managers: Finance Manager, HR Manager, Sales Manager & Operations Managers. His functions will be to follow the strategy from headquarters, responsible for P&L , incomes, company expenses, new products and company coordination. Manage overall operations and is responsible for the effective and successful management of labour, productivity, quality control and safety measures.	It is a requirement to have ten years of experience managing multinational companies and a high level of English. We value the experience as Managing Director in multinational distributor companies or a similar role in the animal care sector. We are looking for graduates in ADE, business, economics or related careers, preferably with MBA. We value profiles with strong analytical skills, managing and leadership ability, also reporting and communications skills.	You will be part of a growing multinational company where you can make a difference and develop your professional career.	 If you are interested in this offer, click on "apply now" to send an updated copy of your CV, or call us now. If this offer does not suit your profile but you are looking for a new job, please contact us and we will discuss it. We guarantee confidentiality.
location: Navarra, Comunidad Foral de Navarra, España

description: POR QUÉ NOS VAS A ENCANTAR  En IKEA consideramos que todas las personas tienen un talento que ofrecer. Buscamos personas que empaticen con los clientes, compartan nuestros valores y estén dispuestos a probar nuevos retos. Si todos te piden consejos sobre cómo decorar tu hogar y siempre estas dispuesto a ofrecerles nuevas soluciones, trae tu talento a VENTAS.   QUÉ HARÁS DÍA A DÍA  Tu misión como vendedor/a, es identificar los distintos tipos de clientes según su necesidad de compra y ofrecerles una experiencia de compra divertida, cómoda y satisfactoria para incrementar las ventas. Ofrecer una atención personalizada desde el primer contacto con el cliente.  Mostrar soluciones de decoración del hogar llenas de inspiración. Garantizar la satisfacción de los clientes, de forma eficiente y eficaz utilizando todos los medios y los canales de venta disponibles. Asesorar sobre los productos, su funcionalidad y sus características, además de dar a conocer a los clientes todos los servicios que facilitan la compra.Requisitos:•	Experiencia laboral como vendedor/a•	Soltura en manejo de herramientas informáticas (office 365...)•	Valorable formación/conocimientos en decoración o diseño de interiores•	Valorable soltura en manejo de herramientas de diseño (REVIT, AUTOCAD, SKETCHUP...)•	Altas dotes comerciales y de negociación•	Vocación de servicio al cliente•	Disponibilidad para trabajar en jornadas parciales•	Capacidad de organizar el trabajo propio y apoyo al resto del equipo   NUESTRO EQUIPO EN IKEA  Desde IKEA tenemos el compromiso de hacer un mejor día a día para la mayoría de las personas. Todos los colaboradores/as de IKEA disfrutan de un amplio paquete de beneficios que están a tu disposición desde el primer día, aquí te contamos alguno de ellos: Ofrecemos un salario competitivo distribuido en 12 pagas anuales más 2 pagas extras en los meses de julio y diciembre, con un amplio abanico de horarios en jornada continua con los descansos que establece la ley, respetando tú tiempo libre fuera de IKEA.  Para que disfrutes al máximo de tus descansos, en nuestro comedor de empleados puedes encontrar gran variedad de productos a precios muy económicos, subvencionados en 2/3 por IKEA.  Porque la confianza de trabajar en un lugar seguro es la base para nuestro crecimiento personal y profesional, en IKEA contamos con un servicio médico a tu disposición para cualquier consulta. Además de ofrecer un entorno de trabajo seguro para garantizar unas buenas condiciones de trabajo.  Te ofrecemos el 15% de descuento en todas tus compras.  Porque formas parte de la gran familia IKEA queremos compartir contigo los momentos importantes, por ello celebramos aniversarios, fiestas, Teams Buildings, la llegada del verano, regalo de Navidad. ¡Siempre hay un motivo para sonreír!   Muchos más te están esperando, ¡descúbrelos!
industry: Venta al por menor

description: En Sopra Steria trabajamos para hacer posible la transformación digital de nuestros clientes y para conseguirlo necesitamos seguir creciendo y sumando gracias a personas como tú. Con presencia en más de 25 países y con más de 44.000 colaboradores, nuestra misión es unir talento y proyectos, tratando de ayudarte a que encuentres un lugar en el que poder desarrollar todo tu potencial.¿Te atreves a crear el futuro?Para acompañarnos en este camino, estamos buscando un perfil de Programación con experiencia de al menos 1 año en tecnología Java/J2EE tanto para el desarrollo de Frontend como de Backend.Te integrarás en un gran equipo de Desarrollo en uno de nuestros principales proyectos de Santander.En la parte FRONT utilizarás JAVA, Javascript, JQuery, HTML5, CSS, AJAX, AngularJS y Angular2. En la parte BACK utilizarás JAVA (con sus frameworks Hibernate y Spring).No buscamos la perfección, pero nos gustaría que pudieras aportar:- Experiencia de al menos 6 meses en desarrollo Java/J2EE- Experiencia como desarrollador/a web con conocimientos de Angular, Java, Javascript, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, API¿Qué ofrecemos?Porque sabemos lo que necesitas…•	Facilidades para ti, para tu tiempo. ¡No todo va a ser trabajo!•	Participa en proyectos retadores. ¿Te animas a aprender algo nuevo?•	Crece con un programa de desarrollo continúo personalizado•	Disfruta de nuestros Beneficios y accede al Plan de retribución flexible•	Smart Sessions ¿Tienes algo que contarnos?•	Para que te sientas parte del equipo: GymForLess, pádel, running… y un fisio por si acaso!¡Atrévete a trabajar de una forma diferente y conócenos!

Why join frog?Joining frog means you’ll be joining the “pond,” a global network of studios, each with a thriving in-person and vibrant virtual culture. frogs are curious, collaborative, and courageous, united by our passion for improving the human experience through design, while each bringing our unique and diverse skills and experiences to the table. We draw on our global reach and local knowledge to solve complex problems and design innovative, sustainable solutions that touch hearts and move markets. frogs prize humour, positivity, and community just as highly as performance and outcomes. Our culture is open, flexible, inclusive, and engaging. Working at frog means being empowered to Make Your Mark on every project, in your studio, your community—and the world at large.As a Senior UX/UI Designer, you look beyond point solutions and apply design-led thinking to deliver new multi-channel service strategies, ecosystems, or even new businesses to the markets. You gel well with designers and non-designers, thrive in a highly collaborative environment and know how to tell a compelling story. You are a thorough, lateral thinker, who can pull up the sleeves and dig deep to deliver rewarding experiences. Your passion for Service Design is infectious.You Are Responsible ForAs a Senior UX/UI Designer, you LEAD service design activities for existing or new propositions within our full portfolio, through:Design service experiences with lasting impact based on understanding of user needsDevelop service blueprints and customer journeys articulating existing and envisioned service experiences integrating stakeholder needs, multi-channel touch points, and back-end service delivery systemsExplore and articulate options for service propositions beyond product propositions based on knowledge of customer context andproduct/service business approaches and trendsCreate and test ways of generating revenue from new service propositionsPlan and lead co-creation workshops with clients, partners and customers as part of analysis and design of new servicesWork within multidisciplinary teams to design internal business systems, processes, and capabilities required to deliver envisionedservice experiencesWork closely with other designers to realise relevant touch points across the end-to-end service experienceCreate and test service prototypes to gain insight into assumptions and questions of service deliveryWork at varying levels of fidelity to test isolated assumptions as well as holistic service experiences.Create user focused strategies, innovations, solutions and experiences and the user testing and validation of these, considering usability, sustainability and appropriate visual and verbal articulation in line with Design Language System and Brand guidelinesDrive operational excellence and efficiency, delivering appropriate design quality within budget and project parametersCustomer focus and Design consultancy, collaborating, partnering and co-creating with internal and external stakeholders, with clear and impactful communication and articulation of design decision makingCreative or content leadership on high complexity project or program level and/or setting the standard with high level of content specialismProvides design thought leadership to senior business stakeholders, actively drives co-create approaches between Design and other stakeholdersLeads larger projects or programs, able to influence direct environment to create enabling conditions for success, to define delivery strategies and manage program level design quality reviewsWe Would Love It If You HadBachelor/Master degree in Design, Design Research or related discipline, or equivalent professional Design training experience.Track record of leading complex and large scale, transformational and/or multiple simultaneous projects with decentralised teamsThought-leadership on design processes, methodology, culture, technology etc. able to articulate complex matters clearly to outsidersDemonstrable design advocacy and mentoring skills to provide strategic and tactical design directionStrong influencing and expectation setting skills against real-world limitationsSubstantial day-to-day coordination skills (resources and process) to maintain high design standardsEntrepreneurial, humble, quick-thinking and exceptionally creative capabilities paired with a keen sense of humourQualified Candidates Must Present An Online Portfolio ThatDemonstrates a passion for digital product developmentExhibits stylistic breadth, attention to detail, and balances beauty, innovation and usabilityShows experience with diverse content and subject matterProves their facility in translating high level ideas into unique visual styles and directions, and breaking those down to elemental levelEqual Opportunities at frogfrog is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.frog is a global business with teams working from every corner of the world. To help us process your application, please ensure that your application documents (CV, cover letter, portfolio, etc.) are all in English.

description: UNIR, Universidad líder en formación online, está en continua búsqueda de personas con talento para su desarrollo en el ámbito de la docencia y la investigación. Se valorará positivamente tener concedido algún sexenio de investigación. description: Do you love helping people all over the world? Do you thrive under pressure? Do you value autonomy and independence in your work?Are you a methodical person? Good time-management and personal organizational skills are essential.Passion about technology, assuming learning process never endsFluency in English & Spanish (other languages are a plus)Interest in working in a strongly growing international company.Exposure to retail and/or fashion IT systems (POS, ERP, etc.) is a plus.*Nextail is an equal opportunity employer. description: The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history. With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape. Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience. In 2018 we launched <vpTech/> - the IT community of Veepee. Our teams are widely distributed within the offices in Paris, Lyon, Nantes, Nice, Barcelona, Brussels, Warsaw, Amsterdam and Tel-Aviv.As an ML Engineer, you will join our Data Science Team, which is fully cloud-native and distributed between Paris, Barcelona and Brussels.Your mission will be to build, deploy and maintain the state of the art machine learning algorithms for various use cases such as recommender systems, targeting, churn prediction, demand forecasting and more!Responsibilities:Build and improve the data science stack;Train, version and deploy machine learning models at scale in a cloud environment;Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability etc;Keep improving your technical knowledge and expertise by attending conferences, contributing to open-source projects, reading and presenting a state of the art papers and organizing and attending meetups.Requirements:At least 3 years experience in a data science environment;Strong knowledge of Python, SQL, Tensorflow is a bonus;Experience with feature engineering, machine learning deployment and serving;Used to work in a cloud environment (GCP, AWS, Azure,...);Proficiency with version control Git;Prior experience with deploying containers on a platform like Kubernetes and its ecosystem (Istio, Grafana, Prometheus, etc) is a big plus;A strong team player, willing to share knowledge with other team members and help out where needed;You have strong verbal and written English language skills.What we offer:The dynamic and creative environment within international teams;The variety of self-education courses on our e-learning platform;The participation in meetups and conferences sponsored by vpTech locally and internationally;Up to 3 days of remote work per week;Video games, beer and quiz parties with colleagues.Belonging to Veepee, <vpTech/> is one of the biggest Tech community in Europe with more than 1000 IT collaborators around Europe.From Warsaw to Barcelona, through Lyon, Nantes, Lausanne, Tel Aviv, Brussels, Nice, Amsterdam and Paris, all our projects are developed in a functional environment with a wide skills variety where you’ll be sure to find your place, no matter the technology you want to work with.If you love to try things why don’t you jump on this new adventure?Need more info > https://careers.vente-privee.com/en/vptech/

Analizar el sell-in y el sell-out por marca (intercambio de datos o Nielsen cuando esté disponible) y compartir aprendizajes / plan de acción con el resto de la empresa. Adaptar el surtido por retailer y/o tipo de tienda. Informar sobre los precios al consumidor, respetando escrupulosamente la Ley de Competencia Europea y Española.Monitorear actividad e iniciativas de la competencia (lanzamientos, POSM, etc. )Elaborar y reportar previsiones de ventas periódicas. Identificar nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento y recomendar un plan de acción. Visitar periódicamente las tiendas clave del cliente para comprobar la implementación del acuerdo nacional (surtido, merchandising, manejo de obsoletos, rotacion) y establecer una estrecha relación comercial con las tiendas clave o “PRO´s”.Alcanzar los objetivos cuantitativos de MH España:Negociar aumentos de precio.Contribuir a definir e implementar una estrategia para reducir la brecha en 3xnet entre clientes en España y dentro de MH Europa.Aumentar la participación de mercado de MH en cada retailer, centrándose en impulsar la tasa base de venta.Incrementar el NSI del cliente mediante optimización promocional. Alcanzar los objetivos cualitativos de MH España:Ser selectivo en la distribución, definir el rol de cada minorista (estratégico / no estratégico para MH).Vender y supervisar la implementación de una visibilidad cualitativa en las tiendas para desarrollar la imagen y la deseabilidad de las marcas de MH: merchandising, exhibidores, activaciones.PERFIL DEL CANDIDATOIdiomas: Espanol e Ingles avanzado. Experiencia profesional: +3 anos en posiciones de Key Account Manager regional o nacional. Experiencia en companias de consumo masivo, trade marketing y category management sera muy valorada. Comodo/a y agil con el manejo de numeros y conocimiento de P&L. Manejo de herramientas de ventas (Nielsen, Excel, Bases de datos). description: MissionThe Almirall Research team in Barcelona is strengthening its core immunology department and is looking for a talented senior immunologist with experience in translational science. The team is enabling the chemical and biologics pipeline from discovery up to preclinical development, and is responsible for delivery of high quality therapeutic lead candidates with a high potential for success in clinical development. Tasks and ResponsibilitiesKey responsibilities include but are not limited to:Propose targets and shape discovery strategy in view of early validation and clinical success. Primary focus is on immune-inflammatory diseases in the field of dermatology.Work in a highly cross-functional environment to align biologics and NCE strategy from early project initiation to clinical potential.Ensure projects address significant unmet need and have a high likelihood to translate from target hypothesis to patient benefit.In alignment with the disease strategy and new product planning teams, position new project concepts and design and execute experimental plans to drive target candidates into preclinical development.Contribute to decision making process in new project initiation and evaluation of external opportunities.Build and maintain effective relationships with academic and industry collaborators and advisors.Education & ExperiencePh.D. and/or M.D. in relevant scientific area and minimally 5 years of experience in an industrial environment.Sound background in human immunology and translational research.In-depth knowledge and track record in leading NCE or biotherapeutic projects. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in translational dermatology. Strong project leadership and experience in cross-functional teams. Excellent communication skills and ability to influence team decisions. Strong decision maker capable of simultaneously working of several fast-paced projects.

description: MissionWe are seeking a talented immunologist to design, execute and lead new drug development efforts from early discoveries to preclinical stages. As a successful candidate, you will be part of a dynamic cross-functional team dedicated to finding new therapeutic options for autoimmune and inflammatory skin disease. The scientist will have the opportunity to act as project team lead, and champion drug development programs by driving highly collaborative efforts with peers, stakeholders and external partners. You are expected to design and conduct research, as well as to oversee a team dedicated to identifying and validating new targets up to transition to preclinical development. We are looking for a senior immunologist who is passionate about using her/his deep understanding of autoimmune and inflammatory disease to make impactful contributions to clinical drug development, from exploratory research to preclinical development.Tasks and ResponsibilitiesProvide exceptional technical knowledge and leadership to drive drug discovery projects, working with a cross-functional team that includes clinical scientists, bioinformatics and discovery scientists.Translating exploratory hypothesis into a strategy to develop preclinical candidates with the ability to simultaneously lead and/or support more than one project.Have deep scientific expertise of cellular and molecular human immunology to champion, oversee and execute new drug development projects starting from early hypotheses.Design, perform and execute the development of key internal capabilities (tools, assays, workflows, etc.) to study human immunity at the molecular and cellular level, mentoring other peer scientists as well as external collaborators.Present experimental results and research plans to multiple audiences.A key responsibility is to enable complex cross-functional projects that involve internal and external partnerships, using your deep knowledge in immunology and ability to coordinate and influence scientific collaborations to lead drug development efforts.Education & ExperiencePh.D. in Molecular/Cellular Immunology or related field with successful postdoctoral studies and preferentially experience in drug discovery gained in an industrial environment.Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in human immunology including deep understanding of T, B and NK and myeloid cell biology. Knowledge of Treg biology is preferred. Ability to design and execute complex flow cytometry assays as well as experience with cell sorting is essential. Demonstrated cell biology expertise including cell line engineering (cell lines and primary leukocytes) using CRISPR and imaging techniques (confocal, time-lapse microscopy, etc.) will be given preference. Experience in single cell RNA-seq sample preparation and data interpretation is desirable.Expertise is mouse immunology and in vivo studies would be a plus.Recognized success in carrying out independent projects in autoimmune disease and inflammation is preferred, ideally demonstrated by relevant publications in the field. Leadership, collaborative spirit, self-motivation and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously while delivering results under tight deadlines. Candidates with demonstrated experience supporting and leading cross-functional teams are highly encouraged to apply.Strong communication skills in English is a must. Ability and enthusiasm to collaborate, lead and motivate peers and collaborators, critically evaluate data and articulate solutions to complex projects to achieve demanding project goals is necessary.
location: Sant Felíu de Llobregat, Cataluña, España
industry: Industria farmacéutica

description: Inetum es una compañía de servicios ágil que proporciona servicios y soluciones digitales y un grupo global que ayuda a compañías e instituciones a aprovechar al máximo el flow digital. En un contexto de continuo movimiento, en el que las necesidades y los usos se reinventan constantemente, el grupo Inetum se compromete con todos esos actores a innovar, seguir adaptándose y mantenerse a la vanguardia. Con su perfil multi-experto, Inetum ofrece a sus clientes una combinación única de proximidad, organización sectorial y soluciones de calidad industrial. Presente en más de 26 países, el Grupo tiene cerca de 27.000 empleados y en 2019 generó unos ingresos de 2.300 millones de euros (pro forma). Precisamos incorporar a importante proyecto de uno de nuestros clientes, un/a Ingeniero/a en DevOps, con los siguientes requisitos: Perfil 1 (Orientado a Infraestructura y Seguridad) - Ingeniero DevOps:• Experto en Linux, Kubernetes, Helm, Contenedores (Docker, Podman, Buildah etc), Terraform.• Experto en Infraestructura y Seguridad Cloud.• Experto GCP y OpenShift (V4 o superior). También en Ansible y Python.• Experiencia en proyectos como ingeniero DevOps en proyectos en GCP y OpenShift.• Experiencia definiendo procesos de CI/CD.• Experiencia implantando soluciones de IaC y GitOps.Perfil 2 (Orientado a implementación de pipelines con Groovy y Spinnaker)- Ingeniero DevOps/QA:• Experto en Linux, Kubernetes, Helm, Contenedores (Docker, Podman, Buildah etc).• Experto en implementación de pipelines de CI, con Jenkins (Groovy).• Experto en implementación de pipelines de CD con Spinnaker.• Con conocimientos de GCP y OpenShift (V4.x).• Experiencia en proyectos como ingeniero DevOps.• Experiencia definiendo e implementando pipelines de CI/CD para tecnologías Java, Angular y Python.• Experiencia implantando soluciones de IaC, CaC y GitOps.• Experiencia definiendo buenas prácticas en la definición de los pipelines y las librerías de código.• Experiencia con herramientas de Monitorización (Prometheus, Grafana etc)Se ofrece:Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportadaPlan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimientoPlan de formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes.Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte, etc.Flexibilidad horaria

description: Zeppelin Metrology es una empresa española ubicada en Madrid, dedicada a la distribución integral de equipamiento de medida con un alto componente tecnológico, ofreciendo soluciones de vanguardia en la metrología tridimensional de no contacto y en la microscopía electrónica con microanálisis.RESUMEN:Persona para dar soporte técnico y de aplicaciones a la red comercial y al cliente finalDemostraciones de productos, informes de medida, instalaciones y cursos de formación a clientesSoporte postventa continuado a la base de clientes tanto remoto como presencial.Instalación, calibración y mantenimiento preventivo de los equipos del clienteREQUISITOS PROFESIONALES3 años de experiencia como Ingeniero de aplicaciones o Ingeniero Servicio Técnico en metrología industrial, microscopía electrónica, sistemas ópticos o sector afín.Ingeniería, licenciatura en ciencias, o capacitación técnica afín al puestoEXCELENTE nivel de inglésDisponibilidad para viajar por la península ibérica y ocasionalmente otros países.Orientación al clienteSE VALORARAExperiencia en utilización de sistemas de medida 3D, MMC, textura superficialMicroscopía electrónica de barrido a nivel usuarioMicroscopia óptica avanzadaConocimientos de metrología dimensional, mapas de fabricaciónConocimientos de otros idiomas: portugués, etcMISIÓNRealizar demostraciones de los equipos de medida 3DInstalaciones, calibraciones y mantenimientos preventivosCursos de formación a clientesSoporte postventa remoto y presencialElaboración de informes de medidaSE OFRECETrabajo en sector innovador de alto componente tecnológicoFormación avanzada en metrología óptica 3D y microscopía electrónicaOTROS REQUISITOSLugar de trabajo en MadridPasión por el contacto con el cliente y la tecnología, autonomía y decisiónCÓMO PARTICIPARSi eres un o una profesional que busca un reto profesional, con ganas de trabajar en proyectos tecnológicos de última generación esta es tu oportunidad. Para unirte a nosotros, debes enviar un correo electrónico con tu CV y una carta de presentación a support@zeppelinmet.comSOBRE ZEPPELIN METROLOGY (www.zeppelinmet.com) Zeppelin Metrology está comprometido a aportar valor y mejorar los procesos de medición tradicionales en el entorno industrial y de investigación, apoyándose en modernas tecnologías 3D y su capacidad para configurar soluciones específicas a las distintas necesidades de nuestros clientes Zeppelin Metrology, proporciona soluciones innovadoras en el campo de la microscopia electrónica y el microanálisis tanto para el control de calidad industrial como en el mundo de la nano y microtecnología, el análisis forense y las ciencias de la vidaActualmente buscamos Técnic@ Especializado para Soporte Postventa Integral para dar soporte a la red comercial y al cliente final.

Be part of something bigger!BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.Our vision for Peripheral Intervention at BDOur Peripheral Intervention (PI) business unit offers a comprehensive range of medical products, devices and services for the treatment of peripheral arterial and venous disease, cancer detection, and end-stage renal disease and maintenance.About the roleAn exciting opportunity has arisen to join the Sales division at BD. The position will report into the Sales Lead.We continue to grow through outstanding and innovative driven products and the clinical and market knowledge of our sales team. This is an opportunity to join a professional and inspiring team, helping to continue our growth and success in changing clinical practice and surgical techniques.Main responsibilities will include:Understand and sell efficiently within the local business model and partner framework.Proficient disease, therapy and product knowledge and leveraging said knowledge in selling situations with clinical and non-clinical partners.Deep knowledge of health-economics and tender processes, with potential to influence key decision maker criteria for impactful outcomes.Uncover and develop partner needs, both for clinical and non-clinical partners, including benefit-based solutions and effective handling of partner objections.Segment accounts and target/allocate resources and budget appropriately, including tracking targets and outcomes through SFDC.Understand, align with BD policies and serve as an ambassador for BD with internal/external partners in multiple settings.Match selling skills and messaging appropriately and leverage relationships between partners to move business objectives forward.Engage in self-development, including attendance in sales meetings, professional skills trainings and product trainings.Performance metrics:Delivery of quarterly objectives set with Sales Manager.Completion and regular analysis/updates of Business Plans for key strategic accounts, including sales targets against forecast and quarterly action plans.Corporate CRM updates (SFDC), including timely entries of sales calls, call objectives, outcomes and next steps for accounts and key partners.About youWe are looking for someone with University/College degree in Life Science, with validated experience in sales within medical devices or biotech industry and proficiency in English. You will also bring:Sales experience in Peripheral Interventional business, knowledge of disease state and related therapies with competitive knowledge.Uncover and develop partner needs, both for clinical and non-clinical stakeholders, including benefit-based solutions and effective handling of partner objections.Influence and negotiate based on value, with potential to create ideal bargaining positions that result in increased margins.Develop and influence key decision, making criteria in favour of BDI Peripheral Interventional therapies, including resolution of risks and concerns.Understand, interpret and sell with clinical data to impact key decision making criteria with different partners.Willingness and ability to travel and with a clean driving record.Click on apply if this sounds like you!Why join us?A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here our associates can fulfill their life’s purpose through the work that they do every day.You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program — which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components — is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates.Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, or any other protected status.To learn more about BD visit https://emea.jobs.bd.com/

description: We are seeking a talented, self-motivated Business Development Manager to join our team in Spain. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-growing team shaping the future of OOH advertising while bringing programmatic trading into this impactful channel.The Business Development Manager will be acquiring and working with our most strategic clients. You will maintain a high level of customer satisfaction by building long-term strategic partnerships with our clients and ensuring that their experience with the Hangry Media platform is transformative for their business. You will also take an active role in defining how our business and products evolve by representing the voice of the client. Responsibilities• You have demonstrated strategic sales account management expertise, strong knowledge and understanding of the programmatic ecosystem, ability to foster C-level relationships and a passion for growing our clients’ business• With a strong consultative approach, provide service and support to Hangry media owners enabling business, ensuring optimum platform knowledge and usage and driving overall revenue growth for the client• Lead and support revenue and account planning for our clients while creating the conditions for business growth• Plan and execute quarterly strategic and operational business reviews to evaluate needs, strategic direction and identify growth opportunities • Coordinate product feedback and ensure up to date knowledge and training of all platform features• Develop and strengthen relationships with key business stakeholders• Manage all day-to-day client operations with focus on delivering a world-class account management service• Report on KPIs, market feedback, business forecasting and goalsQualifications• 3+ years of experience in similar roles, with a successful track record of reaching and exceeding business goals and revenue targets• Demonstrated strong strategic sales account management expertise• Excellent understanding of advertising technology, programmatic exchanges, digital  & static targeting, tracking and related trading models • Experience of working with/for media owners and sound understanding of their interaction with commercial and technical partners• Ability to foster executive level relationships and liaise with senior stakeholders, demonstrating retention and growth strategies• Ability to navigate a large organization but remain agile to the needs of a new business unit• Ability to educate and transition customers to a new method of trading, but protect a core business• Fluency in English & Spanish

We provide high-quality technical services in innovation-driven industries such as automotive, aviation, rail and energy, as well as Industry 4.0 and IT projects. Our employees benefit from exciting challenges at recognized companies, as well as diverse career opportunitiesWe are looking for:We are looking for an accomplished Software Development with Experience in Python + Django, to help our client build and maintain high quality and scalable code in an strategic internal tool for 3D bsuiness.The main goal of this service is to keep alive and develop new features of an internal R&D tool to analyze telemetry data about 3D printer jobs. The tool is mainly written in python. Another assignments include developing python scripts to facilitate analysis of our R&D engineers and other scripts that run inside the printers using firmware libraries.Responsibilities:The tool is already developed and working but there always requirements to develop new features, give support, fix bugs among others.Education and Experience:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience.3+ years of successful SW Development experience in pythonKnowledge and Skills:Hands-on programming experience in Python + DjangoWeb (Angular JS). Bug fixing, solve issues and do the maintenance.Micro services structure. Install, configure, debug and maintain the following (the infrastructure is being migrated) applications/technologies:o RabbitMQo MongoDBo REST APIo Dockerso Nginxo SQLo Gito Cloud accessWe offer:To join to an R&D environment within one of our main clients, the market leader in measurement science.FREELANCE or Permanent contract by Ferchau, we are one of the Top's european Engineering and IT services providers, adding value for the main Engineering and IT companies.30 holiday days.Annual balance.International work environment and having contact with totally multidisciplinary work teams.Amazing client's facilities located in Barcelona.

description: WeGetFinancing (https://wegetfinancing.com) is operated by Emerging Payments Technologies, a USA company with offices in New Jersey. Our product is a real-time Purchase Finance Gateway that allows consumers to obtain instant financing from numerous lending sources when making a purchase online at a participating merchant's website. This position is for a remote contractor. (EST or CET timezones).We want to grow our development team, located across Europe, and we are looking for a Quality Assurance engineer.What you will doAs part of the WeGetFinancing development team, you will be responsible for the QA processes of our platform's different components.You will be the first QA profile to join an existing engineering team by supporting the current team in test automation. Your role will be essential as part of the development process to validate and test our builds before they hit production.You will participate in biweekly sprints, develop detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and cases.You will work with a modern stack using innovative frameworks using Python 3 and React, being constantly on the edge of the technology.If you are a very passionate QA engineer that follows engineering best practices and in search of constant growth, this offer is for you, giving you day-to-day challenges and learning opportunities.Job descriptionWe are looking for a QA Engineer to support our current engineering team with the QA processes of our main product. As part of your job, you will be responsible for developing and executing exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.After some time working on the team, you will learn and understand how the WeGetFinancing platform and infrastructure work, with its plugins and APIs. As part of your responsibilities, you will need to help the team identifying bugs before they hit production and implementing a strong QA flow for our different Jenkins pipelines. You will be creating reports of the QA status of the various builds before they hit production.What you need to bring+2 years of experience with Python.Experience with pytest, cypress, selenium, robot framework, or similar testing tools.Experience with Jenkins or a similar environment.Writing docker containers and managing them with docker-compose.Basic knowledge of AWS.University degree in Computer Science or related.Fluency (both written and spoken) in English.Bonus points ifPrevious experience with Agile methodology.Knowledge of Git and git-flow.Knowledge of relational databases and SQL language.Linux/Unix knowledge.Experience creating or consuming REST APIs (JSON, XML) and Swagger/OpenAPI.Experience with eCommerce and payment methods.Links to GitHub/BitBucket public repositories with relevant projects, pull-requests, or any open source project participation.We offerCompetitive salary.Full remote position.Standard vacations package (national holidays + standard holidays).

Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.Right now, we are on the lookout for talented Java Engineers to join our Elasticsearch - Distributed Systems team and focus on critical features that affect how Elasticsearch scales and provides reliability to our users. This team maintains critical components of Elasticsearch such as snapshot/restore and replication. You can be based (pretty much) anywhere in the world.What You Will Be DoingPushing the limits on the number of shards, nodes, and petabytes that Elasticsearch can handle todayEnsuring users can reliably backup and restore Elasticsearch at scaleBuilding and enhancing fundamentally hard features such as cross-cluster replication or a changes APIProviding enhanced capabilities for data management Look into all kinds of issues, including performance or concurrency issues, and propose solutions.Supporting our support engineers with the harder problems.What You Will Bring AlongYou have strong skills in core Java and are conversant in the standard library of data structures and concurrency constructs, as well as newer features like lambdas.You have a deep technical proficiency in algorithmsYou have proven your ability to understand and work on complex, highly distributed systems.You are able to take on projects and guide them from beginning to end. This covers both technical design and working with other engineers to develop needed components.You demonstrate the ability to build and debug features with a broad impact on a product and that run on multiple machines.Bonus points for knowledge of:Data storesSearch, analytics, LuceneStrong knowledge of the JDKAdditional Information - We Take Care of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leaveDifferent people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. If you require any reasonable accessibility support, please complete our Candidate Accessibility Request Form.

Gestión de cuentas de acuerdo con las políticas comerciales de la Unidad, para alcanzar los objetivos de venta y rentabilidad establecidos. 2. Establecer y negociar relaciones a largo plazo, el marco anual con cada cliente. 3. Elaborar y Gestionar presupuestos, definir rentabilidad e interlocución con el cliente desde el inicio del proyecto hasta la implementación de este. 4. Participar en los diferentes programas de marketing de la Unidad para crear herramientas (reels, presentaciones corporativas .. etc) que aceleren la venta. 5. Diseñar propuestas comerciales acordes con las necesidades de los clientes junto con la estrategia de precios. 6. Reportar mediante el CRM la actividad comercial y sus principales Kpi's. 7. Manejar una cartera clientes. REQUISITOS *    Licenciado, Diplomado. Valorable Máster.*    Experiencia de al menos 3 años en un puesto de KAM en empresa Gran Consumo, Finanzas, Farma o tecnológica.*    Inglés, deseable

description: Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.The Observability team is in charge of developing solutions that focus on application developers and engineers that run infrastructure and services supporting these applications. Elasticsearch is an efficient datastore for logs, metrics, and application traces, supporting the three pillars of observability. The Observability team builds and maintains solutions that make getting insights from this data turnkey and efficient, such as our APM, Infrastructure Monitoring, Logs, and Uptime solutions. When developing these solutions, we think about the problem end-to-end: how do we automatically collect data from common data sources, how do we store it efficiently in Elasticsearch, how do we present this information to the user, what actions do we take on the insights from the data? All of these aspects are important in bringing a turnkey solution to the market.As a Senior JavaScript engineer on the Observability team, you'll primarily be working on UIs and APIs in Kibana devoted to curated observability users. You'll be working with the UI team and product management to build high quality, intuitive and innovative UIs and robust API to drive the experience.Engineering philosophyWe believe that engineering complex, pluggable software for the web that is built to last the test of time is both tricky and exciting. Doing so requires a team of diverse individuals, with sharp minds and the ability to empathize with our users, working together with mutual respect and a common mission.We care deeply about giving you full ownership of what you're working on. Our company fundamentally believes great minds achieve greatness when they are set free and are surrounded and challenged by their peers, which is clearly visible throughout our organization. At Elastic, hierarchy does not determine how decisions get made. We feel that anyone needs to be in the position to comment on anything, regardless of their role within the company.What You Will Be DoingWork on new and exciting Elastic products.Develop the APM, Logs, Metrics, Integrations, Agent Management UIs and APIs in Kibana.Collaborate with fellow JavaScript engineers.Collaborate with product design, server team, agent engineers and the Kibana team.What You Will Bring AlongJavaScript programming skillsExperience with one modern MVC style JS FrameworkAbility to work in a fast paced start-up environmentExcellent verbal and written communication skills, a great teammate with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging and troubleshooting skillsStrong preference for Open Source experienceAbility to work independentlyYou might haveExperience with React and TypescriptExperience with Node.jsExperience writing automated testsExposure to Observability, Performance or Availability tools or servicesAdditional Information - We Take Care of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leaveDifferent people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. If you require any reasonable accessibility support, please complete our Candidate Accessibility Request Form.

description: KRELL CONSULTING & TRAINING es una compañía de consultoría tecnológica y desarrollos de sistemas IT, con innovación, calidad y capacidad en la formación especializada de sus profesionales y clientes.Nuestro equipo de profesionales cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el sector, lo que ha hecho del conocimiento nuestro principal patrimonio.Sabemos que lo más importante son las personas a las que COMO TÚ orientamos y ayudamos a crecer personal y profesionalmente. Anímate a unirte a nuestro equipo y verás cómo se enriquece tu futuro y desarrollo profesional incrementado con la experiencia de trabajar en equipos multidisciplinares para clientes de primer nivel en diferentes sectores: banca, seguros, telecomunicaciones, utilities o administraciones públicas.¿QUÉ TALENTO BUSCAMOS?Buscamos perfiles de experto en SISnet para cubrir los siguientes roles en un proyecto de implantación de core asegurador:- Analista Programador: 2-3 años de experiencia. Se valorará tanto experiencia funcional como técnica en el desarrollo y la implantación de SISnet en clientes del sector asegurador. Se valorará certificación oficial de Netijam, así como idioma inglés.- Team Leader: Se requiere experiencia previa en integración técnica entre sistemas. Deberá ser capaz de liderar y coordinar el equipo asignado, así como los entregables, y participar en la interlocución con el cliente. Adicionalmente, deberá definir y desarrollar la integración entre SISnet y otros sistemas- Project Leader: experiencia para un proyecto de implantación de core asegurador a nivel internacional. Deberá ser capaz de liderar y coordinar el equipo de proyecto, asi como los entregables, la calidad del mismo, la gestion económica del proyecto y mantener la interlocución con el cliente.Valorable en todos los casos aportar experiencia dentro del sector asegurador o en empresas de producto

description: About The RoleThe EMEA Client Response Data Team requires a Data Research Analyst to provide support for complex data cases that get escalated to our team. You will work closely with Client Service Support, Data Product Management and Data Operations to ensure resolution of these issues. Our analysts are required to research identified issues, ensure timely resolution, and communicate outcomes to all appropriate team members. Timely resolution requires coordinating resources across various data teams. More importantly, you will help in identifying the trends of data cases submitted and come up with strategies to reduce the number of data issues submitted. The position is based in our Data & Development Center EMEA and will report to the Leader of the Client Response Team.Job Responsibilities Demonstrate a high sense of ownership of the issues in the data ticket queue to be responsive and provide timely updates, follow-up, expedition, and resolution. Collaborate strongly with the global data teams Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects. Using project management methodology such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues. Act as an expert regarding investment data points and calculations including new financial regulations (Solvency II, MIFID II, etc.) Understand roles, responsibilities, and expertise of internal stakeholders to expedite issue resolution. Translate requests from internal clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.Qualifications A bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required Proficient oral and written communication skills. Fluent in English. Fluency in Dutch is preferred. Knowledge of other European languages is advantageous. Collaborates well in a team environment, have the ability to communicate and work with team members from diverse backgrounds, in a conscientious and inclusive way. Sensitive to clients’ needs Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data. Strong organizational and time-management skills, capable of handling high volumes of data and meeting strict deadlines You will be collaborating with cross functional teams and leading from the front when it comes to different types of data so experience within data methodology/quality and processes is a big bonus. Previous experience in project management is preferred. A deep customer service focus and strong attention to detail.302_MstarEurServSL Morningstar Europe Services, S.L. Legal Entity

description: QualificationsDegree with a strong record of academic achievement2-6 years of experience in project management preferably in consulting (e.g. in a project management office in the context of transformation projects)Motivation towards the flexibility and agility that is required in a consulting environmentDriven by creating long lasting impactFluent and effective communicating in Spanish and English (verbally and in writing)Flexibility to travelWhat You'll DoYou will design and implement client´s transformation plans and execute wide transformation programs such as operational improvements, KPIs implementation, process improvement, etc.In this role, you will coordinate and follow up on PMO tasks. You will spend your time preparing and driving implementation projects and coaching clients. You will also manage project workstreams largely independently and with the support of a project manager. As you gain experience, you will gradually assume responsibility for delivering parts of transformation projects yourself. You will lead less tenured consultants and clients in your project or workstream and successfully hold client meetings and workshops to achieve the project's objectives.You will also contribute to the development of the firm through participation in internal projects.Who You'll Work WithYou will be based in our Madrid office and will be part of Orphoz, where our mission is to carry through the most complex transformation projects for our clients. You will join a team of consultants and transformation execution experts.In Orphoz, we combine the advantages of a start-up (light hierarchy, autonomy, freedom of expression and initiative) and those of a large group (available resources to develop one’s projects and logistical support).

description: FarmaOffice (www.farmaoffice.com) es un SAAS del sector farmacéutico que ofrece las mejores herramientas tecnológicas para la farmacia (análisis de clientes, comunicación, gestión y presencia online) y que ya está en más de 1.200 farmacias.Para afrontar nuestro crecimiento y escalabilidad de producto, necesitamos cubrir 1 vacante de PHP Developer (Laravel) en nuestras oficinas de Sant Cugat.Buscamos una persona responsable en su trabajo, acostumbrada a resolver problemas, con iniciativa, ganas de aportar y encarar nuevos retos.El candidato podrá crecer dentro del equipo y acompañar la transformación tecnológica de un proyecto con mucho potencial y recorrido tecnológico.¿Qué perfil necesitamos?Mínimo 4 años de experiencia en PHP FW Laravel y/o Symfony.Experiencia en el desarrollo de una arquitectura de proyecto sólida y escalable.Experiencia con REST APIs.Experiencia Back-End PHP, SQL (my, pg), MVC, shellPersona con inquietud por aprender, mentalidad proactiva y creativa.¿Qué más nos gustaría?Experiencia en testing unitario e integración.Experiencia Front-End (Vue, Angular).Experiencia con bases de datos NOSQL y soluciones de Big-data como Elastic o Memcached.Experiencia trabajando en un entorno ágil (SCRUM).¿Qué ofrecemos?Formar parte de un proyecto en crecimiento.Desarrollar proyectos y retos de alto nivel técnico.Buen ambiente de trabajo y horario flexible.Opción de teletrabajo, combinado con presencial en oficina (3 días por semana).Salario en función de los conocimientos y experiencia del candidato.
location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Cataluña, España

description: QualificationsBachelor’s degree; Advanced degree preferredPrior experience in management consulting preferred3-7 years of experience assessing, architecting, and delivering marketing technology, data, and analytics solutions to clients at scaleDeep understanding of and thought leadership around the marketing technology and ad-tech landscape and playersHands on experience with leading marketing cloud platforms and leading point solutions skewing towards data activation and campaign activationGeneral understanding of ad-tech, including integration with DSP’s and bidding enginesExperience that includes managing 1st and 3rd party data and use of customer data platforms, DMP’s, A/B testing, cross channel campaign management, and decision-ing enginesDigital marketing savvy with first level of technical knowledge in some digital marketing disciplines Traffic generation (Search Marketing, display, programmatic, etc); UX, conversion rate optimization, A/B testing; Email marketing; Paid Media,Alternatively strong focus on customer acquisition – managing performance marketing channels (e.g. Search, Programmatic, Social, Affiliate, Email, conversion rate optimization) and/or CLM (e.g., managing customer data, segmentation, and driving personalization of owned channels)Experience in leading evaluations and vendor selection, including writing business requirementsData-driven thinker and problem solverComfortable working with business, IT, and marketing stakeholdersAbility to think quickly and critically on a broad range of marketing technology and digital marketing topics across various verticalsStrategy oriented, with deep expertise in business and wide knowledge in enterprise management and superior level of problem solvingExcellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate with senior marketing leaders and C-level executivesProfessional attitude and service orientation; team playerWillingness to travel internationally Proficiency in English and Spanish What You'll DoYou will provide a distinctive level of subject matter expertise on how to architect and deliver marketing technology and data strategies that accelerate customer acquisition and customer value by increasing customer engagement and personalization.You’ll have the opportunity to work directly with consulting teams to conduct assessments of client capabilities and performance, playing a significant role in team problem solving through the findings and insights from diagnostics and assessments. Additionally, you will drive the strategy and solution development for specific components of the tech stack, and you’ll guide clients on technology solution choices, selection criteria and vendor trade-offs.You will also contribute to defining the implications to the client operating model, new roles and org implications, and define operating processes.Who You'll Work WithYou’ll work with McKinsey Digital based in Madrid.McKinsey Digital brings together the best of firm's digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on the modernization of the marketing technology and data stack, advanced measurement and analytics, and the intersection of technology and the marketing operating model.You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm. You’ll work with colleagues from across the firm to help our clients deliver breakthrough experiences to unlock value in new ways driven by data and technology. You’ll also have the opportunity to plug into exciting large scale marketing and digital transformations.Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

You will also be in charge in the analysis of the risk assessment, and proposal of corrective measures as well as advising on protection measures.You will ensure compliance with regulation on PRL and will be responsible for the coordination of business activities (CAE – Coordinación de Actividades Empresariales) for client and providers by updating the documents timely, guaranteeing the office is fully compliant with the regulation.Who You'll Work WithYou will be based in our Madrid office as part of the Location Management Team overseeing Madrid and Barcelona offices.To support you in your daily work, you will have a close working relationship with both HR team and office services team in ensuring initiatives related to health and risk prevention are well planned and implemented.

description: En TELHEMA, distribuidor oficial de Orange España S.A., buscamos personas ambiciosas que quieran incorporarse en un gran proyecto de distribución de Orange Empresas en la provincia de Gerona. Qualifications8+ years of combined hands-on software and client-facing experience within larger scale Big Data projects such as migration and IT transformation, e.g. data lakes migration, re-platforming to different platform warehouses, working across stakeholder groups, etc.Experience in multiple database technologies such as, traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL) distributed processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR), MPP (AWS Redshift, Presto, Athena, Teradata), NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra), graph (Neo4J, Titan)Experience with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secure solutionsData governance, data lineage, data quality and master data management expertiseTrack record of leading a workstream and managing a small team on Agile projects; ability to work well in a team environment Avid follower of the fast moving data technologies landscape with the ability to pick up and learn new technologies and tools Extensive experience leading technical workshops with clients to co-create architectures and solutions (built on various cloud infrastructures such as MS Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, etc.) creating on-premise data lakes in the client data center to centralize all information from different platforms Willing to travel to clients' sites up to 50-60% of the timeProficiency in English and SpanishWhat You'll DoYou will be a go-to expert for designing and building big data platforms at scale.In this role you will be part of high impact strategy projects involving technical strategy definitions and implementation for our clients. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topicsYou will provide strategic direction, design and drive architecture and implementation planning for our clients, and act as Big Data/Cloud evangelist, educating McKinsey's and Client's teams on Big Data/Cloud Architecture topics.You will work with our clients to model their data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches. Alongside with the team and the client, you will define the technology stack to be provisioned by the infrastructure team.This is a hybrid client-facing/technical role using state of the art technologies, whilst also being able to communicate complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences. Collecting clear requirements is a key part of this role and will define the technical strategy the team employs in the study.Who You'll Work WithYou'll join our Madrid office and be part of McKinsey Digital. This group brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.Our office culture is casual with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

description: DescripciónCuando estás mirando el horizonte de una ciudad o las rejas en los últimos automóviles y camiones, es probable que estés viendo nuestros productos. problema y buscando la causa raíz de este.Te responsabilizarás de las alertas de calidad externas realizando metodología 8D para la resolución.Coordinaras los problemas de calidad diarios de la instalación junto con los técnicos creando canales fluidos de información.Realizaras análisis individualizados del scrap para buscar soluciones robustas e individualizadas para cada con los hitos definidos en el plazo acordado.Colaboraras estrechamente con los proveedores en el desarrollo de los nuevos productos.Deberás proponer e implementar acciones de mejora para mejorar los resultados de la instalación tanto en rendimiento como en utilización.Deberás mantener actualizada la base de datos de aplicación.Deberás mantener y actualizar el ERP con los datos de la producción de la instalación de pintura.Deberás mantener actualizada la documentación relacionada con el proceso de pinturaRequisitosExperiencia previa de al menos 3 años trabajando en instalaciones de pintura, description: Summary of the roleIT Operations Engineer has a key role to manage operations for Bespoke applications:  application deployment, environments implementation (Production, Staging and Tests), incident/change/problem management as well as optimization and automation by applying devops practices. Be part of a worldwide Operations team (Fluent English mandatory). Will be involved in the Bespoke applications migration project to AWS cloud.Main responsibilitiesThe IT Operations Engineer will:  * Plan & coordinate Product releases rollout on the different platforms  * Plan & coordinate client data loads & deployments  * Coordinate activities in order to ensure diliveries on Production on target dates but also to assure all developments are in compliance with Production stability and security.  * Provide accurate and in time information to all teams involved or dependent of releasing process  * Respect releasing processes and procedures, maintain them and seek for improvements whenever possible  * Able to propose industry standard automation tools for deployment, monitoring, alerting  * Analyze internal requirements for development of new or improvement of existing internal tools.   * Design technical solutions and perform feasibility studies.   * Write and maintain procedures for support and deployment  * Be able to produce KPIs on server activities, support, etc.  * Align deployment process for all Bespoke (BSS) deployment centers and platforms  * Collaborate with BSS team to make sure that the development strategy is in-line with the deployment automation needs  * Enhance and standardize the support and incidents reporting processes along the different regions and customer types  * Provide first level support to the team in case of any network or system problem on internal platforms If needed participate to onsite missions and working together with customers IT department to secure the solution delivery in the best efficient way.

description: DescriptionWho Guardian industries is?When you are looking at the skyline of a city or the grids on the latest cars and trucks, you are probably looking at our products. SRG Global ™, a Guardian Industries company, manufactures automotive equipment products that define a vehicle's DNA and help to improve fuel efficiency. And above all, we make the ideas, formulas and processes that make these products possible. 18,000 people work to make products that improve people's lives! For more information, visit our website at https://www.guardian.com.SRG Global Liria is looking for, a SUPPLY PLANNER.What You Will Do In Your RoleOur organization is currently seeking a Supply Planner to help manage our supply chain operations. In this role, you will coordinate with our demand planning and procurement teams to optimize inventory and encourage asset utilization. You will develop and execute our supply plan, determining priorities and implementing strategies to reduce out-of-stock and over-stock issues. You will also help manage our production schedule, taking into consideration the forecasted demand for finished items and our raw material needs. Applicants should have a bachelor’s degree in supply chain management or logistics as well as data modeling and materials planning experience.Maintain a long-term production schedule/plan, taking into consideration the needs forecasted by our demand planning teamMonitor monthly and weekly production plans, prioritizing certain work ordersTrack inventory levels at our retail distribution centers and allocate product as neededTrack inventory of raw materials and advise our purchasing teamMonitor movement of materials through purchasing, storage, production, and retail distributionSet preferred stock levels and prevent excess inventoryThe Experience You Will BringRequirementsBachelor’s degree in supply chain management, logistics, or a related field (master’s degree a plus)Experience in production planning, supply chain planning, or logisticsData modeling and analysis experienceMaterials planning experienceStrong analytical, organizational, and communication skills
