Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.Right now, we are on the lookout for talented Java Engineers to join our Elasticsearch - Distributed Systems team and focus on critical features that affect how Elasticsearch scales and provides reliability to our users. This team maintains critical components of Elasticsearch such as snapshot/restore and replication. You can be based (pretty much) anywhere in the world.What You Will Be DoingPushing the limits on the number of shards, nodes, and petabytes that Elasticsearch can handle todayEnsuring users can reliably backup and restore Elasticsearch at scaleBuilding and enhancing fundamentally hard features such as cross-cluster replication or a changes APIProviding enhanced capabilities for data management Look into all kinds of issues, including performance or concurrency issues, and propose solutions.Supporting our support engineers with the harder problems.What You Will Bring AlongYou have strong skills in core Java and are conversant in the standard library of data structures and concurrency constructs, as well as newer features like lambdas.You have a deep technical proficiency in algorithmsYou have proven your ability to understand and work on complex, highly distributed systems.You are able to take on projects and guide them from beginning to end. This covers both technical design and working with other engineers to develop needed components.You demonstrate the ability to build and debug features with a broad impact on a product and that run on multiple machines.Bonus points for knowledge of:Data storesSearch, analytics, LuceneStrong knowledge of the JDKAdditional Information - We Take Care of Our PeopleAs a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leaveDifferent people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. If you require any reasonable accessibility support, please complete our Candidate Accessibility Request Form.

description: ¿Te apasiona la gestión de proyectos y el mundo de las nuevas tecnologías?En ALTEN SPAIN estamos buscando Business Managers para hacer desarrollo de negocio en el sector público, en proyectos de IT para nuestro equipo de Madrid.Idealmente buscamos a una persona con cierto conocimiento técnico y experiencia en gestión de proyectos.Un poco más sobre nosotros:Alten es una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español. Con más de 37.000 empleados repartidos en 28 países, ALTEN continua su crecimiento siendo uno de los socios de referencia de las principales compañías de ingeniería y TIC.¿ Y qué hace un Business Manager?Como Manager tendrás una visión 360 del negocio, encargándote de la gestión económica de tu propia unidad de negocio. Se podría decir que serás el eje que articula la relación entre el consultor, la empresa y los diferentes departamentos transversales que permiten a ALTEN desarrollar su actividad con éxito.Las funciones que realizarás serán:· Gestión de tu unidad de negocio y del equipo.· Gestión de ofertas, acuerdos y negociaciones.· Gestión de costes y presupuestos: análisis de la rentabilidad de los proyectos, gestión del P&L.· Determinación de necesidades de personal.· Selección y contratación de consultores.· Gestión y liderazgo de equipos.¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?ALTEN ofrece un ambicioso Plan de Carrera con diferentes fases en función de la consecución de objetivos donde apostamos por la promoción interna.Para potenciar este Plan de Carrera, lo complementamos con un Plan de formación continua.Si te gustan los retos, esta es la mejor oportunidad para desarrollar tu carrera profesional en una compañía en la que el límite lo pones tú.¿Te apetece este nuevo reto?
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información

description: QualificationsMaster's degree and excellent academic record Initial professional experience in strategic purchasing and/or supply managementExceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Mobile and excited to take on longer international assignmentsMobile and excited to take longer international assignmentsAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and in SpanishWhat You'll DoYou’ll work with colleagues and clients from a wide range of business areas across Europe to develop purchasing strategies that support clients' business objectives and give them a competitive edge.In this client-facing role, you’ll play a key part in driving process improvement, delivering successful business results, and developing broad based strategies for a diverse set of clients. Examples of the type of work associated with this role could include driving strategic sourcing to capture value, defining new operating model by optimizing Source-to-Pay processes through digitally-enabled procurement transformation programs, designing new organizational structure and reporting relationships, and/or instituting rigorous governance and performance-management methods.In addition to working directly with clients, you will also collaborate with colleagues worldwide to build and shape our expertise and approaches to purchasing and supply management optimization, continually developing your own knowledge as well as that of the firm.Your application should be in English and include a cover letter, your CV, and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.) indicating all relevant grades.Who You'll Work WithYou’ll be working with McKinsey’s Operations practice and will be based in Madrid.Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.Our Procurement group is part of our Operations practice, providing clients with support and advising their management teams on strategic and operational questions such as global sourcing, e-procurement, supplier development, and the formation of purchasing organizations.You will be part of our Operations Excellence Program (OEP), a two-year training program during which you will acquire the necessary knowledge to help companies achieve excellence in their operations. Along with other members of the OEP community, you will dedicate one day every other week to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts.
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información ,Software,Servicios financieros

description: The Enterprise Account Executive team at Stripe works to help some of the largest and fastest-growing businesses in the world take advantage of Stripe. You’ll lead and coach high-performing sales executives, helping them deliver on ambitious targets, as well as roll up your sleeves to work directly with prospective Stripe customers.We are looking for a self-starting leader who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a high-growth environment, and solving complicated problems with limited oversight. Ideal candidates will have management and leadership experience scaling a technology sales team, superior communication skills, and a knack for understanding unique customer needs.In This Role You Will Recruit, train and lead a team of sales professionals Build new processes and sales plays for a growing Digital Native & Enterprise business Develop the long-term vision and strategy for the team and manage day-to-day operations, with a focus on performance against key sales metrics. Be accountable for increasing revenue and new client acquisition at high rates of growth. Coach and guide the team in developing consultative and solution-based sales skills through all facets of the sales cycle. Play a personal and direct role in building and maintaining enduring customer relationships, up to C-level. Inspire, motivate and enable personal and career development of team members, both to promote career growth and to increase impact for Stripe. Work collaboratively and cross-functionally across the organisation to help shape Stripe’s products and solutions to meet customer needs. We Are Ideally Looking For Someone With 10+ years of sales experience and 5+ years of people management experience. Demonstrated experience leading sales in a high-growth technology environment. Ability to hire, train and coach a high-performance sales team. Ability to build strategic executive relationships with customers and industry thought leaders. Demonstrated passion for helping to scale new technology businesses. Ability to understand and articulate technical concepts, and translate them into industry- or business-relevant terms. Nice To Haves Prior experience leading a team in an international office of a US HQ’d company.  Prior experience in the payments industry.

description: QualificationsBachelor’s or master’s degree with a strong record of academic achievement6+ years of experience in project management consulting and/or project implementation (e.g. in a project management office (PMO) in the context of transformation projects)Experience in conducting workshops and coaching sessionsParticular functional (e.g. lean management, process optimization and agile management management) or sector expertise is a plusDriven by creating long-lasting impactMotivation towards the flexibility and agility that is required in a consulting environmentFluent and effective communicating in Spanish and English (verbally and in writing)Flexibility to travelWhat You'll DoYou will lead the design and implementation of client´s transformation plans and delegate project workstreams to execute wide transformation programs such as operational improvements, KPIs implementation, process improvement, etc.In this role, you will be the leader of the project. You will manage the workshop and implementation content, lead the implementation process stages and lead the project team including consultants and senior clients. You will also coach and motivate your team of consultants and client employees in each project.Who You'll Work WithYou will be based in our Madrid, Spain office as part of Orphoz, where our mission is to carry through the most complex transformation projects for our clients.You will join a team of consultants and transformation execution experts where we combine the advantages of a start-up - light hierarchy, autonomy, freedom of expression and initiative – and those of a large group – available resources to develop one’s projects and logistical support.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategorySalesJob Details MuleSoft Account Development Representative - Israel market LocationMadridDo you believe that good is the enemy of great and strive to be the best version of yourself?MuleSoft’s high impact Account Development team is looking for highly motivated and strategic players to join us in pushing the limits of outcome-based selling. As a MuleSoft Account Development Representative, you will lead our Sales organization to the highest quality, quantity, and velocity of strategic pipeline through deep discovery and research, engaging and inspiring prospects towards the path of success in the budding API economy.The RoleOur Account Development Representatives fuel the revenue engine for MuleSoft -- creating new opportunities with a best-in-class software sales team through collaborative account planning and engagement with C-Level and Executive stakeholders in Fortune 100 companies.Your goal will be to apply pipeline generation skills to identify and prospect new customers in medium and large sized companies. With a customer centric approach, you will qualify their business goals and identify how MuleSoft can help them.Working with Account Executives and cross-functional teams, you will create and prioritise target account lists within your defined territory, identify and generate new business opportunities and, through in depth qualification, progress the pipeline through the sales funnel as well as become a Social Selling Expert.Working on the Account Development team here at MuleSoft provides ample opportunity to explore various roles outside of BD, including outside sales, Customer Success, Services, and Technical Pre-Sales, and with a historical promotion rate after 2 years of 61% outside of the core BD role, this is your chance to launch your career in enterprise software sales.What We Are Looking ForWhile hiring the next generation of talent at MuleSoft we are looking for people who share our 4 Core Values; Trust, Customer Success, Innovation & Equality. We look for people of character, who keep their promises and bring an amazing attitude. We look for smart people, who can understand others, communicate effectively and get things done. Above all we look for individuals that are motivated to build their sales career here at MuleSoft.In the ADR role, you will do well if you have experience in business development and/or outbound prospecting, if you love a challenge, working in target driven environments and succeeding as part of a team. We are seeking someone who is not afraid of prospecting and speaking to customers on the phone as well as making sure you are up to date on the newest technologies and industry trends.Fluency in English and Hebrew as well as valid working visa for Spain are required for this role.The OpportunityAt MuleSoft, as part of Salesforce, we strive to create a workplace where everyone can bring their full, authentic self to work and not feel they have to leave a part of their identity at the door. In particular, we welcome applicants who are confident that they have what it takes to develop a successful sales career.Advantages / Benefits IncludeWorld-class training, development and mentorship in the areas of professional growth and product knowledgeConstant learning and knowledge sharing with some of the best complex selling professionals in the industryChance to work in a dynamic, fun and challenging environmentHealth Insurance and Pension contributionsA monthly wellbeing subsidy of £100- Annual education budget of £5,000 to spend on your career developmentAdditional 7 days paid time off for charitable causes (1-1-1 model)World class training bootcamp in San Francisco (virtual for now)Maternity & paternity benefits (parental leave, childcare support, fertility and adoption program, etc)Opportunity to be part of the Salesforce’s employee-led and organised Equality Groups helping to drive innovation and social responsibility (We have 12 Equality Groups, including the Salesforce Women’s Network, Abilityforce and more. Learn more here .)Shares purchase planLearn more about our commitment to Equality and how we are working to create a diverse workplace that reflects society: Salesforce/Equality .Accommodations  -  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.Posting StatementAt Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategorySalesJob DetailsThe TeamThe EMEA Industry Business Development (IBD) team supports sustaining strong growth across 11 key industries, by enabling our sales teams to better speak the language of the industry (rather than Salesforce products). The team combines strong thought leadership with an entrepreneurial drive to get things done and a highly collaborative mindset. We work with our internal sales leaders to shape alocally relevant industry strategy - and engage with senior stakeholders at our customers and prospects to execute it.While we are an EMEA team, we interface closely with our HQ.The RoleAs the EMEA Travel, Transport & Hospitality IBD Lead, you will be responsible for delivering the following four pillars of the playbook, from strategy to execution, in order to advance the maturity of the industry and enable high double digit ACV growth:Industry Thought Leadership & Expertise: Complement our global sales plays with impactful, locally relevant industry points-of-view and value propositions(incl. industry trends, challenges, Salesforce solutions and customer references). Manage the Industry Boards(senior cross-functional group setting industry strategy).Act as a trusted advisor to sales leadership.Industry Demand Generation: Coordinate structured and programmatic demand generation activities, working with the extended Salesforce machine of fieldmarketing, partners, sales programs and inside-sales. Concrete levers includepresentations at 3rd party events, organising C-level round-tables and defining impactful sales programs.Your ProfileStrong analytical background, ideally at a Tier 1 strategy consulting firm to an Engagement Manager /Project Leader level, or significant investment banking/PE/VC experienceTravel, Transport & Hospitality industry experience preferred, but not requiredMBA preferred, but not requiredEntrepreneurial spirit and confidence to pick up and lead new projectsExperience in dealing with senior stakeholders; strong networking and influencing skillsAbility to lead and influence extended teams without formal reporting-line authorityAbility to take a practical approach to business developmentWilling to travel (inside EMEA) to support on-going activities, key opportunities (post-COVID up to 30% of time)Good communication, and ability to present complex industry concepts internally (e.g., to Sales teams) and externally (in front of senior client or at events)Fluency in English is essential and any additional European languages are a plusAccommodations  -  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.Posting StatementAt Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Our innovative cloud platform gets accolades from press around the world, but it’s the dedication to helping our customers succeed that's made us one of the world’s largest software companies. The company is thriving under the guidance and leadership of some of the brightest minds and most experienced executives in business and we’re now looking to expand further.A key focus of this expansion is within the Public Sector, where we’re working with organisations globally to create the Government of the Future by redefining how their mission intersects with technology. description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details  We are looking for a passionate people leader with exceptional expertise in building, growing and coaching high performance Solutions Engineering teams for Specialists and Architects in SEMEAReporting to the Leader for Solutions Engineering SEMEA, you will be leading the Solutions Engineering Specialists and Architects organisation across all industries with your management team.As a key member of the SE SEMEA leadership team, you will work closely with the sales leadership and their sales teams in Salesforce to ensure the Solutions Engineering teams are optimised to drive our strategies and growth plans in the region.You Will Be Instrumental In Engaging, Managing And Closing Strategic Deals, Where Salesforce Is Striving To Deliver Business And Data Transformation To Our Customers' Long-term Sustainable Success And Demonstrate a Commitment To Our Core Values Trust Customer Success Innovation EqualityYou are a Forward Thinker, Thought Leader with a passion for our Salesforce Products, Architecture and Digital Transformation and the value it brings. Pivotal to this will be your understanding of industry trends and market opportunities to engage with CXOs in transforming their organisations and providing strategic counsel to CXOs and executives within the data landscape. This will include the ability to advise CXOs and executives on strategies for data transformation, data culture, industry trends and digital innovation in a compelling and engaging fashion. You have numerous examples of bringing new thinking to customers, your team and your current company.You will guide, advise, and support your team of Solutions Engineers in deal shaping , sales partnering as well as manage team resourcing, coaching and career planning. You are instrumental in leading the team through change, scaling, and bringing together the various SEs to work as one team. Being a senior leader of this Solutions Engineering team, you will also be responsible for developing our managers to be our future leaders, and ensuring that there is an effective succession plan.Who You AreThe successful candidate has the breadth and depth of experience in solution and value-based selling, having deep relationships with C-level executives and track record of selling data transformation and wall-to-wall solutions at the C-level.You have demonstrated success in building and managing a high performance Solutions Engineering organisation with a will to win, and continuous improvement, and the ability to evaluate, develop and reshape an existing team as necessary while mentoring and inspiring the team.Additionally, you have a track record of success in the following areas: Exceptional Leadership. An experienced leader who has developed and led managers and individual contributors in the software industry, preferably from a presales/Solutions Engineering perspective or related customer facing functions. Demonstrated success in mentoring and inspiring a Solutions Engineering team to focus on innovation, employee & customer success to drive growth.Stakeholder Management. Proven collaborator and relationship builder up to C-level across multi-functions. Ability to effectively manage internal and external stakeholders to drive results.Technically Astute. Strong background in Solutions Engineering in the enterprise software industry, with a passion for technology, preferably in the data and analytics space – Business Intelligence, ETL, Analytics, AI/ML, CRM, Big Data, Data Science and Enterprise Architecture.Strong Communicator. Excellent verbal, written communication, and presentation skills.Adaptable and Transformational. Used to working in high growth, matrix organisation where you have influenced, led and driven change, taking the business to the next level through disruptive thinking and innovation.Data Driven. A highly passionate data advocate with strategic and analytical skills in using data to measure and drive effectiveness and performance.Key ResponsibilitiesHire, Develop, Retain. Lead and grow the Solutions Engineering Specialists & Architect team ensuring we continue to hire and retain top talent in the market, providing career growth opportunities, developing our next-gen leadership and effective succession planning.Leadership. Partner with sales leadership to provide strategy and support for business development, accounts development, pipeline generation and deal management. Ensure each SE is enabled, empowered and accountable to deliver high quality work and excellent customer experience.Focus on Innovation. Ensure the team is constantly improving our approach to solution and value-based selling. Drive strategic initiatives and programs as needed to actively drive growth and support the teams career development and advancement.Executive Engagement. Develop and deliver outstanding Analytics Vision, Point of View and Value Proposition to all levels of an organisation including CXOs and executive management. Build and nurture C-level relationships across key accounts to solidify our partnership and commitment to the customers, while penetrating deeper within accounts.Core Values. Embody Salesforce values and provide exemplary leadership. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org.Salesforce welcomes all.

description: QualificationsMaster's degree (“Licenciatura”) in finance, economics, business administration, actuarial or engineering obtained within the last 4 yearsPrevious experience in the insurance industry is an advantageStrong experience in Excel and PowerPoint; advanced software knowledge (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau, etc.) is a plusExcellent problem solving and analytical skills Strong interest and ability to collect, analyze and synthesize data Ability to work collaboratively in a team environmentSkills to communicate complex ideas effectively and in a structured mannerFluency in Portuguese, Spanish and English (spoken and written); other languages like German, French and/or Dutch is a plusWhat You'll DoYou will develop a strong understanding of the insurance industry, products, players and functions in Europe with a special focus on Iberia.In this role, you will be involved in client development activities, knowledge creation support and internal and external reputation building initiatives. Through project-based work and collaboration with colleagues, you will deal with new intellectual challenges daily and improve key management skills like problem-solving, communication structuring or effective team working, among many others.You will also be responsible for presenting results of your research to consultants at all tenures, while getting their always constructive feedback in a recurrent way in order to help you in your development. You’ll have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues.The offer is for a period of 6-24 months depending on the candidate's availability.Please note that your CV should be in English.Who You'll Work WithYou will work in our Barcelona office as part of our Panorama Financial Institutions and Insights Consulting (PFIC) - Insurance Client Capabilities Network (CCN) team. You will support a C&I specialist and a C&I expert directly in serving Iberian insurance clients.During your internship, you will work and collaborate on a daily basis with both consultants and members of our PFIC team of multiple markets across the globe with special relevance of European colleagues.You will feel part of a much broader team, always accessible to support you and provide you development opportunities in the firm.
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información ,Software,Servicios financieros

description: About FTI ConsultingFTI Consulting is a global business advisory firm, dedicated to helping organisations navigate and manage a diverse range of complex issues and business challenges. Our expertise covers the spectrum of Corporate Finance & Restructuring, Economic Consulting, Forensic & Litigation Consulting, Strategic Communications and Technology. We are a company of more than 4,600 professionals with annual revenues in excess of $1.8 billion, with offices located in every major business centre in the world.Our professionals are some of the most experienced leaders in their fields, and advise across a range of industries. Our clients engage us for high-stakes concerns or emerging opportunities that require specialised expertise, and over the past two decades we have been engaged to work behind the headlines on some of the biggest news stories to date.FTI Consulting is a fast growing and vibrant place to work. Steered by our values of Integrity, Creativity, Achievement, Empathy and Respect, its meritocratic culture invites both collaboration and healthy debate. We are large enough to be trusted by our clients to solve their biggest issues and yet small enough to know our colleagues on a personal level enabling better team working and a supportive culture to develop your career goals and ambitions.About Technology:Our Technology practice helps clients manage the risk and cost of e-discovery. From forensic data collection to fully managed document review services we collaborate with our clients to deliver strategic solutions tailored to their unique legal requirements. With keen focus on the productivity and defensibility of document review, clients rely on our comprehensive portfolio of software and services expertise and address matters ranging from internal investigations to large-scale litigation with global e-discovery requirements.About the Role:This Consultant position is a part of FTI Consulting's E-discovery Consulting and Digital Forensic team. From the Technology segment we are in the position to deliver to our clients a large portfolio of services which includes the application of a comprehensive computer forensic methodology which includes the Identification, preservation, processing and analysis of ESI in order to present evidences for all purposes that can be used in any kind of litigation or internal investigation, in addition, following a partnership with Relativity, we are able to provide clients with the combination of E-Discovery wide experience and our own flagship web-based document repository, Ringtail.As part of the Madrid based team, the Consultant will be cross-trained in various Digital Forensics and E-discovery skills and will assist on all phases of our projects.Key Responsibilities:You will be part of a cross-functional team that manages all areas related to the identification, collection, extraction, migration, processing, analysis, conversion, quality assurance, tracking, and management of client data. This could involve: Liaising with clients and project managers regarding client requests and manage expectations. Utilise industry standard and bespoke software to access, extract and handle data from phones, mobile devices, computers and storage media, following forensic standards, on-site, at client premises, around Spain and abroad. Use of worldwide recognised tools to preserve data maintaining in all times the corresponding Chain of Custody, ensuring data integrity during all phases. Utilising industry standard and bespoke software to access, extract and cull data from electronic evidence sources. Assuming responsibility for day-to-day data processing, conversion, analysis, quality control, import and other specialized tasks including interaction with other consultants, supervisors, and client personnel. Co-ordinating closely with colleagues within and across teams to manage the delivery of client requirements. Being customer-service-oriented to meet client deadlines, including working out of business hours when necessary. Travelling as required to ensure effective management of case activities. (Minimal notice possible). Education and Qualifications: Minimum 2:1 degree in law or a technology focused subject such as computer science, forensic computing or information systems, or equivalent experience. Fluent in Spanish and English is required.Skills and Competencies: Technically savvy with a strong proficiency in Microsoft Windows and related software, especially Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.). Self developer that demonstrates an ability to solve complex problems with well thought out innovative solutions. Ability to manage time and prioritise tasks effectively. Ability to work effectively as part of a team and support the team's goals above individual goals. Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while handling multiple tasks through completion. Good communicator who can perform in a client facing role. Flexible with working hours and has the ability to work in a cross-functional team. Experience: Familiarity with personal computer and server hardware, operating systems and software, possibly having some experience of working in a computer forensics, e-Discovery or technology related role or university project. Familiarity with forensic principles and technologies. Desirable knowledge and experience in the use of Computer Forensic tools such as Encase, Nuix, FTK, UFED, Oxygen Forensics, BlackBag, among others. Knowledge of and experiencing in configuring and operating Ringtail, Relativity or any other e-discovery tool as a document review management application desirable . Use of Concordance, Summation or Introspect desirable. A good understanding of transact SQL and relational databases desirable. Knowledge of data manipulation, data conversion, and data analysis activities in a SQL database and MS Access desirable. Familiarity with email server software (Microsoft Exchange, Lotus Notes) desirable. Knowledge of programming (Python, Java, Visual Basic, PowerShell) desirable. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información ,Software,Servicios financieros

description: Do you have an appetite for all things Food & Beverage? Are you as keen as mustard where service is concerned, whilst ensuring back of house is in order - whether it be a plate full of numbers, setting a rota or laying the table for a successful team. Then why not come and join us at the Radisson Hotel Group to Make Every Moment Matter! where our guests can relax and enjoy the experience!Our Food & Beverage Service Team are sophisticated hosts with an instinctive ability to anticipate guests’ needs by being in the right place at the right time and delivering a hospitality experience that goes above and beyond - creating memorable moments for our guests.As Food & Beverage Supervisor, you will join a team that is passionate about delivering exceptional service where we believe that anything is possible, whilst having fun in all that we do!Interested then why not say Yes I Can! as we are looking for passionate people just like you!Key Responsibilities of the Food & Beverage Supervisor:Supports the smooth running of the food & beverage department, where all aspects of the guest food & beverage service experience are delivered to the highest levelsWorks proactively to improve guest satisfaction and comfort, delivering a positive and timely response to guest enquiriesDelivers on plans and objectives where food & beverage initiatives & hotel targets are achievedSupervises the food & beverage team fostering a culture of growth, development and performance within the departmentAccountable for ensuring that costs and inventory are controlled, that productivity and performance levels are attainedBuilds and maintains effective working relationships with all key stakeholdersTakes the lead to deliver departmental programmes that advance service standards, profitability and cost controlEnsures adherence and compliance to all legislation where due diligence requirements and best practice activities are planned, delivered and documented for internal and external audit, performing follow-up as requiredRequirements of the Food & Beverage Supervisor:Experience in food & beverage serviceStrong supervisory and managerial skills with a hands-on approach and lead-by-example work styleCommitment to delivering exceptional guest service with a passion for the hospitality industryAbility to find creative solutions with proven problem-solving capabilities offering support where requiredPersonal integrity, with the ability to work in an environment that demands excellence, time and energyExperience of working with IT systems on various platformsStrong communication skills Fluent in spanish and englishCAREERSJoin us in our mission to make every moment matter for our guests and be part of the most inspired hotel company in the world. At Radisson Hotel Group we believe that people are our number one asset. As one of the world’s largest hotel companies, we are always looking for great people to join our team. If this sounds like an ambition you share, then start with us.To find out more about the Radisson Hotel Group, our Culture and Beliefs, then why not visit us at careers.radissonhotels.com.
industry: Hostelería

description: Thrive in the dynamic and challenging environment of a contract development and manufacturing organization. Driven to excel through self-leadership and thriving team engagement. If this describes you, then look no further than LSNE. We have the experience, expertise and a successful track record in completing development of life-changing pharmaceuticals and medical devices. Together with our clients, we work to bring about treatment of many forms of cancers, Diabetes, communicable diseases, and many other illnesses. Come make a difference. Your work will matter and your contributions will be significant in these endeavors. Join our team!FunctionsPerform their duties following quality criteria, health and safety standards. Carry out the functions of their position in accordance with the Behavioral Values established by the company. Work in accordance with GMP regulations. Report the work done and the needs of the Microbiological Quality Control department to the person in charge of the quality unit. Supervision and control of the work performed by the personnel under their charge. Administration and control of the department's resources and materials. Preparation, review, approval and control of the GMP documentation generated in the microbiological quality control laboratory. Maintain updated GMP documentation that applies to the microbiological quality control laboratory. Verification and management of new monographs and updates in Pharmacopoeias. Management, investigation and participation in the actions of the quality events detected in the microbiological quality control laboratory: results out of specifications (OOS), out of trend (OOT), deviations, Change Controls (CC) and Preventive Actions and corrections (CAPA), claims, rejections and withdrawals. Verification and monitoring of the execution of environmental and personnel controls to ensure microbiological control in the different areas. Management, review and monitoring of clothing qualifications for entry to classified rooms. Supervision and control of staff behavior in classified and unclassified rooms. Initial and continuous training of the Microbiological Quality Control Laboratory staff, in the different instrumental techniques and procedures that apply. Coordinate, together with the staff of the Quality Control laboratory, the calibration, verification and maintenance of the department's equipment. Supervision and maintenance of the organization and cleaning of the laboratory. Supervision and interpretation of microbiological results. Preparation, review and evaluation of trends generated in the microbiological quality control laboratory. Management and defense during internal and external audits (clients or competent authorities) as well as visits that take place within the Microbiological Quality Control laboratory. Collaboration with the quality assurance department for the establishment of corrective and / or preventive action plans. Preparation of the necessary documentation for registration processes and collaboration in answering deficiency letters. Report the department's KPls according to the established frequency. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.
industry: Servicios médicos,Biotecnología,Industria farmacéutica

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details Due to the continued growth of our public sector sales teams we are now seeking a proven leader to manage and grow our Public Sector sales team across EMEA. This role reports into the Senior Vice President, Sales, EMEA.The AVP, Public Sector leader will lead the broader EMEA public sector team, will be able to articulate the value of cloud computing to government, and has a proven track record of direct sales and sales management success in software or technology consulting across Public Sector verticals of Government, (Local & Central), Education and Health. An extensive network of senior government relationships will be required to support both the delivery of our Tableau values and growth with EMEA Government customers.What’s in it for you?This is a high growth opportunity working with our Global Public Sector Business Unit that will see you at the forefront of new technology on the market leading Tableau Platform. With a business culture that has the customer’s interests at the core of everything we do, Tableau will set you up for success.Responsibilities Lead the go to market strategy for the EMEA Public Sector market to achieve high levels of both revenue growth and customer success.  Second line leadership of Regional VP’s across EMEA.  Accurately manage the sales forecasting process for the assigned territory.  Lead and coach the team to achieve/exceed their annual sales quotas by thoroughly qualifying all leads and sales opportunities and to leverage business from new and established relationships.  Partner closely with the Tableau and Salesforce teams and contribute positively across the functions.  Work closely with our Tableau and Salesforce Partner ecosystems in support of our developing and delivering Tableau solutions.  Assist the Account Managers to drive strategic initiatives into the targeted communications accounts.  To lead and coach strategy development and execution, negotiations and close business. Minimum Qualifications At least 10 years in a senior direct sales management role.  Consistent over-achievement of quota, revenue goals, and delivering revenue growth.  Experience in application software sales to enterprise and public sector customers.  Demonstrable experience in building successful sales teams.  Knowledge of the Analytics/BI industry ideally, along with its value to Public Sector  Strong commercial skills and experience.  An extensive network of senior government relationships across a variety of Government accounts. Desired Skills Background working in the IT Software industry, ideally within Analytics/BI arena;  Experience in enterprise software sales, with a strong preference within Public Sector  Experience in IT Consultancy and Advisory services.  Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. description: Spain | Remote | Work from Home |¿Amas los datos? ¿Vives en espania? ¿Quieres trabajar de forma remota? ¡Sea parte de este equipo!Why you?Are you a Mysql DBA who lives in Portugal? Do you want to work remotely? Are you community minded? Do you blog, contribute to the Open Source community? Are you inspired by ever-shifting challenges, constant growth and collaboration with a team of peers who push you constantly to up your game? At Pythian, we are actively shaping what it means to be an open-source database engineer and administrator, and we want you to be a part of the world’s top team of MongoDB, Cassandra, PostgreSQL and MySQL professionals.What will you be doing?As a MySQL Database Consultant (DBC) you will work as part of Pythian's open source team and supply complete support for all aspects of database and application infrastructure to a variety of our customers. Our collaborative Mongo environment means everyone works together to solve complex puzzles and develop innovative solutions for our customers. You'll work closely with the customer teams to understand their needs, in both a project based and long term support capacity.You'll create and document database standards, create optimized queries, indexes, and data structure.Monitor and support database environments and serve as an escalation point for complex troubleshooting and interactive production support.Use database vendor provided tools and Pythian developed accelerators to performance tune various database system, specific queries and applications scenarios.Diagnose and address database performance issues using performance monitors and various tuning techniques.Identify areas of opportunity and recommend appropriate improvement suggestions.Cross-functional training in NoSQL, Site Reliability Engineering and DevOps methodologies are encouraged.When you're not fixing things, you'll be authoring new blog posts on interesting topics for our open-source community to digest, creating new articles in our customer facing knowledge base for more frequently seen issues, and hosting webinars amongst other things like participating in conferences and meetups promoting Pythian to the open source community.What do we need from you?While we understand you might not have everything on the list, to be the successful candidate for the MySQL DBC job you are likely to have skills such as;Knowledge and experience in installing, configuring and upgrading MySQL databases & tools relevant in MySQL Administration. Experience administering PostgreSQL in virtualized and cloud environments, especially AWS, GCP or Azure.Experience with scripting (bash/python) and software development (C++, Java, Go) Automation technologies such as Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Chef, SALT experience.Debugging skills and the ability to troubleshoot methodically, identifying and applying fixes for known errors, and when necessary, capacity to think outside of the box to resolve complex issuesVery good documentation skills.Our perfect candidate would also have strong knowledge with prior production experience of PostgreSQL alsoNice to haves include; Understanding of current IT service standards such as ITIL. Being a contributor to Open Source projects relevant to PostgreSQL, MySQL or other database or infrastructure software.Por qué elegir Pythian?Utilizamos las últimas tecnologías y metodologías y ofrecemos:Salario y beneficios competitivos.Un entorno que inspira la innovación.Horarios flexibles que permiten el equilibrio entre trabajo y una vida sana.Programas de incentivo diferenciados (certificaciones, entrenamientos, indicaciones, etc.) ¡Sea parte de este equipo!Why PythianPythian excels at helping businesses use their data and cloud to transform how they compete and win in this ever-changing environment by delivering advanced on-prem, hybrid, cloud and multi-cloud solutions to solve the toughest data challenges faster and better than anyone else. Founded and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada in 1997, Pythian now has more than 300 employees located around the globe with over 350 clients spanning industries from SaaS; media; gaming; financial services; e-commerce and more. Pythian is known for its technology-enabled data expertise covering everything from ETL to ML. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver innovative solutions that meet the specific data goals of each client and have built meaningful partnerships with major cloud vendors AWS, Google and Microsoft. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today’s rapidly changing digital economy. If you are a MySQL Database Consultant; live in anywhere in Spain; love your data and want to love your career then join us!DisclaimerFor this job an equivalent combination of education and experience, which results in demonstrated ability to apply skills will also be considered.Pythian is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.Applicants must be legally authorized to work in their country of residence permanently– Pythian will not relocate, sponsor, or file petitions of any kind on behalf of a foreign worker to gain a work visa, become a permanent resident based on a permanent job offer, or to otherwise obtain authorization to work.No recruitment agencies
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información

description: Job DescriptionBuscamos gente como tú: ¡Que disfrutas de tu trabajo, aceptas retos para llegar más lejos en tu carrera, te sientes orgulloso de pertenecer a una compañía Top Employer , te gusta el trabajo en equipo y colaborar con tu experiencia para que todos seamos mejores en nuestro día a día!¿Quieres recibir formación en últimas tecnologías y tener la posibilidad de certificarte de manera gratuita?¿Quieres trabajar en un ambiente dinámico, con proyectos de gran envergadura aplicando tecnología de última generación y trabajar en equipo con profesionales de primer nivel?SkillsEn estos momentos estamos interesados en incorporar en nuestro equipo de Software Engineering en Madrid o Sevilla a un Technical lead con al menos 4 años de experiencia en las siguientes skills Analisis y desarrollo de tecnologías con .net Core Javascript y css AngularLas condiciones que te ofrecemos en Avanade son las siguientes: Horario que te permitirá conciliar vida laboral y personal. Participación en proyectos importantes para clientes de primer nivel nacional e internacional. Una atractiva remuneración compuesta por un salario bruto anual y un programa de beneficios corporativos y retribución flexible.Te esperamos: ¡Avanade es tu compañía!About AvanadeAvanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 29,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. We welcome all, and seek talented individuals who can bring their whole self to work, build inclusive teams and encourage diversity inside and outside the organization. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

At Pythian, we are actively shaping what it means to be an open-source database engineer and administrator, and we want you to be a part of the world’s top team of MongoDB, Cassandra, PostgreSQL and MySQL professionals.What will you be doing?As a MySQL Database Consultant (DBC) you will work as part of Pythian's open source team and supply complete support for all aspects of database and application infrastructure to a variety of our customers. Our collaborative Mongo environment means everyone works together to solve complex puzzles and develop innovative solutions for our customers. You'll work closely with the customer teams to understand their needs, in both a project based and long term support capacity.You'll create and document database standards, create optimized queries, indexes, and data structure.Monitor and support database environments and serve as an escalation point for complex troubleshooting and interactive production support.Use database vendor provided tools and Pythian developed accelerators to performance tune various database system, specific queries and applications scenarios.Diagnose and address database performance issues using performance monitors and various tuning techniques.Identify areas of opportunity and recommend appropriate improvement suggestions.Cross-functional training in NoSQL, Site Reliability Engineering and DevOps methodologies are encouraged.When you're not fixing things, you'll be authoring new blog posts on interesting topics for our open-source community to digest, creating new articles in our customer facing knowledge base for more frequently seen issues, and hosting webinars amongst other things like participating in conferences and meetups promoting Pythian to the open source community.What do we need from you?While we understand you might not have everything on the list, to be the successful candidate for the MySQL DBC job you are likely to have skills such as;Knowledge and experience in installing, configuring and upgrading MySQL databases & tools relevant in MySQL Administration. Experience administering PostgreSQL in virtualized and cloud environments, especially AWS, GCP or Azure.Experience with scripting (bash/python) and software development (C++, Java, Go) Automation technologies such as Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, Chef, SALT experience.Debugging skills and the ability to troubleshoot methodically, identifying and applying fixes for known errors, and when necessary, capacity to think outside of the box to resolve complex issuesVery good documentation skills.Our perfect candidate would also have strong knowledge with prior production experience of PostgreSQL alsoNice to haves include; Understanding of current IT service standards such as ITIL. Being a contributor to Open Source projects relevant to PostgreSQL, MySQL or other database or infrastructure software.Por qué elegir Pythian?Utilizamos las últimas tecnologías y metodologías y ofrecemos:Salario y beneficios competitivos.Un entorno que inspira la innovación.Horarios flexibles que permiten el equilibrio entre trabajo y una vida sana.Programas de incentivo diferenciados (certificaciones, entrenamientos, indicaciones, etc.) ¡Sea parte de este equipo!Why PythianPythian excels at helping businesses use their data and cloud to transform how they compete and win in this ever-changing environment by delivering advanced on-prem, hybrid, cloud and multi-cloud solutions to solve the toughest data challenges faster and better than anyone else. Founded and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada in 1997, Pythian now has more than 300 employees located around the globe with over 350 clients spanning industries from SaaS; media; gaming; financial services; e-commerce and more. Pythian is known for its technology-enabled data expertise covering everything from ETL to ML. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver innovative solutions that meet the specific data goals of each client and have built meaningful partnerships with major cloud vendors AWS, Google and Microsoft. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today’s rapidly changing digital economy. If you are a MySQL Database Consultant; live in anywhere in Spain; love your data and want to love your career then join us!DisclaimerFor this job an equivalent combination of education and experience, which results in demonstrated ability to apply skills will also be considered.Pythian is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.Applicants must be legally authorized to work in their country of residence permanently– Pythian will not relocate, sponsor, or file petitions of any kind on behalf of a foreign worker to gain a work visa, become a permanent resident based on a permanent job offer, or to otherwise obtain authorization to work.No recruitment agencies
location: Valencia/València, Comunidad Valenciana / Comunitat Valenciana, España
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información

description: Buscamos a un candidato con ganas de trabajar, experiencia en un puesto similar de venta y recomendación activa de dermocosmetica, aromaterapia, productos naturales, productos de micronutrición. Imprescindible inglés y se valorarán otros idiomas ( Ruso, chino, francés, alemán).Formarás partes de un equipo multidisciplinar con muy buen rollo de trabajo!Envia tu C.V. a hello@farmaciaprincesabcn.com.

QualificationsMasters degree and excellent academic record Previous experience in operations, e.g. implementation of lean manufacturing concepts or Six Sigma, digital manufacturingExceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Mobile and excited to take on longer international assignmentsAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and in SpanishWhat You'll DoYou will work in teams of consultants providing expertise in engineering and manufacturing, helping clients to achieve new performance highs.In this role, you will make an important contribution to the analysis, design, and implementation of lean manufacturing and management approaches, developing tailor-made solutions and working closely with clients to ensure positive impact and sustainable results.In addition to working directly with clients, you will also share your experience and insights with colleagues internationally, thereby expanding our knowledge and refining our approaches in the field of lean management.Your application should be in English and include a cover letter, your CV, and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.) indicating all relevant grades.Who You'll Work WithYou’ll be joining our office in Madrid and working with McKinsey’s Operations practice in Europe. Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.Our Manufacturing service line is part of our Operations Practice and helps leading companies in all industries develop and implement future-oriented lean manufacturing strategies. Our clients include leading companies worldwide from a wide range of industries. We offer their managements support and advice on strategic and operational questions relating to Manufacturing.You will be part of our Operations Excellence Program OEP), a two-year training program during which you will acquire the necessary knowledge to help companies achieve excellence in their operations. Along with other members of the OEP community, you will dedicate one day every other week to functional training and knowledge development under the leadership of our operations experts.
industry: Servicios y tecnologías de la información ,Software,Servicios financieros

description: Busco personas líderes , con ambiciones y sueñosGrandes.Acá ñas horas de trabajo y el sueldo te lo Pones tu, dependiendo cualesSean tus objetivos. Asociados a la empresaMás seria a nivel mundialDelNetworking. RequisitosQuiera divertirse y viajar trabajando fuerte Sea perseverante Y te ha sueños claros.Desde laParte del mundo que estes, tengo un plan para vos!
El supermercado necesita un cajero para trabajar. Salarios altos y condiciones de trabajo dignas.Dias libres: sabado, domingo.

¿Has nacido para vender? ¿Eres una persona alegre y dinámica con excelentes habilidades interpersonales y de comunicación? Alcanzar tus metas nunca es suficiente para ti, ¿siempre quieres superarte? ¿Convencer a la gente es un don natural para ti? ¿Buscas un ambiente joven, multicultural, motivador y en crecimiento? ¡Fantástico! Estamos buscando a alguien tan motivado, apasionado y talentoso como tú!En Bodas.net buscamos un/a nuevo/a compañero/a para nuestro equipo de Sales España como Sales Account Manager para Bilbao.Para nosotros, la persona ideal aporta experiencia en ventas B2B y en la gestión de un porfolio de clientes, además tiene buenas habilidades de escucha, comprensión de las necesidades de los clientes y fuertes competencias interpersonales. Nos gustaría contar con una persona apasionada por la venta y el mundo digital, que conozca los principios y nociones fundamentales de marketing digital y pueda ofrecer a nuestros clientes un servicios digital de calidad.¿En qué consistirá tu trabajo? Tu zona de trabajo será Bilbao y tu trabajo se realizará en Home Office con desplazamientos en calle Estarás a cargo de la apertura de nuevo negocio a través de visitas presenciales a los clientes del portal. Serás responsable de la gestión de cartera de clientes B2B, ofreciéndoles un servicio de gran retorno y precio asumible a las empresas del sector nupcial (masías, restaurantes, etc). Asegurar la fidelización de nuestros clientes gracias a un servicio personalizado  Se ocuparás de la negociación, seguimiento y cierre de las condiciones contractuales con los clientes ¿Qué buscamos en ti? Experiencia demostrable de 3 años o más en un puesto similar Residencia en Bilbao Experiencia comercial, preferentemente en venta de servicios a clientes B2B Ser un/a excelente profesional en negociación Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y persuasión  Gusto por el trabajo con objetivos y la consecución de los mismos  Estar en posesión de vehículo propio Posibilidad para desarrollar tu trabajo en HomeOffice ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte? Posición estable desde el primer día Salario fijo y variable Seguro médico privado gratis al año de tu incorporación Subvención para formaciones Retribución flexible (Ticket Restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería) Reembolso de gastos Km's y gastos profesionales Teléfono móvil y ordenador portátil NUESTRO EQUIPO - Somos un equipo joven, creativo y absolutamente apasionado. Este es el secreto de nuestro éxito: trabajamos duro, aprendemos cada día y sobre todo amamos nuestro trabajo. Nuestro entusiasmo es contagioso y se transmite a nuestros futuros novios, a las empresas y a todos los protagonistas que participan con nosotros en esta increíble aventura.NOSOTROS - Bodas.net es el portal líder a escala global en el mercado virtual del sector nupcial.Formamos parte del grupo multinacional The Knot WorldWide, creado para ayudar a los futuros novios a organizar el día más importante de sus vidas. Gracias a nuestra presencia internacional, hemos creado la comunidad nupcial y el mercado de bodas virtuales más grande del mundo. Somos un equipo global de más de 1.700 personas y trabajamos en 16 países y 3 continentes. #WhatWeDoMatters
industry: Marketing y publicidad,Software,Internet

description: WHAT WE DO MATTERS:Here at Bodas.net (The Knot Worldwide) we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life’s milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we’re there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:We are looking for a highly motivated engineering leader with a passion for leading teams to create elegant and scalable software for our users. The right person will have a proven track record delivering engaging, consumer focused products within a data driven, agile environment. In this role you will lead a talented engineering team, partner with product development, and actively participate in both tactical and strategic conversations to determine the evolution of our products.The Knot Invitations is an exciting new line of business for The Knot Worldwide and we are making significant investments in our offering. This role has significant growth opportunity and visibility to stakeholders including the CEO, CPO, and CTO. The Engineering Manager for this team will work cross-organizationally to drive technical architecture vision and be a strong partner to product and design to establish OKRs and set technical vision to achieve business objectives.RESPONSIBILITIES: Oversee an engineering team responsible for our Invitations product vertical.  Ensure the team is operating effectively to reach their goals, are properly supported and deliver quality software. Evolve our platform into a sustainable architecture that supports iterative and fast development. Develop, coach, and mentor multiple engineers at various stages of their career to ensure growth and cultivate emerging leaders. Provide leadership within the team to ensure solutions are built in alignment with company principles. Actively participate in Agile ceremonies including pre-IPM, IPM, standups, and retros. Partner with product and design to plan and deliver OKRs. Actively participate in establishing the broader technical and product strategy that supports our company goals. Partner with Principal Engineers and Architects to set the vision and create the tech roadmap to effectively operate this product and platform. Formulate and proactively look for opportunities to improve the overall effectiveness of the teams. Collaborate with the broader zone and company on key technical initiatives. SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS: Have 7+ years of proven industry experience with 3+ years of experience leading engineering teams. Deep understanding of distributed system design utilizing both relational and non-relational data stores. Experience working within an Agile based environment. A track record of shipping successful consumer facing products. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable managing multiple work streams and coordinating resources across teams and products. Thrives in a collaborative work culture with teammates located in-office or remote across multiple locations in the US and abroad. Knowledge of A/B testing software and techniques is a plus. The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability.

description: Marketing Intern – Italian MarketAbout the jobThis is a paid marketing internship position that will support the Marketing team for Le Mini Macaron with Italian market activation. INTERESTED CANDIDATES SHOULD SEND CV AND COVER LETTER (ENGLISH ONLY) TO CAMELIABEAUTYJOBS@GMAIL.COM. DUE TO HIGH VOLUME OF APPLICANTS, ONLY THESE SUBMISSIONS WILL BE CONSIDERED. NOTE: POSITION IS BASED IN BARCELONA AT OUR OFFICE (THIS IS NOT A REMOTE WORKING POSITION). Key DutiesWork directly with social media manager in activation and day-to-day management of Italian social media platforms.Daily social media engagement with Italian Le Mini Macaron community and the Italian nail, fashion and beauty industry.Assist with Italian community management; answer questions and concerns on our Italian Instagram and Facebook.Assist with Italian PR: influencer pitches and follow up, press releases, research and press clippings.Assist with Influencer/PR mailers preparation and shipment.Engish-Italian translation as needed. The ideal candidate has the following qualities and experience: Marketing school degree with a strong creative backgroundExcellent written and oral communication skills in Italian and English. Spanish will be a plus.High-level knowledge of the following social media platforms: Instagram, Tik Tok, Facebook and Pinterest.Creative and aware of all social media trends.Comfortable appearing on camera.High attention to detail, organized, and the ability to multitaskQuick learner and adapts to a fast-paced environmentSelf-motivated and good time managementSense of urgency and good time management skillsPrior experience in beauty preferred DurationMinimum 6 months, full timeAbout Camelia BeautyCamelia Beauty is a beauty start-up that was originally created 8 years ago in Shanghai. We are a young, dynamic and international company that has created the brand Le Mini Macaron, which is sold in Sephora, ULTA, ASOS, Galeries Lafayette, La Rinascente, Urban Outfitters, Feelunique, and other beauty retailers and department stores. Our brand has been featured in such leading media as Elle, Marie Claire, Cosmopolitan, Glamour, Teen Vogue, Refinery 29, PopSugar, NYLON, and many others. We are looking for dynamic, creative and motivated individuals to join our team. www.leminimacaron.com / www.leminimacaron.euInstagram: @leminimacaron#leminimacaron

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Team OverviewThe Office of Ethical and Humane Use (OEHU) was formed with a mandate to ensure that Salesforce technology is used to help, not harm, society and uphold the basic human rights of every human being.OEHU is seeking a Senior Manager/ Director to play a pivotal role in the development of product policies around the Ethical and Humane Use of Salesforce Technology and serve as the EMEA lead for our Office. Working together with the Chief Ethical and Humane Use Officer and policy team, they will deliver product policy recommendations and implementation strategies across Salesforce that shape the use of our technology in alignment with Salesforce’s ethical use principles.Role OverviewThe ideal candidate will have Trust & Safety and/or product policy experience within a technology company. They will have an understanding of the potential societal repercussions of emerging technologies and familiarity with principles that can be used to govern and resolve related ethical issues. You will engage regional stakeholders to capture and integrate a wide range of perspectives into our product policy making process The candidate will have strong research experience and analytical skills to gather facts, assess patterns and recommend a path forward. You will work with Legal, Product, and Security teams to implement solutions to assure our technology is used for good.Job ResponsibilitiesIncorporate research and stakeholder expertise to craft new and/or update existing product use policies that focus on the ethical and humane use of Salesforce technologies.Act as a regional point of contact for the Office of Ethical and Humane Use and maintain close working relationships with senior stakeholders across the business to ensure alignment in applying product policy principles and addressing ethical risk in international markets.Coordinate with Global Strategy teams to identify and assess ethical product use in international markets.Collaborate with Product teams to craft product-specific policy applications and automation tools.Conduct investigations, enforce our product policies, and identify product vulnerabilities and ethical risks.Stay informed about the dynamic global regulatory landscape, industry trends, and internal operations. Help Ethical and Humane Use team quickly make sense of large volumes of information to determine how global events may impact the use of Salesforce’s platform and its customers.Minimum Requirements7+ years of relevant work experience in Trust & Safety, Product Policy, or similar roles in a technology company.Experience working on topics across diverse international markets.Preferred RequirementsDemonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and juggle competing priorities.Demonstrated cross-functional team influence.Strong analytical ability-- able to take a complex problem, synthesize detailed information from multiple sources, and construct nuanced top-line recommendations on the path forward. Ability to consider an issue from multiple points of view and weigh the merits of all perspectives.Strong communication skills-- comfortable presenting ideas to diverse teams and individuals in multiple formats, from slide decks, memos, to informal chats. You know that a huge part of communication is listening and making sure others feel heard.Product policy writing experience- ability to assess the pros and cons of various policy options and their potential unintended effects and pitfalls.Strong understanding of the ethical challenges related to diverse communities in interacting with technology.Project management experience- Measurable success in running complex programs from conception to completion. Ability to manage multiple competing projects and maintain high degree of organization.Fluency in English and other European languages.Strong awareness of geopolitical landscape. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. We are currently recruiting high-energy, driven Account Executive with relevant experience in Software or IT Solution sales, value-driven sales approach. Ideal candidates should possess strong B2B sales and account management experience and a good knowledge of clients in Spain. Salesforce offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be provided the tools, resources, and outstanding leadership to sell business application solutions. These individuals are committed to winning, but also benefit from seasoned leadership and an incredible, loyal and passionate customer base ideal for up-selling and cross-selling our growing suite of Cloud Computing applications and platform.Job Details Learn Salesforce award winning products, platform and value proposition Work in partnership with our team of Business Developers, Pre-sales and marketers for all sales leads and sales opportunities Drive a high volume of sales by managing the complete sales process on an assigned territory Assigned to Mid Market accounts in Spain Up-selling and leveraging business from new and established customer relationships Strengthen client relationships through regular engagement and face-to-face meetings Managing industry events and user groups to generate market interest Attend industry recognised sales training programmes Further development of sales techniques through our Sales Academy, Bootcamp and Sales Productivity teamsRequirementsfor the Role 5 years Technology sales experience (preferably Software or Business Applications) Solid sales forecasting abilities and revenue achievement Successful history of net new business sales ideally with Mid-Size Customers A background in inbound and outbound prospecting and closing of new business Consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals Fluent in Spanish and EnglishAbout SalesforceSalesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.
